reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for toddler', 'author': 'Berr', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got it for my young adventurer who is almost two, great quality and easy to use and clean', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good', 'author': 'Ashley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easily hang taking off plastic on new mirror so satisfying would buy again', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not as big as I thought', 'author': 'Jamie', 'rating': 1, 'content': "This mirror is easily adhesive easy to put up but once again NOT as big as I thought it would be doesn't even look right on the back of a door because its so small so I put it on a wall by the bed", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Cheap quality', 'author': 'David Connolly', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Cheap quality mirror reflects unevenly and cracks very easily because the backing is not stiff. But generously gave 3 stars considering the low price. 8”x8” is pretty small, too, so think about that.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars As pictured, works well.', 'author': 'Tara', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I will start by saying that 3 out of 4 panels were great. The mirror is a tad distorted, but would have worked well for the reason I bought it. This was purchased as a cheap/safer option for my baby's nursery to play with during tummy time. The adhesive is great, mirror is plastic so I am not concerned about shattering, and the edges are rounded. My review stars were based off of the reasons listed. My one problem was that the top panel had a deep cut taken out of it, possibly from a box cutter in the factory? There were no cuts on the packaging, so I am unsure how it happened. This was disappointing as I would need all 4 panels to make a square and did not feel comfortable leaving a sharp cut within baby's reach. However, customer service responded very quickly and refunded what I spent so I am not upset! I ended up making a tall rectangle with the 3 remaining panels and called it a day. Good product, you get what you pay for. Even better customer service!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfectly safe mirror if you worry about glass ones', 'author': 'Allie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was super easy to install. There are so many options on how you can arrange the little squares. It can be a nice decorative mirror, or just a practical back of the door full-length mirror. The 4 panels that it comes with are just right for that. Which is all I wanted. And the best part, my giant dog knocking herself into the door, won\'t break any glass if it happens to knock one loose. But so far, it seems to be sticking very well.I believe I got the 8" panels, and I\'m not a small girl. So, they\'ll most likely be good got anyone. I intentionally raised the camera to not show my face.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "2.0 out of 5 stars (Return Review- Pros and Cons) Don't look in the mirror!", 'author': '@HobartAdventures', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter. She put them up and was like "MAAAAAHHHHHMM!!! You have to return these mirror tiles! It\'s like I\'m looking in those mirrors at the fair on that thing you walk through." And it did!!! They made us look 3x larger (width wise) than we actually are. We\'re average size I\'m 5\'3, shes 5\'5. My husband thought we were kidding and was making jokes until he stood in front of it and was like "DAMN! These even make me look fat." He\'s 6\'3 and 220#The stickies they give you, are out of this world! They deserve 500 stars! We removed them with heat and it STILL ripped the paint off, and the drywall paper off clean down to the gypsum.Honestly, I love mirrors. I thought these were going to be perfect and I would have kept them if I was going to use it to bounce light around my dark house. I have nowhere to put them though. I have a million other ideas for them, just not good as an actual mirror you\'d use on the daily to get ready with.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality', 'author': 'YOE', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Smaller than I expected because I didn’t read the description. Overall a great product', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Much smaller than it looks', 'author': 'Amie Hanley', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I was excited to get this for my teenage son to put on the back of the door so he would have a full-length mirror without spending a bunch on it. The pictures on this listing make the mirror squares look much larger than they are. Look at the sizing before purchase to ensure they are what you expect. Overall though, they have been sturdy on the back of his door.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Awesome', 'author': 'MyDogIsMyLife', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is actually an awesome product. It's cheap but functional as a short term or temp solution.Mirror quality isn't the best but for the price and portability it's worth it. Use these while apartment hopping and vanlifing when I need a full mirror and none are around. Not being glass is beneficial to me and the lightweight allows me a portable folding mirror. I basically attached them together with ribbon and gorilla glue on the back so can unfold the mirror down(like a ladder) but travel with it compact.So these are cheap but also awesome - if you want a super nice mirror then would aim for glass. This is perfect for travel.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Glass Full Length Wall Mirror Tiles, 14'' x 12'' x 4PCS, Full Body Mirror for Bedroom, Full Length Mirror Wall Mounted for Home Gym, Door (14'' x12''-4PCS)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic', 'author': 'GC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The product came in immaculate condition. The instructions were clear and it was easy to install. Word of caution : please mark the area with a pencil where you actually want to stick it and make sure the wall is even and plain. The sticker and glue is super strong and slight up and down will make it impossible to take it off unless you want to destroy it. The warping issue which most of them complain can be taken care by leaving a minor gap between the glasses. Overall as quite happy and satisfied with the product for the price and quality', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy Breezy and Beautiful', 'author': 'Chaim', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These mirrors come packed perfectly and with super easy instructions too. Had them up in minutes and they look wonderful. Lite weight but great quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great option for a fraction of the price!', 'author': 'Fuchsia Angel', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought two 24 packs of the 12"x14" mirror tiles for my home gym project, which gave me an 8\' wide x 5\' tall mirror. It\'s not perfect (pros and cons below), but I still love it and am very satisfied with this purchase!Pros: 1) I love that I was able to build a giant mirror for only about $180 (after buying 3m Command Strips as an alternative installation option). 2) Easy and cheap shipping (they come in a very small box). 3) Easy install (with 3m Command Strips you can remove the tiles and put them back up as many times as needed to get it perfect). 4) Modular and scalable you can set them up in any configuration or shape you want and expand/add more later. 5) If you move to a new place, you can take them with you (just buy more Command Strips). 6) The tiles look like real mirrors. 7) Speedy delivery.Cons: 1) Distorted image or gaps between tiles. If you put them right up against eachother the cracks distort the image. If you put a small gap between them it looks better but then you have tiny gaps. With the 3m Command Strips, I was able to do lots of trial and error to get the most seamless mirror possible, but it\'s still not absolutely perfect. 2) The sticky stuff they provide (glue and double sided sticky foam) will ruin a wall if you need to remove them (see other reviews). This is where the 3m Command Strips come in. I got the "small" size and cut them in half, putting one in each corner of every tile, and haven\'t had a single issue. These added about $40 to my total project cost, but is well worth it for the ease of installation, removal and moveability.All in all, I would go this route again if I ever have to set up another home gym on a budget. It is a very affordable and easy way to have a huge mirror. You just have to decide if you want small gaps between tiles or a fun house effect along the edges, which still beats spending a thousand dollars on a giant heavy mirror in my opinion. I went with the funhouse option, but it doesn\'t bother me when I think about how much money I saved.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wall mirror', 'author': 'Amber Lea', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This mirror is amazing. I had no mirror in my bedroom. Easy to put up. Looks great. I would recommend and I'm picky.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lovely, and great customer service', 'author': 'Ross J.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to put up using command strips, and didnt crack when I had to pull them off to reposition. One of my 16 was chipped, they promptly sent me a replacement even though I did not get a chance to open and install til outside my return window. I will likely be ordering more now!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Supersede my expectations', 'author': 'Iesha Taylor', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My daughter picked these out and I was afraid they were going to look for/feel cheap when we receive them. However, I was completely wrong! These are so heavy and it is a real mirror. It comes in four pieces so you can style them as you want on the wall, but she just wanted them straight down like a full length mirror.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars They’re alright —- not the best, not the worst', 'author': 'Savannah London', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I had higher expectations for these. When they’re lined up like I have them, they definitely are a bit distorting. I think they would be good in a different orientation. Easy to apply to the wall— didn’t have problems with that, I’m just personally not a big fan of how they look.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Looks nice', 'author': 'Andria', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Got for my daughter and it looks nice. Easy to put on wall and sticks well. Unsure though if have to take off the wall eventually if move if they would come off good. One came chipped a little bit in corner but I guess it’s whatever. Not highly noticeable. My daughter though accidentally sat on one when it was on bed before I put up and it broke in half! Sucks! But accidents happen. Just put the other 3 up. I’ll probably order more eventually to add to the 3 on her wall now and use 2 or 3 squares of them for myself and my room eventually,', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Mirror, Bad Mounting Method (See Recommendation)', 'author': 'Nebraska Joe', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The aluminum mounting brackets and yellow sticky adhesive stickers are awful. Instead, I recommend using a “J mold mirror mount” to support the bottom of mirror and plastic mirror clips for the top (to keep it from tipping forward). See my photos of bracket and clips from the orange big box store. I also took photos comparing a J Bracket to the flimsy one that comes with the mirror (which wedges the mirror flush against a wall … unless your wall is perfectly flat, you’re in for trouble if you use the supplied bracket). Trust me, this will eliminate the warping, distortions, and heartache mentioned in other reviews.Secure the J bracket to studs (16” apart in most homes so I found 3 or 4 for my 48” J bracket). You can supplement with 1-2 drywall anchors. You will need to drill a couple holes in the aluminum J bracket to line up with your studs. Use a 1/8” drill bit on the bracket and 13/64” bit for the drywall anchors from my photo. The screws that come with the mirror are 1-inch #8 wood screws 1”. These are not quite long enough to go deep enough into studs (get your mind out of the gutter and read on). Instead, pick up 1 1/4” wood screws instead (also #8) to secure the J bracket to the studs. Pick up and 1 1/2” #6 for the mirror clips if you want to hit a stud for those (optional, drywall anchors enough for mirror clips). The mirror rests in the channel of the J bracket and allows play so your mirror stays straight!)Hope this helps. You will not needy adhesive if you use the J bracket on the bottom (cradles the mirror in the channel) and clips at the top. Don’t mess with glue, command strips, etc)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Happy', 'author': 'Bryan H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This product is too notch. Packing was very secure, everything was intact on arrival. Instructions for installation are very simple and easy to follow. I installed 4 panels in about 45 minutes for our home gym. I would definitely purchase again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: deweisn Dresser Mount Tri-Fold Lighted Vanity Mirror with 21 LED Lights, Touch Screen and 3X/2X/1X Magnification, Two Power Supply Modes Make Up Mirror,Travel Mirror
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Convenient travel mirror', 'author': 'CSG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is great little mirror. It’s the perfect size for travel and very light weight. I like that it has both the option to plug it in with a micro USB cable or 4 AAA batteries for power. The lighting is very bright, almost too bright at times. While the unit is very light, it seems well made. You do have to tighten the screw where the mirror connects to the stand, to keep it at whatever angle you want. I didn’t see that as a big deal.I do wish the mirror could be adjusted to be higher or lower (even a little), but for the price point I’ll live with it. I bought this mirror during Prime Days at ~$24. I see it is still selling for that much. While I like the mirror, I wouldn’t pay the full price listed amount of $49.99.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect gift!!!', 'author': 'Created by AM', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect gift for a friend, daughter, sister, cousin! I got this as a last Christmas gift for a cousin of mine who is very entrepreneurial. I thought not only would this be a perfect addition to have for her skin cafe routines, but it would make a perfect “ring light” of sorts in even creating videos or content on today’s major platforms. So perfect for makeup/skincare but also perfect to use in your videos / content making! The lighting is perfect and the zoom features are next level to your typical vanity mirror. This is an upgrade!!! The design is aesthetically minimal, elegant, so cute. Perfect gift, perfect investment.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful mirror that adjusts angles easily', 'author': 'T. Jackson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Okay, first the con. Yes, this is a lighted mirror. There are tiny, bright LED lights all around the edge of the main mirror (none on the side mirrors). However, I find that they add more glare than light, but in a dim room, they may be useful. However, I wouldn\'t rely on the lighting on the mirror for things like color accuracy if you are putting on makeup. Here are the pros. First of all, it is just large enough to see your entire face easily, and it angles perfectly when I need to use it to dry and style my hair. The magnifying mirrors are located on the right--3x on top and 2x on bottom. The bottom mirror is somewhat awkward to (okay, there is another "con"), but I\'m blind as a bat so the larger magnification is more useful for me when I need do my eye makeup. For the size, the mirror is very light. I have a hand mirror that is half the size but actually weighs more. I ordered the mirror in rose gold, and it is a deeper color than most items that come in this shade. However, it is a beautiful color and the mirror is lovely enough to leave out on your table or counter. As for travelling---unless you have a very big purse or tote, I wouldn\'t really consider this something you want to carry around with you. However, the stand comes off easily, so the whole thing can be folded flat. It should fit nicely into my larger carryon--I don\'t think I want to put glass into a check-in bag, but you could if you wanted to pack it in a way that it is padded and protected. It did arrive in the mail in one piece, after all. I bought the mirror when the price dipped just below $20.00 and it is a very good value for around that price. For better, variable lighting, you should be expected to pay a lot more. However, I am very pleased with the mirror and it\'s great to be able to easily move the mirror in the needed position (not have to force it down or up with both hands) AND have it STAY that way (it doesn\'t move until you move it).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Super bright mirror!', 'author': 'Adrianna', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I like the vanity mirror however, I think it is a bit too bright for me and hurts my eyes. It is very small though and amazing for traveling. For the price, it is worth it if you don't mind it being too bright.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bright lights, and easily portable. Good mirror!', 'author': 'B.T. Lockridge', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great mirror. Easily portable and it has a touch light that is on the large middle mirror that is very bright and useful when powered by the USB cable. I have tried it with batteries as well (especially when I misplace the cable or am not near a plug-in/outlet) and the lights are not even half as bright as when it is plugged into an outlet. But that’s been the case for many different lights and electronic items that I have owned, so it’s not the mirrors fault by any means. The mirror is great and can be adjusted to a number of angles and degrees. The magnification in all the mirrors is crystal clear and quite wonderful if you ask me. I love the way it closes when not in use and it’s pretty compact so it can be stored away until needed. However the base/stand is an oval shaped bottom and I find myself more often Then not tipping the mirror over backwards due to the length and weight of the top of it (I want to literally lay it horizontal at times, and I can’t because it will just tip backwards. Every time. ) I understand why it does it and I admit it’s a little rare to find someone who wants to tilt it back as far as I do, but that doesn’t take away from the fact that it honestly tips over and that I honestly believe it would be more stable and secure if the base was a square or rectangle and a little bigger in comparison to the degree at which it can tilt. Anyways, wonderful mirror, perfect image, beautiful magnifications, and sleek design. Very portable, useful, and lightweight. Basically exactly what I was looking for. Thank you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good LED Desk Mirror', 'author': 'JD', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this for my teenage daughter who was begging for a vanity style mirror. The rose gold looks exactly like the picture in the advertisement. The product functions exactly as intended/ described. The lights are bright, clear and work well. The lights can function using batteries or wall plug which is nice. There are 2x and 3x mirrors provided. The mirror is light and travels easily. No complaints regarding this product. Daughter loves it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice mirror', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mirror is a great addition to my morning routine. Makes it easier to put on my makeup.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Given as a gift', 'author': 'Andrea G', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I gave this as a gift to my daughter. She loves it. Can run off batteries or plug in. 3 settings for the lighting. Fits perfectly on a desk and is very easy to pack with for travel', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Too short for me', 'author': 'Christy R', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This would be a good mirror if you’re sitting at a vanity, but since I stand at my bathroom counter to do my makeup it is too short for me. The height is not adjustable, only the angle.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars I don't use the lights really", 'author': 'Paloma Hakela Aviles', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's functional and does everything it says it will do but the lights are so dim even on the brightest setting but I kind of expected it with the price so I still think it's worth it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: JUSRON 360 Viewing Angle Self Hair Cutting Mirror, Clear Anti-Fog HD Glass (Black Without LED, Without Accessories)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great design', 'author': 'Terese', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I use this mirror as a portable way to see all angles of my head. It does not light up, so no comment on the brightness. It is as bright as the room your in. It hooks on any door, including my mirrored closet doors. It adjusts up and down and the sides open and close to any angle you need. It's durable yet packs away nicely. I use it all the time to do my hair. I highly recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Quality.', 'author': 'Imani Pretty AF🦋', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Make sure to take the film off. After i took the stickers off i didnt realize the film was still on it. Scratch a tiny corner and make sure the film is ACTUALLY OFF. Overall very pretty and useful.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Effective, easy to set up', 'author': 'Kai', 'rating': 5, 'content': "During the lockdown period of the COVID pandemic, all the barber shops were closed. My hair was growing to an uncomfortable length. I did what many did during that time - turn to the internet and DIY. I reasoned that if I wasn't going to be seeing much people in-person during that time, it would be OK if I messed up trying to cut my hair. I bought a set of clippers and off I went with a handheld mirror.Fast-forward 2 years later. Barbar shops are open, but I'm still cutting my own hair. I learned a few important things during this journey. The first is to buy a good clipper set. The second is to use plenty of mirrors. While you get eventually get proficient with using a wall mirror plus a hand mirror, being able to free your other hand and not having to constantly reposition the hand mirror would have made things a lot easier.As it seems I'll be cutting my own hair for a while, I decided to cave in and buy a tri-fold mirror set. It's a simple concept that I've considered buying my own mirrors and making this myself, but finding a good way to mount it and finding strong hinges to position the side mirrors made it too much effort to DIY the mirror setup.This mirror set is convenient because it's an all-in-one unit. The door mounts pivot out from the unit and are on telescopic rods (think of the old-school radio antennas). Hook it over the door (or whatever is your mounting source) and pull it down to the right height. Open up both panels of the mirror until it's at the best angle for you. The panels stay in place due to the friction on the hinge. It should allow you to see the part of your head behind your ears. For a full view of the back of your head, you'd have to position the panels parallel to each other and look direct at one of the panels.There's not much to fault this simple item. If anything, I'd love if the mirrors had some more height to them just to have more viewing surface, but that would mean the unit would be much bigger when folded.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Super handy for coloring and cutting your own hair', 'author': 'N. Tegeler', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Handy thing to have when you color and cut your own hair. It's sturdy/good quality. It was packaged well but still had a minor flaw and a tiny crack in two of the glass panels they are in a bottom corner and a top corner two different panels but won't effect my use. That's the reason for my 4 stars instead of 5.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lighting was great!', 'author': 'Lauren H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great for doing a haircut or just styling! A view from all angles and the lighting is bright which is also helpful !', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 3 way mirror', 'author': 'Jen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great mirror for doing haircuts so it works for me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars YESSSS!!!!', 'author': 'SugaRita', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got two of these 3 way mirrors. So first of all, I bought it to paint on it, so I didn\'t really care how great of a mirror it actually is. That being said, it isn\'t bad. I measured the dimensions and it is 10" x 12" (in fact, it\'s about an 1/8th of an inch larger in each direction), it is beveled, and it does appear to be glass (although I can\'t swear to this). It doesn\'t appear to be warped, it\'s definitely not just a reflective sticker (although the beveled frame might be a sticker, and is peeling on one of the corners—see pictures), it didn\'t arrive cracked (it had cardboard triangles covering the corners and was wrapped in plastic), and it is lightweight. It does appear to have a small black scratch somewhere on the glass, although it doesn\'t feel different, so I imagine it\'s not on the outermost layer. Basically, it\'s perfect for what I need it for, and it\'s a pretty great price. It also arrived promptly—I ordered it with Amazon Prime, so it was guaranteed to arrive in 2 days, and it arrived in 1. That being said, I received it a few days ago and unwrapped it today, so I don\'t know whether or not it\'ll stand the test of time. TBD!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 13, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars dented', 'author': 'Louise Cannon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This arrived to me with a dent in the metal right out of the package. Now... let's rip apart!", 'author': 'Classified', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So I wanted to make a mirrored cabinet for my workshop that stood over the laundry sink/tub in there. I didn't need anything fancy, and wanted it roughly a foot deep to hold first aid supplies and maybe a number of hygiene items. Also, you might see, I wanted a dry rack built into the bottom over the sink. This is where I eat my lunch at the workshop and I hand wash my dishes there.They don't make mirrored vanity cabinets cheap it seems, and also they don't make them any deeper than 4.5 inches. There was no way what I wanted even partially existed for any reasonable price. So, I had to grab my scrap plywood and spend half a day making my own.Of course I selected the mirror (best dimensions to what I wanted at the cheapest price/decent quality I could find) and didn't make the cabinet until after it arrived.It arrived as I hoped and met the standards for what this was meant for: hanging up on little hooks on the wall like a picture. Something like this would make sense in your entryway or mud room, so you check your hair or something before heading out, appearance wise after it's hung the standard version in walnut looks fairly classy and would work with most interior designs, I'm sure the other colors would work as well. The frame this plasticy/particle board wood stuff and the surface you normally see is smooth and impermeable to water from that side. You can lean in and look real close and it looks like very well polished wood, but when you feel it you can tell there's plastic or polymer in the frame. Not bad for the price actually.The problem was the hook mounting hardware that was in my way... And what's this? Brown craft paper glued on the back? Not a problem if this going up in your office or a guest bedroom I guess, but this was going over a drainage tub that I filled with gallons of hot water every few days. I didn't want steam to condense in there over time and have microbial growth as a result.Using this mirror in a bathroom, or near a stove (not sure why you want to check your reflection while stirring a boiling pot of macaroni though...) this might be a pad choice. This mirror isn't marked as a bathroom mirror, so I'm not going to hold it against them at all.This was a excellent opportunity to take it apart like a child with mild ADHD who found dad's toolkit and has been left unsupervised for over 20 minutes. Not much has changed in the last 15 years in that aspect of me being a legal adult...This was also a excellent opportunity to evaluate the quality of the mirror behind it's appearance.The screws for the hanging hardware on the backside were tiny and I had to use the small screwdrivers to get them out. I'm glad they didn't use exotic screws with triangles or star shaped bits. It was standard Philips head, just the small size. The screws were a pain to get out, they were quite stiff and each one took a lot of torque to remove by hand. While annoying for me, I can say that these hooks are going to stay on and not fall off under normal circumstances for you. So this is a win for quality actually despite the fact my fingertips were notably red and sore from gripping the screwdriver so tightly.Using the most dangerous tool in my workshop: the utility knife, and a pair of needle nose pliers, I cut and ripped the paper away in a corner to find corrugated cardboard filler glued underneath it. It was actually glued on pretty well at the edges to the frame. After ripping out a tiny piece I discovered it was about 3/4 of a inch of stiff cheap cardboard and then the black glossy backside of the mirror. I cut a large square out along the inside of the frame and was able to easily remove the cardboard filler which was lightly glue to the back of the mirror with a few squiggly streaks of hot glue.I assume the purpose of the cardboard filler on the back, other than being a cheap material that's easy to work with, is to act as padding on the back side to prevent the mirror from break if hit from that side, which would only be useful during transport I guess.The brown paper overlay that was glued to the frame was very hard to peel off. Given that it was only a inch wide going around the perimeter at this point I didn't think that I needed to remove anymore at this point. I did peel off the corners to see how they jointed the frames and found a metal zigzaggy bracket holding it together. I'm no sure how it actually worked or how it may have been installed, but it looked fairly sturdy considering that this was the cheapest mirror that met the dimensions I wanted.I used some gorilla glue and almost half a dozen pneumatically driven 18 gauge 5/8 inch staples to mouth it to thin ¼ inch scrap plywood for my hinged door. I chose shorter staples to not go too deep and hit the mirror by accident. The sudden “FWAP!” of staples at 120 PSI hitting the plywood and into the back of the mirror frame did not crack it. (Whew!) So it's also durable in that regard.The mirror is decent. I give it a 4/5. I say that I feel at $40 this is a little too much money for what it is, but then again I couldn't find cheaper for something around 16 inches by 20 inches. This is a $35 or $30 mirror if you ask me, but that's perhaps a bit nit-picky. By the way, the dimensions of the glass mirror itself is 17 inches by 13 inches, the frame is 20 inches by 16 inches. The frame is 1-1/2 inches wide around the edges, and it's 1 inch deep if you take off the hanging hardware on the backside.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Tc', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The bathroom mirror was just what I wanted. Fits and looks perfect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Mirror', 'author': 'Mert', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love how this mirror looks in the bedroom.The quality is good and the price was right.I was amazed at the quality of the frame too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Size matters', 'author': 'MovieMaven', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a well made, beautiful mirror, the size is perfect with a quality silver frame.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful Bathroom Mirror!', 'author': 'Edwin H. Holmes Jr.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We remodeled two bathrooms, and needed four mirrors. Home Depot has discontinued bathroom mirrors, and the mirrors available at Lowe's were all too large. Amazon had the perfect mirrors, and they were easy to install. The mirrors are high-quality, well-made, and are affordable. Amazon has saved the day, again. I highly recommend the mirrors. My cat was looking in the mirror leaning against the bed, while I installed the first mirror. She was lightly pawing, her reflection in the mirror. Now I need to order a small mirror just for her, and hang it on a wall at her height, just for her.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Mirror', 'author': 'Bininmi', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This mirror was the perfect size, color and matched my bathroom trim. It did come with a little yellow discoloration (glue I'm guessing) I used rubbing alcohol to remove prior to hanging. Paint was a bit discolored afterward.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Looks very nice, but very hard to hang and fairly flimsy construction', 'author': 'Susan R. Chalfin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Very nice looking mirror for the money. I found it impossible to figure out how to hang and didn't see any instructions. I brought it to a local frame store, and they put a wire in the back so I could hang it. The owner of the frame store said the kind of hanging method the mirror comes with is impossible for a non-professional to do. The construction is flimsy--cardboard back. But once I got the wire on, it looks fine, so it's a good deal for the price if you know how to hang it or can get a wire attached.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Folding Travel Mirror, PU Portable Adjustable Rectangular Ultrathin Mirror, for Travel, Camping,Home (4.3W×2.9L)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for my needs', 'author': 'Coco P', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'EFAILY Folding Travel Mirror, PU Portable Adjustable Rectangular Ultrathin Mirror, for Travel, Camping,Home (4.3W×2.9L) ($5.99)I had a small mirror that I dropped and accidentally broke. It does, however, stay in just about any tilted position simply because the pleather is so thick and stiff- There is no "double layer edging", I think they might mean the beveled edge- There is no such thing as an "HD" mirror but the one I got is quite clear (see my pic)- The edges are decently smooth but the corners are still corners and poky- I have no idea what "uniform transition" and "no strokes" is supposed to meanJust another foreign AliBaba reseller that just slaps in a bunch of words they think are English.Having said all that, it\'s a very decent mirror. It\'s thick and sturdy (see my pic). The cover is also thick and sturdy and water won\'t ruin it. The large stitching, much moreso than the listing pix, is child-like but straight and decent enough.I assumed this was plastic. I was looking for an unbreakable camping mirror, but it\'s good enough I\'ll keep at my desk for unexpected zit checks.5 star mirror, 4 stars for the ridiculous overhype, missing and poor info. I\'ll update if anything pops up but my initial impression is quite good.Don\'t forget to use the Smile.Amazon.com address - It\'s an Amazon program where many everyday things you buy will generate a small donation from Amazon to the charity of your choice at no cost to you. Info here: https://smile.amazon.com/gp/chpf/about/ref=smi_se_rspo_laas_aas', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel or at the office', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice compact slim size makes it easy to store, nice quality mirror, and the stand works great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Travel Mirror', 'author': 'Juanita M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Worth the price . reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Travel Companion - Sleek and Handy!', 'author': 'Kelly Coffin', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This compact rechargeable travel mirror has been a game-changer for me. Thin, and lightweight.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I would pay double, been looking for this for years!!', 'author': 'Tatiana', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I usually have the bulky 90s style lighted makeup mirrors but it's been hard to travel with.I've tried several travel mirrors but they're not that good. I hope they keep making these as I'm thinking about buying a second as a backup.One word of advice, make sure to bring the charger. It lasts a decent amount but not as long as I had thought. But LOVE THIS!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Great mirror for size and brightness, but it's not super durable and charge doesn't last long.", 'author': 'Danielle Duke', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've purchased two of these travel mirrors and really like the mirror and light itself. It's a great size and sleek enough to travel with. The light is adjustable and gets bright enough for my makeup needs.However, it does lack durability. Good price", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So good for travel!', 'author': 'Lex', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The travel makeup LED mirror has been an absolute lifesaver for my on-the-go beauty routine! Its compact size and built-in LED lights make it the perfect companion for travel. I love how easily it fits into my bag or suitcase, and the LED lights provide fantastic illumination for precise makeup application, regardless of the lighting conditions in different places. The convenience of having a reliable and compact mirror with excellent lighting has truly elevated my travel makeup game. If you're someone who values flawless makeup application while traveling, this LED mirror is an absolute must-have—it's made my beauty routine so much easier and more efficient on the road!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Great for Travel, But Short Lifespan', 'author': 'ZW', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This mirror is exactly what I needed for traveling, as any regular makeup wearer knows that lighting for doing your makeup is often disastrous in hotels/guest rooms/ect. It has three light hues, all of which are great for application. I enjoy it so much that I actually just ended up using it every day since I got it.The downside is that it doesn't always hold a charge long enough (timing being subjective of course, depending how long you take). I've been using it daily for a little over a year, and I've noticed that it dies quicker and quicker as time passes on. I take 20-30 mins to do my makeup and the last few months have had me charging it MULTIPLE times while I'm doing my makeup (after leaving it charging all night before). I don't have/can't afford a good set up for doing makeup, so I legitimately need this little well-lit mirror. It used to stay charged during my entire application, until it hit about 1 year of daily use. This week, it's started randomly turning on while it's charging, which is a sign that it's time to replace it and/or find something better.Overall good for quick applications and travel. Bad for spending quality time doing a full face, drinking coffee, messing around on your phone, and taking your time. You'll be racing against the clock using this and that's not how I like to spend my morning getting ready personally.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mirror', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'High quality mirror! Easy to use. Size makes it ideal for traveling. The back holds the mirror in place nicely. The lights are bright, and the dimmable feature helps in tricky lighting. Overall great mirror ESPECIALLY for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect travel mirror', 'author': 'Mackenzie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really enjoyed bringing this mirror for a trip where I didn’t want to have to share a bathroom mirror with the people I was traveling with. It’s really easy to use and adjust. I also enjoyed that there were three different light settings that I could use while doing my make up. I really don’t like a very close up mirror so this was my realistic to just a normal mirror instead of those ones that zoom in on every imperfection.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bright light', 'author': 'Mary Carter Twitty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This little travel make up mirror is surprisingly great! I have been looking for a travel mirror to take with me on my trips and have tried several, but this one surprisingly shocked me how great it really is, it’s small and compact but the light is very bright and then it has the magnifying mirror part as well, so if you’re looking for a Travel make up mirror, this is the one you need!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Professional 8.5" Large Lighted Makeup Mirror Updated with 3 Color Lights, 1X/10X Magnifying Swivel Vanity Mirror with 50 Premium LED Lights, Brightness Dimmable Cosmetic Mirror, Senior Pearl Nickel

Thank you, Vesaur!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this mirror', 'author': 'Lia MaAmazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been using magnifying lighted mirrors for a very long time because I wear makeup every day. I have to say that I absolutely love this make-up mirror for many reasons. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars FINALLY!!! A 2-sided travel mirror that is perfect!', 'author': 'Kate', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have bought and returned so many travel mirrors, I can't count. I wanted one side regular and the other side magnified for close work. Very simple. Very popular back in the old days. Today, most of them have this silly little round 10x mirror that sticks onto the regular mirror for the magnification. Those are HORRIBLE!!! First of all, they're too small. Secondly, 10x is WAAAY to close and you have to get so close to the mirror, you can't see what you're doing! Others do not have the magnifier side lit at all. I don't like the 'compact' mirrors..all 10x magnification and small. I finally found this mirror and it has everything I want! It's large enough for travel or for home. The lighting is perfect and has the usual 3 choices. I like that it doesn't use batteries and I can charge it and/or bring the cord and a USB outlet plug to use. And best of all, the other side is just as big and is only 5x magnified, so I can see close without having to practically put my nose on the mirror! I like this so much, I'm going to buy a second one for use at home/and a backup, because it was so rare in the sea of travel mirrors available out there! If I had one negative, it would be that there's no case for it and I'll have to figure out what to use to protect the mirror. I loved it when I first got it. It was just what I needed to apply makeup as I am nearsighted and over 40. I travel about once a month for 4 days. I purchased this mirror in February. During my trip in July, I noticed that the light was not as bright as on the past. I thought that it just needed to be recharged. I recharged it on my return home. When I took my trip in August, for a very special occasion, the lights were almost imperceptible. The mirror was fully charged. I was very disappointed and struggled to apply my makeup and put in my contacts. I am now looking for a new travel mirror. I really liked this one.UPDATE: while shopping for a replacement travel mirror, I figured out what I was doing wrong!!I am So Happy!The brightness of the light is adjustable!! Recommend .', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice packable mirror, but do not recommend for low lighting', 'author': 'Susan Meisner', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Thousands have given glowing reviews on this mirror and that is why I purchased it. I’m curious to know what the 5-star reviewers paid for theirs. Purchase price will greatly affect the review. I paid a little over $20 and will give it 3.75 - 4 stars because it is a nice packable mirror. My rating would be 1 star had I paid $39.99, the advertised list price. The mirror without the lights on and with the lights on, in good lighting, will allow good visualization to put makeup on. In early morning or low lighting, you will need to put your face very close (6-8in) to the mirror in order to see well. The view with the lights on is only 5X8 inches. The 2X and 3X magnification mirrors are so small @ 3x4.5 inches and the 10X is a little less than 3 inches in diameter, rendering them essentially useless. Using them would require that you lift the entire mirror up to your face to use. I am going to keep the mirror and use it for travel because, as said, it is a nice foldable mirror and it would work well with ample light settings. However, it will not provide adequate lighting for someone who wants to sit back and apply makeup in low lighting. My recommendations to the manufacturer would be to install the lighting in the top and bottom of the main mirror and then in side mirrors to allow a better view. Since the installed magnification mirrors are worthless, in my opinion, add them separately like the 10X magnification mirror so that the user can place them where can be easily used. With all this being said, many are very satisfied with the product as-is. I just wanted to provide a little more details.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Well made mirror but lighting should be embedded in all 3 mirrors.', 'author': 'Alby', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I liked the sturdiness of the mirror but to dismantle the mirror from the base would not be traveler friendly. The more magnified side is good i can actually see all the things. For me the lower magnification side has no use. The button for on and off is on the lower magnification side and i cant see it without turning the mirror around every time i need to cut it off. This is my only complaint about it. The charging is easy - plug in the side and plug into your block in the outlet. Doesnt take too long to charge back up. Also the charge lasts me about a month at a time. There are options to change the light type but also the brightness within each type of light. This mirror could easily be packed if need be for travel. I have truly enjoyed this product and highly recommend this for ppl who need a pretty high magnification.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It’s a 6.5” mirror.', 'author': 'William R', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like it. Both mirrors are very clear and the lights are decently bright. Only two things kept it from being 5 stars for me (well maybe three but we’ll see). One is that I thought it looked kinda small since I searched and bought a product that advertised as an 8” mirror. The mirror measures 6.5” across on the flat side and about an eighth of an inch larger on the magnified side. So the 8” isn’t the mirror, not even the mirror plus the lights. For 8” you would have to measure beyond the bezel and include the screw & plug terminal that the mirror rotates around. The second issue I have is with the touch control. Like many of these mirrors they placed a capacitive touch switch on the mirror itself, so I have to touch the mirror that I’m also trying to keep clean and it’s only on one side. The third nitpicky thing that may only become an issue if I lose the darn thing is their choice of cord. The cord has a large usb connection on one end and a barrel connection on the other end that plugs into the device. If you lose it you are never going to find another one like it so keep track of it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Zonon Flexible Mirror Sheets Self Adhesive Non Glass Mirror Tiles Mirror Stickers for Home Wall Decor (10 Pieces, 8 x 10 Inches)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works perfectly for my project', 'author': 'MrsMinelli', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought these mirror decals and instead of using them as stickers, I framed them (with the glass from the frames) and plan to hang them above a doorway as a sort of faux transom window to bounce natural light. The mirrors aren't perfect and have a distorted effect when looking from afar, but this isn't a problem for what I'm using them for. But based on other review photos, I think the distortion is less noticeable when not using them as stickers.I have 4 mirror decals left and plan to get different frames for them and to maybe paint onto the glass in front of the mirrors or add decals to make more artsy mirrors to hang elsewhere.This is a great deal for the price and works really well for certain projects. But if you are looking for a perfect mirror effect without distortion, especially if you plan to stick them to something as intended, these aren't what you're looking for.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Don’t waste your money', 'author': 'jennifer e meier', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Terrible product! We stuck these to smooth wood panels, then built custom frames around them. When we removed the protective film we found that they are worse than fun house mirrors, with, more of a dimpled reflective surface than a mirror. Not only did we waste the money on these mirrors, but also the time and money on the frames.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for crafting', 'author': 'Michelle Johannssen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I get that these have been reviewed as a ‘fun house’ mirror as they are not super clear when reflecting an image. However, these were perfect for a project I had in mind. They are lightweight, flexible and gave me the look I wanted without spending big in a realMirror. Plus I love that they are lightweight for hanging purposes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝗳𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗶𝘀 𝗗𝗜𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗥𝗧𝗘𝗗!', 'author': 'Sylvia Shu', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I wanted a new mirror for my dorm room door because the framed door mirror, that was held to the door with command strips, fell and shattered—to be fair, my roommate bought it from Walmart (𝘯𝘰 𝘩𝘢𝘵𝘦, 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘮𝘪𝘳𝘳𝘰𝘳 𝘴𝘶𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘥 6 𝘮𝘰𝘯𝘵𝘩𝘴 𝘴𝘶𝘴𝘱𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘥 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘢𝘪𝘳)．Being the case, I got these adhesive, non-glass mirror sheets as a replacement—𝟭) 𝗜𝘁’𝘀 𝗻𝗼𝘁 𝗴𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀! 𝟮) 𝗜𝘁’𝘀 𝗮𝗱𝗵𝗲𝘀𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘄𝗼𝗻’𝘁 𝗳𝗮𝗹𝗹! 𝟯) 𝗜𝘁’𝘀 𝗲𝗮𝘀𝘆 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆!（𝖨 𝖽𝗈𝗇’𝗍 𝗄𝗇𝗈𝗐 𝖺𝖻𝗈𝗎𝗍 𝗋𝖾𝗆𝗈𝗏𝖺𝗅 𝗍𝗁𝗈𝗎𝗀𝗁－ 𝖨’𝗏𝖾 𝗒𝖾𝗍 𝗍𝗈 𝗍𝗋𝗒）However, when I removed the blue screen after applying the sheets to the door, it revealed the reflection to be seriously distorted. （𝘛𝘣𝘧, 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘥𝘰𝘰𝘳𝘴 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘥, 𝘴𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘺’𝘳𝘦 𝘭𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵𝘭𝘺 𝘵𝘦𝘹𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘦𝘥, 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘩 𝘪𝘴 𝘳𝘦𝘭𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘭𝘺 𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘦𝘥 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘥𝘦𝘴𝘤𝘳𝘪𝘱𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘰𝘧 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘴𝘦 𝘵𝘪𝘭𝘦𝘴 𝘤𝘢𝘯 𝘨𝘰 𝘰𝘯.） Despite the distortion, you can get a decent reflection— for a more clear reflection, you need to get closer (though it will still have a slight distortion). Honestly, my roommate and I decided to just keep it because it still works as a mirror, and the distortion of top sheet gives a really funny reflection due to a thin sticker/sign underneath (college property)—the distortion varies but the reflected results are similar to virtual filters (𝙬𝙖𝙩𝙚𝙧, 𝙢𝙤𝙨𝙖𝙞𝙘, 𝙎𝙣𝙖𝙥𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙩, 𝙚𝙩𝙘). ———————————————————I also tested these mirror sheets on two other items that differ in surface texture, to see if the outcome was the same.The first test was on a 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻 𝘀𝗹𝗮𝗯 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗱𝗯𝗼𝗮𝗿𝗱; same material as cardboard box packages—lightly textured with those horizontal lines, but fairly flat. The result was a distorted reflection, however, much smoother than that on the door.The second test was on the back of a 𝗻𝗲𝘄/𝘂𝗻𝘂𝘀𝗲𝗱 𝗽𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗿 𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗮𝗿, so there should be 𝗻𝗼 𝘁𝗲𝘅𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 or bumps of any sort. Despite this, the reflection of revealed distortion, although, being the smoothest/least distorted compared to the other two surfaces.———————————————————————So, my point— regardless of the surface and/or texture, these adhesive mirror sheets have a distorted reflection to some extent. It isn’t ‘𝙗𝙖𝙙’ and could be used for décor aesthetic, although, it’s likely not what people are looking for when viewing this item. However, if you want a funny and/or distorted mirror, this is perfect—it’s great for blurred/censored aesthetic selfies!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Reflection, Ok Adhesion', 'author': 'Sese', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I purchased to improve my UV LED light.It has helped, but the light isn't great, so it was only going to do so much, so it's a little unfair to review it for it's intended use.As a reflective sheet, it works exactly as it is supposed to. The reflection isn't perfect, because this sheet came a little bent, so it is a little warped. But, since I'm not using it for perfect reflection, I'm okay with that.This set did come with multiple sheets, so there is a chance that I would use this for another project. The other sheets came unbent, and I didn't notice any warped imaging.The adhesive is okay, it's definitely repositionable because it doesn't stick well to plastic at all, at least not the plastic of my lamp. I imagine it would stick well to paper or cardboard or something like that. I do not think it would stick well to a wall or door, or anything with texture.It was easy to use, simple to apply (peel and stick), and it's easy to clean. It has a smooth surface. It is also easy to scratch, so non-abrasive cleaners are important. I was able to cut it to size using regular scissors too because it's thin. I could see this having a lot of craft uses.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lightens the room beautifully', 'author': 'Kate', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a mirror-quality material that could be placed in the skylights to project the light from the tunnel into the room. One of the reviewers - Jeff, October 2nd 2022 - included a short video of how well the product works so I decided to give it a try. The result is outstanding. My dark kitchen became bright all day long. Thanks, Jeff! And thanks the manufacturer! Great product. Easy to install, flexible, and reflects the light perfectly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Please be aware...', 'author': 'Bryan Praditkul', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Before buying this, I read the reviews and mentally prepared myself for the poor circus mirror quality, so I was at least ready to accept that. What I did not realize is that the adhesive backing is essentially unusable. Since I had extra after my craft was basically ruined, I testing sticking the excess "mirror" material to various objects and it all eventually comes off after 1hr-2days of affixing it to anything vertical. I even tried adding other adhesives (super glue, hot glue, craft glue)...it all surprisingly came off. The extra glues themselves stuck to the object, so I can tell it\'s the poor adhesive from the mirror itself. To be fair, for my craft, I didn\'t use the whole sheet, so I suppose if you are sticking the entire sheet on, that might work...however, there\'s no warning that says it wouldn\'t work otherwise.I don\'t prefer to write negative reviews, but this is one I feel like so much time was wasted that I wouldn\'t want anyone else going through this pain and frustration.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Could be better if handled better throughout supply chain', 'author': 'Sean A.M.', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I think the biggest issue with these is that they seem to be mistreated at one or more points throughout the supply chain; both sets I have ordered have had creases and/or dents, which permeate the entire stack, so every single sheet has the same flaw. The first set I ordered only had a minor dent, so I used them anyway, because it didn't matter a lot for the little cabinets I was mirroring. However, the second (depicted) set I ordered had a huge crease, as if the stack had been rolled, or as if someone attempted to fold it. They did ship in a box, but these sheets should really be sandwiched between rigid cardboard before they leave the factory.Another problem with these is that the adhesive -- which is definitely strong enough for most purposes -- is not applied evenly, and that contributes to the wavy effect after the mirror sheet is applied. Perhaps warming the sheets with a hair dryer before application will help the adhesive even out?The best results I have gotten from these have been on perfectly clean, smooth surfaces, like on a sheet of freshly-unwrapped acrylic, but even then: there's always still some slight waviness to the reflection. Any tiny piece of dust or lint between the mirror sheet and surface will make a bubble.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Unbreakable', 'author': 'Leslie Woods', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These are so thin like paper it’s awesome. I use them for the back of the bus seats so the children to see themselves and we can see them for safety reasons. These are so thin that at first I thought I had accidentally ordered something without an adhesive, but it has a cover sheet to keep it from scratching the thin blue one then your mirror piece and then on the back, it’s a white cover sheet that you pull off and that gives you your adhesive. I only give it for stars because I would like the adhesive to be a little stronger I had to use glue dots in a place where Bente little bit, but where it was solid straight, it sticks fine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Work well for our purpose!', 'author': 'Amy A.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I purchased these sheets to use as part of my daughter's discoball Halloween costume. They come in sheets and need to be peeled on both sides. One side has blue on it that covers the mirror side until you peel and the other side has adhesion. The adhesion works but isn't quite strong enough for our purposes as it kept coming off but we were trying to stick on a paper mached ball vs a nice flat surface, so take that info with a grain of salt.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Door Mirror, Full Length Mirror Over The Door, 14'' x 48'' Hanging Mirror, Rounded Rectangular Wall Mirror, Wall Mounted/Hanging/Leaning, Home Decor, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality for the price!', 'author': 'Savannah Weber', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mirror is awesome quality for what it is priced at. I have tall doors and this is on the lowest setting so my only wish is that it could be set a little lower down on the door. But still a great mirror and no other complaints! This mirror could also be mounted instead of hanging on door if preferred.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy assembly and functional, but limited hanging height options', 'author': 'Jarod', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This over-the-door hanging mirror is very easy to assemble. It’s so cute you guys. It came well packaged, no breaks or cracks. Easy to clean and it’s just freakin beautiful.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this mirror', 'author': 'michelle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is perfect for my space, not too big and looks great in my room', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful mirror but kind of shabby construction', 'author': 'Luke', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The mirror is beautiful, and the reflection is really good. No distortion/waviness. Frame is ok, although the paint has already started to fade after only 2-3 cleanings/wipes with a gentle cleaning pad and water. I like the size and otherwise it seems well made. I like the hanging hooks as well, in case you want it on the wall.My main issue with it is the way in which the back stand is attached to the frame. It seems like a really stupid design flaw -- the pivot bolt is very close to the back of the mirror, which is unprotected glass. As a result, when you extend the stand, there is a little bit of extra metal material above the pivot which scrapes the back of the mirror. I noticed where it touches, it has already scraped off a small part of the reflective amalgam on the back of the mirror. You can see two little damage black spots on the front. Very small, but annoying because this is just an elementary design flaw. It's does not appear to be faulty or broken, this is the actual design.You can unscrew the base and 'reverse' the brackets so that it still works without scraping the glass, or you can just remove it and hang/lean it.I would have given it 5 stars if it wasn't for that minor issue. Not worth returning since the damage is small (most people would probably not even notice it), and the new one would likely have the same issue.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful mirror, super easy to set up!', 'author': 'Jeanne Carlone', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the gold rim and large mirror!! YOU REALLY CAN NOT BEAT IT.You would never look at it and think that it could be or was a the price that it is.... it is so pretty and quality and just overall LOVE IT', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive quality!', 'author': 'Firestone', 'rating': 5, 'content': '58"×18" Arched Full Length Mirror Arched with StandI just finished mounting this mirror and overall I’m super impressed with the quality, especially for a mirror under $100 (I got it for $69).Pros:• As stated above, a great price!• It was well packed with a combination of ½” and ¾” rigid foam all around with plywood reinforced ends. It arrived in mint condition in two days with Prime shipping.• The frame is made of square aluminum tubing and is very rigid.• The ‘fun house’ mirror effect that some complain about was only observable when I stood half way across the room, focused on a single object (table lamp) and moved slowly from side to side. Honestly, if I wasn’t looking for it I wouldn’t have picked up on the minimal distortion (certainly not enough to move this comment to the Cons section• The stand was fully assembled and recessed into the frame to allow me to leave it in place and still mount flat to the wall.Cons:• It was listed as 18”x58” but it was closer to 17 ¼” W by just short of 58”L.• The mounting brackets are heavy duty but unfortunately they are a rigid key-hole-slot design with no room for mounting measurement errors. Typical, brackets have an adjustable triangular piece of heavy metal at the top of each wall mounting point and allow for some degree of inaccuracy in width spacing between the brackets. Not these puppies. Be sure your measurements are accurate down to the 16th inch (see tip below).• Speaking of the brackets, they were attached with a 1/8” difference in height (bottom to top). I needed to adjust the wall anker for different heights to compensate.Installation Tip:• Reuse a long piece of the shipping plywood to make a template for the screw holes. This will save you from having a crooked mirror or patching drywall.• Layout the spacing exactly as you think you will on the wall. If you need to adjust one of the screws vertically to compensate for different bracket heights, this is the place to do it before drilling into the wall in the wrong place.• Drill 1/8” holes in the plywood exactly where the screws will be located and inert them almost completely into the template.• Flip the template over and slide the screw heads onto the frame brackets to see if you got all of the spacing right. I measured from the frame bottom to the mounted template.• When it fits correctly. Back out the screws until the tips just barely protrude from the wood.• Using a level against the wood strip and with the screw tips lightly touching the wall, position the template where you want to drill holes and tap it to mark screw hole locations in the drywall. Drill ¼” holes in the drywall for the ankers, insert screws almost all the way into the ankers and hang you new mirror.• Because the brackets are on the rear edges of the frame it will be no problem seeing both the screw and bracket from the sides to mount.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Mirror is good for its price', 'author': 'Anon', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The mirror is a lil cheap, when I stand far away looks a lil circus like, but good for the price as long as it doesn’t go above 80, if it goes up FIND ANOTHER MIRROR', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars so much nicer than expected', 'author': 'Greg Begland', 'rating': 5, 'content': "For such a low price, I expected this mirror to be flimsy or poorly finished. I replaced my dated old medicine cabinet with this and and it was worth the replastering! Very chic, I think.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A mirror so nice we bought it twice', 'author': 'Nick E', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'oruii Round Mirror: $51.99 at the time of reviewWhen I sat down to write the review for this mirror, it seemed kind of silly. After all, what is there to say about a mirror? It\'s reflective, uh, it\'s… Big enough for the space? But even mirrors need reviews so here I am. My wife and I recently remodeled all three bathrooms in our house (not at the same time thank goodness). We already had a mirror for one of the bathrooms, but we needed another two. We couldn\'t find a matching mirror for the existing one we had and our basement bathroom was done first. So I set out defined the mirror that fit that aesthetic.I landed on this mirror from Oruii because I liked the simple black framed circular design. I needed something big, but not too big (in this case I settled on the 24" x 24"). This mirror also checked that box. And last but not least, I wanted a glass mirror (as opposed to plastic).I am happy to report that this mirror looks great! The thin black frame does a great job of accenting the edge of the mirror. The aluminum material helps keep the way down too. It has a nice easy to use hanger built into the back with angular guides that help lead whatever nail or hanging tool of choice right into the center hole. There is also a small foam square down towards the bottom to help even out the bottom side of the mirror so it sits flat against the wall.Really the only nitpick I have is very difficult to avoid. The aluminum frame does have a very small separation point at the bottom where it\'s clear that one strip of aluminum was bent around the mirror. Unfortunately, it\'s pretty easy to see. That having been said, it is pretty small, and I doubt that our guests notice it (even if I see it every day).Ultimately, I think this is a fantastic mirror for the price. Right around 50 bucks for a 24 inch circular mirror with a nice stylish black band around it? Yes, please! If I could give partial stars, this would probably get 4.75 stars. But since I can\'t, and I\'m not willing to round down for that tiny little nitpick, this is gonna end up at five stars out of five for me. Not only what I order it again, we did order another one for our other bathroom. It looks great in there, too!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks so good in my bathroom!', 'author': 'samantha', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to install and great quality for the cost! I needed this mirror for a space in my room where I find myself doing my makeup but don't have a mirror there. It fits just fine & looks nice enough although I cannot seem to remove the finger prints without putting more finger prints on it. Also, I probably could have used a slightly larger mirror. They make larger mirrors, the 20 x 28 would have been better for the space that I need it in.This mirror arrived with some packaging glue on the mirror, but I was able to wipe it away (it did take awhile). The black frame seems light weight and sturdy enough. I did not see any directions, but it is self explanatory, I guess. The good part is that it is not heavy. Hanging a heavy mirror is the absolute worst! So the light weight feature is great! Now, the way it attaches is unique. I have never seen a mirror with that type of backing. I opted to use the heavy duty stickers as opposed to the nail in wall. I am sooooo very thrilled they offered that option! I actually LOVE the sticker nail and have never seen it before. However, I measured incorrectly and in removing it, ripped off the wall. Guess that means the nail sticker IS HEAVY DUTY! They provided two sets of nails and also two sets of sticker nails. Thankful for that! Since that was my fault for mis-measuring, no complaints there. Overall I'm ok with it. The price is a little high, but mirrors seem to be getting expensive these days. I definitely would not use this as a bathroom mirror, more like a closet mirror or small space mirror.
