title: Wall Mount Small Mirror, Brushed Black Metal Framed Rounded Corner Rectangular Makeup Mirror for Bathroom, Bedroom, Living Room (12" x 16",Black)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars True reflection, beautifully designed, good value for the price.', 'author': 'Jennis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love how this turned out. It has a tiny seam where the metal end meet, pretty easy to install. Came with anchors in case the location doesn’t align with studs. I thought it was thoughtful for them to include mounting hardware. I ADDED some poster putty at the bottom of the mirror so when I clean it, it doesn’t move around. Before it would have a slight bounce when touched. Now it sits more firmly against the wall. LOVE THE SIZE! Smaller bathroom but 2 kids can see themselves in the morning getting ready. Sturdy, and a nice matte black is what I chose.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellet stylish mirror!', 'author': 'Susan E. Stout', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This mirror is amazing, especially for the price. It's stylish and sturdy. It completed my office bathroom project.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mirror', 'author': 'Off Gassing', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Exactly how I expected it to be. Good quality and looks great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Takes Patience to Install Properly', 'author': 'BillAdams', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Installation can be a challenge. There are two keyholes on the back that slide over two screws mounted perfectly on your wall. It would be helpful if they had told me these facts:The outside measure of the mirror is 30 1/16 x 20 1/8. The frame of the mirror extends 5/16 above the backboard, and the keyhole is recessed into the backboard 1/8” but has a “bubble” on it to accept the screw head. So if you let the screw stick out of the wall by 7/16” it will fit into the keyhole and the mirror will hang. If the screw doesn’t stick out enough, it won’t clear the frame to reach the keyhole.The two keyholes are, for horizontal hanging, 20 1/8” center-to-center, which means even if you find a stud, you will still need a drywall anchor for the second hole (as studs are 16” apart). For vertical hanging, the keyholes are 10 ½ “ apart.The mirror comes with some drywall anchors and screws but they didn’t look adequate. The mirror weighs 10 lbs and to allow for stress on it during cleaning the glass, allow 15 lbs. So I bought a set of #6 drywall anchors and screws. I measured on the wall (with a level) where the holes should go. Bottom of the frame to the horizontal mounts is 15 ¼”.Drill pilot holes first with a 3/16” bit in case you’re lucky and hit a stud. I did. On the other hole, the pilot hole is about 5/16” to accept the anchor. When you put in your screws, you have to estimate the head extension 7/16 by eye. You can always screw in more, but you can’t screw out without ruining the anchor.Make the same keyhole measurements on the reflecting side of the mirror and mark the keyhole locations on the glass with lipstick or Vaseline. That helps you align the screws with the keyholes, a procedure that is otherwise blind. I put a few 3M sticky pads at the bottom of the mirror to fill the space between the frame and the backboard so it wouldn’t rattle.The mirror looks really classy. It’s a great product at a great price. But you do need a bit of patience to install it. I should have hired someone. Took me all afternoon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful Mirror', 'author': 'Brandon’s Playlist', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Came in 1 day, and easy to install, solid heavy and well made.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice', 'author': 'Butch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Beautiful and very good quality. Love it. Recommended', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Defective peoduct', 'author': 'Sara Perkins', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Bought three of these mirrors. Each one had the aluminum frame detached from the mirror itself in multiple places and could be pulled away from the mirror so that at least an inch or more of space was visible. Short return window and a large restocking fee. Wish I’d never bought.EDIT: The company has worked with me to resolve this issue, and fully refunded the broken products.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great quality', 'author': 'Sara', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'sturdy, heavy quality. chic look with the black frame and rounded edges, definitely upgrades your whole bathroom look', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good mirror- use own hardware!', 'author': 'Jamie Brown', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Arrived safely without any issues! No messy extra packaging which was a plus.I agree with other reviewers- the black frame does have a small split/seam from where it connects that can be mended on your own. It’s annoying to me but could easily be overlooked for others. I will be fixing it on my own.The hardware that comes with the mirror is not long enough. So be sure to use your own wall anchors and screws.It was a beast to hang because the mirror is NOT flush with the black border. Because of this, the mirror will stick out from the wall and will lay flush with the border, not the back of the mirror. As you can imagine, you then need to ensure your screws are sticking far enough out to catch the mirror, which is why the hardware that came with the mirror is not long enough.Overall 4/5 stars, looks great and I feel more secure using sturdier and longer screws that we had. I will be fixing the seam in the border as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressed, would recommend', 'author': 'D.P.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'No Cracks: These mirrors are exactly what I was looking for. I ordered 5 of the 24x36 mirrors and they all came in perfect condition no cracks. (Shout out to the delivery people!)Frame: I read a few reviews that stated flimsy frame with a gap. The frame is metal and I have noticed it is hot glued to the frame better in some than others, so if your frame moves you could add some extra hot glue to secure it better. However overall once hung on the wall I don’t expect any issues. Also, there was a gap mentioned where the frame comes together is small and positioned at the top of each frame if you were to hang it vertical.Hanging kit: I do agree the screws/anchors provided to hang the mirror seem small, so to be safe I will be buying bigger ones.Packaging: Each mirror came individually wrapped and well packed. 10/10 would recommend', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Large Makeup Mirror, Travel Lighted Makeup Mirror, 3 Color Lighting, Rechargeable 2000mAh Battery, Portable Ultra Slim Vanity Mirror, Travel Essential for Women
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High Quality Portable Mirror', 'author': 'Michael', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very nice folding mirror that is easy to travel with from room to room or take in a suitcase. The white plastic case is very shiny and has a premium feel. Both Mirrors (the main mirror and the 10x round add on mirror) are very nice distortion free glass and provide very sharp reflections.This arrived in a high quality box packaged very well in bubble wrap with a micro USB charging cord and instruction book. The 10x close up mirror has two suction cups on it so you can move it as necessary. There is a physical on/off switch on the back near the micro USB charging port and charge indicator light. The lid/stand has a magnet in it that keeps the lid shut tight when closed. The border of the mirror lights up in a very uniform/continuous manner and provides a nice boost of light for when using the mirror. The base folds to cover the mirror for protection when not in use. The glass mirror is slightly recessed so when closed, the glass does not get touched by the base. Our mirror came with some charge in the battery and lasted a while before we needed to actually charge it. It has been in use for a few weeks and lasts several days between charges.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Convenient and needed!', 'author': 'trevis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mirror is perfect! It IS large, it does fold up nicely, and it has a smaller mirror that can attach with suction cups that has even stronger magnification for doing things like plucking your eyebrows. The lighting has two settings, and it seems to stay charged for a long time. I like that I can charge it and not have to have it plugged in to have the lighting. It has a cover that folds down and behind it so that it can sit on your vanity. It is supposed to stay up in a range of tilts, but mine will only hold for so long until it drops back into the lowest tilt, so that's annoying. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I need the extra light and magnification', 'author': 'TI', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm 68 and have used various different lighted mirrors for decades. She was thrilled to have this mirror!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Light her eyes up', 'author': 'Jeffery H', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Let me tell you when I gave this to my wife, Happy tears! While I can't speak on the battery life just yet, the inclusion of a charging cord is a thoughtful touch. It adds to the convenience and ensures I can keep the mirror illuminated whenever needed. Overall, a stylish and functional addition to my makeup routine.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars GOOD, NOT GREAT', 'author': 'Kimberley Sanchez', 'rating': 3, 'content': "For the most part, I like this mirror. It is very annoying that it continues to turn off without any logical reason to do so. Unless they improve the product to keep it from automatically turning itself off at random, I would not buy this again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super chic and great magnifying', 'author': 'Melissa Marchant', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Looks very elegant. Quality is great and it works very well. Great buy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not very happy', 'author': 'Eric Kasum', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'It’s a pretty mirror, and it works good, but it has several things I don’t like. It says it can be extended to be higher, but at its full extension it’s less than 1 foot high, so it’s way too short. Our previous mirror was much higher. it has the on switch on the backside of the mirror. In other words you have to turn the mirror over to turn it on and then turn it over to use the magnification mirror. Bad design. Why not have the switch on the base? My old mirror had a finger touch base to turn the light on and off and I loved it. Also this mirror is too small. It’s much smaller than our previous mirror. The only problem is, the company that makes our previous Mirror stopped making it, so this looks like our best choice. It may have a longer lasting battery and that was a problem with my old mirror. it also has a modern charger cord, that’s a big plus. My old mirror had the old charger socket and it was really annoying. Pros and cons. I think I’d be happy if the on switch was on the magnifying mirror which is the one I use instead of the backside, which is really annoying to have to turn it over after you turn it on. I guess I’m spoiled because I loved my old mirror so much. Will you like it? You decide.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great vanity mirror!', 'author': 'Fillise', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this lighted makeup mirror, especially the 10x side. So many magnification mirrors are only little disks, but those of us in our 60s and up need the whole mirror! The lighting is an added bonus. Recommend wholeheartedly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for Low Vision Folks', 'author': 'JamVee', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I'm a low vision guy and had trouble shaving/trimming my beard etc., until I got this handy mirror. Its very sturdy, and the light (2 brightness settings) does the job. The hi-magnification side is great too.A minor draw-back is stand isn't really tall enough for me. I have no place to put it except on the sink countertop. I'm 6' tall, and even with the stand extended all the way, I still have to bend over to look into the mirror.For traveling, I wouldn't recommend it, because it's a bit bulky and heavy to put in a suitcase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Square Wall Mirrors for Bedroom Door, Unbreakable Full Length Shatterproof Mirror Tiles, 10"x10", 4 Pack
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It Has TWO Layers of Protective Film - Remove Both!', 'author': 'Gardyloo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a large unbreakable mirror that can be set at any height you need. When I first tried this, I peeled off one layer of protective film. We installed it in the shower to shave my face. It didn’t fog up, but the image wasn’t completely clear. Then I read a review of a similar item that reported TWO layers of film. They were right, there are TWO layers of film, and removing the second layer makes this easy to view. Images are now clear, and I can shave safely in the shower. Highly recommended item!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Does What it Needs', 'author': 'Onyx', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have this weird problem where every few days while showering I get an eyelash in my eye and I have to spend the rest of the shower with an eye closed. Figure why not get a mirror to help me get it out?I didn't do any cleaning on the tile wall before I stuck it on and it hasn't fallen off after a few weeks. I've let all kinds of soap and water get on it and haven't wiped it down or anything and it's still perfectly clear enough for me to see. Does exactly what I needed to do and my super small inconvenience is no problem anymore.Also weird to see myself in the various stages of soaps in my hair, ears, face.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars It's a mirror but it has a slight haze.", 'author': 'G. Parks', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Update: I increased the star rating. I noticed that there was an additional protection film on the mirror that was really difficult to catch an edge and remove. Once I removed that, the mirror is now much better.It works for my intended usage but it haze a slight haze. I did take off the protective plastic and even tried cleaning it. Don't expect a glass mirror reflection.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Shatterproof', 'author': 'kitty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My old mirror fell and shattered at my feet after the suction cup became loose. This mirror will not shatter. its made out of some sort of plastic that resembles the back of a coaches clipboard. It has a wide, crystal clear view that has not fogged or gotten any signs of hard water stain on it since i began using it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I can see when I shave!', 'author': 'The Miller Bunch', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I never gave it much thought before, but after seeing this shower mirror and picking it up I'm now wondering why I never thought about getting one before. I always shave in the shower, and then I would sometimes get out and noticed that I missed a spot and have to touch up once I was already drying off. But no more! This mirror is about the size of a sheet of paper, is as clear as a bell, and didn't actually fog up while I showered. It comes with a hook that sticks to the shower wall (clean and dry first of course), and so far it has held up fine. I love it! One thing I will mention. Mine came with 2 coatings of that thin, invisible plastic that you have to peel off. After I peeled off the first, it still looked a bit hazy, that's when I discovered I had a second layer to peel off. Once I did it was perfect.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Its Huge!', 'author': 'Powers', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My old one is starting to see the end of its life. The coating on the bag is coming off, its got rust on it from who knows what, and pretty sure the water marks are just a feature now instead of something to clean off.So I saw this and was like "Oh I do need that!" Not realizing how much bigger it is than the one I have!So far the material is really good and the reflective surface is better than most glass mirrors. The backing feels like a solid plastic and doesn\'t appear to scratch off.Also with it being shatter proof. It doesn\'t have to stay in the bathroom! It could go out to the garage with you to find that 10mm socket, it could go to the basement so you can see around up into that thing they call a crawl space even though a newborn would struggle to fit in there, etc. The possibilities are only limited by the wife!Overall:Pretty good upgrade to replace my old one!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Delivers function with safety,', 'author': 'Sybarite', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This hanging shower mirror is a two piece unit. The hook affixes to the wall with an adhesive and the mirror dangles from the hook, via a whole in the mirror. Though the manner of installation left much to be desired, I am able to safely shave in the shower now without fear of the mirror dropping and shattering glass all over the shower floor. Thanks to the plexiglass fabrication, this lightweight mirror will not shatter with a fall and provides a clear reflection to work from. I would definitely seek this mirror out again as an option to mirrors for the shower.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Does the trick', 'author': 'The Honest Review Guy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This works out pretty well. It doesn’t get really all that foggy, and the way I managed to drop it, it held up just fine (just a scuff). I appreciate that it came with a little sticker hook thing as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice mirror but not fog free', 'author': 'Mr. Lundt', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'For a plastic mirror, this provides a very clear reflection. It is not really fog free. Any cold mirror will fog up in a hot shower. It is possible to warm this mirror up by holding it under the running water for a minute. The water does seem to bead up on it as if it has some kind of Rain X coating. It comes with a hook with double-sided tape. I chose to use a suction cup. Overall, this is a good mirror but not fog free', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Light weighted and works as a mirror', 'author': 'Michael', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This mirror is very light weighted and the shatterproof design makes it safer to use while bathing. It has a designed in hole for hanging hook if designed. However the included hook does not seem heavy duty so not sure if could sustain over hot bath area.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Wall Mirror Full Length Mirror for Wall,Home Gym Mirror 14''x12'' x 12PCS, Glass Frameless Body Mirror Wall-Mounted for Gym, Bedroom, Living Room, Over The Door
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very useful mirror, saves space, no image distortion', 'author': 'Mahanu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I didn’t want to spend a lot on full length mirror and chose this one instead . For a sticker , it looks really like a mirror , no image distortion at all . I recommend this', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PERFECT FOR MY PROJECT', 'author': 'Jay', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wanted to make a “mirror-window” on a low budget and these worked great. ALL 12 pieces arrived perfectly packaged. Stuck them to freshly painted wall then used pvc window casing around them and pvc spacers in between. Go big or go home👍', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy-ish install, decent price', 'author': 'Anon', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I installed this in my basement office directly across from a white accent wall to help brighten up the room because I experimented with a paint color that was a little too dark. I think it works for what I wanted it to do.The install wasn\'t too bad, I actually didn\'t look at the instructions because I couldn\'t be bothered to look up the QR code in the "instruction manual". It took me about ~1hr putting it up solo. I wasn\'t too fussy about being a perfectionist, once I measured and place the first mirror I just used a spacer (my leveler) and eye-balled a lot of it. If I had another person to help, I could have put it up in ~40 minutes and I could have been more precise.Tip: once you have the adhesive on the back of the mirror, place one edge on the wall with the mirror ~perpendicular to the wall so the adhesive is NOT touching. Use your leveler or tape markings to make sure the edge is perfectly horizontal or vertical (depending on which edge you chose. If you have something to brace against this next part will be easier, for my I used my leveler. Pivot the mirror towards the wall slowly, watching to make sure the edges are lined up and gently press it into the wall. The adhesive tape is quite sticky and it will be difficult to make any adjustments once the adhesive is touching the wall.The instructions specifically say that the adhesive tape and the adhesive glue are both permanent, but you can get command line strips (sold separately) to make the mirrors removable.The mirrors are 1/2 - 1/4 the thickness of a typical bathroom mirror. They\'re thin enough that they can bend slightly, warping the reflection so the image will be slightly less than perfect. It\'s possible this is mitigated by using the glue instead of the tape, since the mirror will have little or no space between it and the wall - I used the tape.Also they give you plenty of adhesive, they sent me 3 tubes of adhesive glue and 2 pages of adhesive tape that are cut up into squares. I used 4 squares, one for each corner of the mirror, and had 60 squares left over, so you could easily put 8+squares on, but be aware that adjusting a mirror after placing 4 adhesive squares onto the wall was nearly impossible.Mirrors can be quite expensive, so I think the price is reasonable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars cute', 'author': 'Anna', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love how it looks in my room, and was cheap and easy. be careful though because I cut my finger putting it up but that’s probably user error. also there are no instructions so I kinda guessed. anywho it’s cute and easy and cheaper than buying other mirrors.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars FUN HOUSE MIRRORS', 'author': 'laura', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'These were easy to install, and the glass was definitely glass, however, they are all different types of glass. In one mirror panel I look extremely skinny, in the one beside it, I look short and squatty. It is HORRIBLE, and It is installed permanently on my wall. My husband is very upset that I did this. He would love it if they were actually decent mirrors, but they are far from it. I have never seen so many different types of reflections. It is crazy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Soso', 'author': 'Torrien Henderson', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Not enough', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love the mirrors!', 'author': 'Queen SC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good quality product. Definitely glass/mirror and didn’t come scratched or broken. Ordering one more to extend across my wall lol. I really turned my room out', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Installation', 'author': 'JANICE ALLEN', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'There are no dislikes, but I would rather have a floor mirror', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Bad distortion', 'author': 'Roopa', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'They were easy to install (and difficult to remove), but they distorted images so much they were basically unusable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Decent mirrors. Adhesive very strong', 'author': 'Sean C', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'These are pretty solid especially for the price. Though definitely use command strips to mount if you want them to come off. title: Lighted Makeup Mirror Hollywood Mirror Vanity Makeup Mirror with Lights Smart Touch Control 3-Gear Dimable Light 360°Rotation (12in. White)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love my Mirror', 'author': 'Mike Williams', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Lighted Hollywood Vanity Makeup Mirror in black, and overall, I am quite pleased with my purchase. This mirror has proven to be a valuable addition to my makeup routine, providing excellent lighting and useful features for flawless makeup application.Design and Build Quality:The design of this Hollywood-style makeup mirror is sleek and elegant, adding a touch of glamour to my vanity setup. The black finish gives it a sophisticated look that complements my room decor. The build quality is decent, and the mirror feels sturdy enough to withstand regular use. However, I did notice some minor scratches on the frame upon unpacking, which was a bit disappointing.Lighting:The lighting is the standout feature of this makeup mirror. The three-gear dimmable lights are fantastic, offering different levels of brightness to suit various lighting conditions. The LEDs provide clear, natural lighting that mimics daylight, making it easier to achieve a well-blended and balanced makeup look. I love that I can adjust the brightness according to my preference and the time of day.Smart Touch Control:The smart touch control is a convenient feature that allows me to adjust the lighting with a simple touch. It's responsive and user-friendly, making it effortless to change the brightness while in the middle of my makeup routine. However, I did notice that sometimes it requires a few taps to respond properly.360° Rotation:The ability to rotate the mirror 360 degrees is helpful, especially when I need to check my makeup from different angles. The swivel mechanism works smoothly, and I can position the mirror at the perfect angle for precise makeup application.Size:The 12-inch size is adequate for my needs, but I would have preferred a slightly larger mirror for a more comprehensive view. While the current size is suitable for makeup application on the face, a larger mirror would have been better for full-body outfits.Power Source:The mirror can be powered using either a USB cable or batteries, which is a convenient option. I appreciate the flexibility to choose between these power sources based on my needs and availability.Durability:As mentioned earlier, the build quality is decent, but the mirror frame could be more resistant to scratches and minor damages. I suggest handling it with care to maintain its appearance over time.In conclusion, the Lighted Hollywood Vanity Makeup Mirror with Smart Touch Control and 3-Gear Dimmable Light is an excellent addition to any makeup enthusiast's collection. The lighting is the standout feature, providing natural, adjustable brightness for a flawless makeup application. While there were some minor drawbacks, such as the size and potential for scratches, the mirror's overall performance and functionality make it a worthwhile investment for makeup lovers.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!', 'author': 'will mccurdy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well built, just the perfect amount of lite. Well worth the money. I put a small shelf on my wall to get it out of the way when not in use. Not to heavy so it’s easy to move around. Perfect size to. U can see the top of your head all the way down to your chest.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it!!', 'author': 'CharlotteSimplicity', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I do not tend to purchase trendy beauty fixtures such as vanities or light up contraptions. I prefer my Victorian antique mirrors and vanities. I get ready in the early hours and this sleek mirror goes on my side table, the design is modern but with the black and sleek lines it doesn’t stand out like a sore thumb. I wish it could operate without a cord, I don’t have many outlets. I am impressed by the light settings and it’s very useful how I can tilt the mirror up and down!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cute, but lighting color is a weird blue', 'author': 'Heather and Chris', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I *love* the styling and size of this mirror. It's exactly what I was looking for aesthetically. Also, the mirror swivels up and down so that you can get a good angle, and there's a non scratch foam pad on the base, so you can easily slide it forward to get up close without scratching the surface of your vanity. The touch button feature for the three levels of light is neat, but the button is in on the mirror portion of the glass, so when you touch it with oily or makeup covered fingers, obviously it is going to get kind of nasty, but it's easy to wipe off. I have only two major complaints... Despite there being three levels of brightness, the first two are much too low to really bother with, so you always have to use it on the brightest level, and even that is arguably a little low, and the tone of the color for the light is in an unnatural blue hue, no matter what brightness setting you have it on. I have had to make sure to add plenty of natural, warm lighting in the general area-- I keep a small lamp on my vanity, and I really need to turn on surrounding lamps and an overhead light to make sure that I have proper lighting for daytime especially. If they had made sure that this light was more warm/neutral in color, and that the brightness level had gone a little higher, it would be ideal, but I am making it work with the surrounding warmer lights. Also, there is no magnifying portion of this mirror, so I have put a very small pedestal magnifying mirror to the side, and that has done nicely as well. Overall, it's really like a 3.5 out of 5 because of the color of the light, mostly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Makeup mirror', 'author': 'Nicole Crawford', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nicely structured mirror, good size. If I ever lose them, I’ll come right back here to purchase them again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars nice size for travels', 'author': 'logical1', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed another magnifying mirror for my travel bag. This is the perfect size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good mirror, not good tweezers', 'author': 'Zon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Mirror is as expected - nice magnification, lightweight with thin, plastic frame, slips into small makeup bag easily (which is where I’ve always kept a mirror like this). I recently dropped the one I’d had for many, many years, and the mirror shattered. This one is nearly an exact replacement. Local big box store currently only carries one with a small built in light (bulkier and the light is terrible), so I ordered this one, and am happy with it so far.Unfortunately, the tweezers, are not of very good quality. Although I wasn’t in need of them, I thought it would be nice to have an extra pair. However, after trying them, I will *not* be using them for personal care. I’m attaching a photo to compare the La Cross set I use (nearly daily) to these. The tweezers from this set have a flat, but rather sharp edge to the tips (grasping end), which causes more of a skin grab than just hair, and they pinch fat too easily. I tested them before the review, and although quite careful, I still feel irritation of the skin where I used these. It’s not simply because I was tweezing, as I pluck a hair or two from my brows almost daily, so I don’t get irritated like someone who isn’t accustomed to it. It’s solely because of the unrefined edge of these tweezers. When I took the photo of the two, side-by-side, it was evident why they feel so different. The La Cross pair are more angled on the inside and are polished, but still provide adequate grip. I hope the photo uploads at a decent enough quality to be able to see the differences. The ones from this set are on the left, and the La Cross set are on the right (you can see the paint wearing away from use).So, the ones that came with this set will be relegated to either the craft room or the tool box. I’m sure they’ll be useful in one of those places, as long as I’m careful to not gouge or scratch anything.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Magnifying not great', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Maybe I’m just more blind than I thought but this feels more like 10x magnification than 20x. I do like the size though. Very nice for travel', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: FUNTOUCH Rechargeable Travel Mirror, Lighted Makeup Mirror with 10X Magnifying, Portable, Touch Screen Dimming, 3 Colors, 1800mAh Battery, 10 x 7.5 in
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sleek and durable', 'author': 'micki', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wow!What a great product!The packaging was durable and simple. Product arrived fast and in perfect condition.The mirror itself was larger than anticipated and very clear--allowing for detail during eye makeup applications.The light had several settings which was easy to adjust by simply holding a button on the mirror. This light could also be adjusted to change from a fluorescent to a much softer natural light and several settings in between.Very simple to power on, as the power switch is on the front cover of the mirror. Yes, it has a front cover.The manufacturers were not playing around when it came to this product. The price is more than affordable for the quality and durability of this mirror.An added bonus is the small 10x magnifying mini mirror with suction cups--perfect for small details.Also comes with its own charger.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile and great for travel', 'author': 'TSingh', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I travel a lot and I stay in hostels often. For me, this mirror is especially useful because the front cover swivels all the way back, and I can prop it in between the slats of a bunk. Or I can maneuver it into any space for make up. I also really appreciate how bright it is because often these spaces are really dark and not conducive for make up. It fits perfectly in with my laptop sleeve.Pros: large but lightweight, bright! And adjustable. Batteries last a long time between charges.Cons: the surface is smooth so so it’s a little bit slippery if your hands are wet or they have lotion on them. It’d be really easy to add a pop socket or handle on it though.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel, Not so great for Magnification', 'author': 'Annie Rutkowski', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I do love this travel mirror, however it would be better if the mirror rotated, and it was 2 sided. with the other side being the 10x magnification. The small suction mirror is really too small, and the case does not close properly for travel when its suctioned to the bigger mirror.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight and easy to use!', 'author': 'Cristinasundays', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Pro’s-Great Packaging-Easy to use-Large size-Clear Mirror-Multiple Light settings-Dimmable-Magnetic close feature-On/off switch-Two colors offeredCon’s-A bit too thick-Thin cover-Slightly wobbly-Smudges-Attracts dirt and hair-Not daily travel friendlyMy first impressions of this mirror was WOW. The packing was amazing and I had no fear that my mirror had arrived damaged. This was a great travel mirror to use. I first started off using this as my main daily mirror. The light function was very easy to operate and I loved that it had a magnet to keep the lid closed for storage. I did attempt to take this to the office with me but it was a bit large for my daily purse, so I had to change purses (I was not leaving the mirror behind). That being said I can see this as being ideal for travel where you have luggage space available to you, not so much a daily travel to gym/ work mirror. The mirror quality itself was amazing, very clear with no imperfections and the light did not take up too much real estate. I was worried at first that the light would be too bright to use but the dimming feature worked great to mimic my daily lighting. My con’s with this mirror is that overall it is about the size of a 2nd gen iPad, which does not seem “travel size”, and that it was too thick for my liking. If it was the same length and height but with a much reduced width I do not believe I’d think it was too big. I would have preferred something with the footprint of a kindle reader. But the trade off is that you get something a good working size that feels well made and not cheap, no one wants to do their makeup in a mirror the size of a compact! I do also feel that the finish will not look great over time, because it is so glossy I can see where scratches will start to form easily, I would have preferred a matte finish. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It works well!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As someone with very short hair, I struggle with my hair upkeep. It feels pointless to go to the salon when it’s getting long but not long enough for a full trim, so I ordered this mirror along with some texturing comb scissors. This mirror works really well! I would love a new one. I like everything about this mirror except the hanging rods, they are reeeally hard to pull out of the mirror, I really struggled to get therm out, they are flush with the mirror with no tab or opening to help you grip them to pull them out, I almost had to get a screwdriver or something to pry them out but then that would have damaged the case, I finally got them out but not without a struggle. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Size Works Great, Easy Fix Tie Rubber Bands on Corners of Stand to keep from Slipping', 'author': 'F. Bamboo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The makeup mirror is great. It is a nice larger sized portable mirror. It does need to be plugged in to use but my laptop is always close by so it hasn't been a problem. It has 3 light tones and the lights are really bright. I really like the mirrors size and like that I can lay it flat and fit into a drawer when not in use. The stand bracket does slip on you but an easy quick fix that I found was to tie a rubber band around each corner of the stand and has worked out perfect and stopped it from slipping. Overall it is a great sized mirror and I recommend highly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great mirror just not perfect', 'author': 'Stienstien', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So this mirror quality wise is pretty nice, really nice quality mirror. it has a full metallic band all around it, it's pretty thick as well about the thickness of a book not just some cardboard. Stand is metal as well. Changing light modes is simple touch the little heart turns it on touching again you can cycle through 3 different color modes. I find it to be bright enough without blinding you when you are staring at it, since your face is pretty close to this to begin with.Only reason for giving it 4 starts instead of 5 is while it can almost stand vertically and has 180 degrees of adjustment, there is a point about 30 percent of incline where the stand and the mirror will slide folding onto itself and only stopping if the cord gets pinched between the mirror body and the stand. Not a big deal but if you push hard enough on the mirror to change the color, turn it on or off it will fold down. Some felt at the bottom of the mirror might help with that if you find theres a certain angle you need. Another reason that pushed this to the 4 star is while the light turns on only when it's plugged in (theres no battery) the connection on the back is a 5v cylinder plug type. It somes with the cord that can plug into any USB port to charge, just not the power block. So if you move this around often enough you will need to grab cord. Otherwise it's a very nice mirror, with some improvements can be even better.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing mirror for at home lashes', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I do mu own lash extensions. I should have gotten this sooner', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars good mirror for getting ready', 'author': 'LovelyDude', 'rating': 4, 'content': "i like this mirror a lot, it is exactly as advertised! the button is easy to use and very accessible. i do find myself having to hold the mirror closer to my face sometimes, but it's not that big of a deal. the stand part is not the most secure and can sometimes slip.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect makeup mirror!', 'author': 'Logan strange', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mirror lights up perfectly and the touch screen works great. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great solution!', 'author': 'Tim & Amanda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are great for budget friendly glow-ups!These are incredible. Used for my home vanity. I've tried the strips and other bulbs but these that plug in (not USB) are definitely brighter.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love them', 'author': 'Kayla Martin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good job', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works well, just be careful not to knock off the bulb covers!', 'author': 'Londonese', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Easy to set up if you have a board to work from, but it is difficult to conceal the cabling, unless you don't mind it on the surface of the panel. I had mounted the lights on the board surrounding the mirror, rather than on the mirror itself. The snap on arrangement of the bulb covers make it easy to put on, but also easily removed if knocked against.The colour of the white light is as you would want it to be by default - and matches the other lights we already had in the room. Needless to say that colour temperature for make-up is pretty important!All-in-all - for the price and easy of installation and the quality of the temperature of the lighting and the even distribution of the light, this gets a recommendation - only knocking one star off for the build quality of the covers / mounts.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Hutch lights', 'author': 'Deziz World', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I got these to replace the light fixture in my hutch that no longer works. These are great. There are 3 different light color options, yellow, blue white and white. They can be very dim or very bright. Because they stick on they can all be applied to one level or different levels. Really updates my hutch and gives light to things that haven't seen it in a while. Great option at a great price (14.99).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Provides the extra lighting my bathroom mirror area needed', 'author': 'ashley macwilliams', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. First I want to mention how easy it is to set up. I was almost finished when I realized I did it the hard way.First place the adhesive strips were you want the bulbs to be placed, then press the bulbs on to the adhesive.Once all the bulbs are secure to the mirror twist them. The bulbs will turn the wire inside the miniature fixture to discretely hide wiring.Now all that said I will say they could have done a much better job with the wire retention.As you can see in my video I was unable to get a perfect straight alignment with the wire which makes it look funky and cheap.No matter how many times I turn the bulbs I can’t get rid of the slack completely.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: The Mirror
reviews: [{'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Mostly vibes, less narrative', 'author': 'Derek Metcalf', 'rating': 3, 'content': "In Tarkovsky style this movie requires an open mind with respect to traditional narrative structure. The sequences are deliberately disjoint, sometimes giving a sense of mania even though most individual shots are slow. The fourth wall is occasionally self-referentially cracked with shadows of a boom mic and the suggestion that the movie is at least partially autobiographical. This is absolutely not for everyone, which is why I hesitate giving it more stars despite liking it quite a bit. You have to know what you're getting into.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Unique directors stand the test of time', 'author': 'Curated Essentials', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The movie is more art than your average flick and I loved it. The picture quality is amazing and I can’t believe this was shot and or released in 1976. The color palette, the subtle wind blowing grasses and tree leaves, the extended sequences with no dialogue make this a unique experience. Highly recommend and we plan on seeking out other Tarkovsky movies.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

It did not fog up at all and though all plastic it is well designed and made well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Sticks really well to the sliding shower door, but anti-fog properties were gone in two weeks :(', 'author': 'Sock', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I got this shower mirror because I color my hair and I keep it touched up with color-depositing conditioner. However, just applying it willy-nilly over my head leads to some patchiness, so I figured a mirror would help me make sure I applied everything evenly.I really like this mirror. The suction is STRONG. It’s super easy to adjust the mirror and not worry about it falling off on your foot or smashing on the ground. The anti-fog was also amazing while it worked. The mirror stayed crystal clear for the first two weeks, but now it fogs up after a while. Not as badly as a regular mirror, and not as quickly, but I’m still disappointed. I haven’t touched the mirror surface so I don’t think I could have disrupted the anti-fog coating.The razor holder is great too. Overall, this should have been an easy 5 stars, but I’m disappointed that the anti-fog stopped working so soon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Needs glue', 'author': 'Nicole Worker', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The sticky part didn't really work. It kept falling off the wall. Had to super glue it. Otherwise it's nice, doesn't fog up at all. Could be bigger.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not for me but seems to do the trick!', 'author': 'Amanda', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've slowly been de-bachelor-padding my boyfriends apartment. I ordered us some shelves and lamp for the shower, and the boyfriend got excited about the concept of shaving his head & face with the extra light and being able to see what he's doing instead of finishing the job over the bathroom sink. He asked if I could find him a fogless mirror because he prefers his temperatures at diabolical, suffocating degrees.I typically go for the lowest priced products so long as the reviews aren't abysmal, but decided to purchase this slightly more expensive mirror because I know his patience would wane if it wasn't truly fogless. Let me tell you, it absolutely is.The quality is solid - actually amazingly so. I first tried installing it in a central point across from the showerhead where we could both use it (he's about a foot taller than myself) but neglected to pay attention to the seams of the tiles, so the suction cup failed, fell and it did NOT break. Color me impressed! Now being properly placed, the suction cup is solid enough that we can both manhandle the mirror to our respective heights without fear of it falling.The razor-hanging feature has several slots so we can both hang and preserve the quality of our razors without taking up precious shelf space. The suction cup also places the mirror several inches off of the wall (think Michael Scott's plasma TV), so you don't have to risk your life leaning forward if you have the eyesight of a mole.Hoping this mirror will last us quite some time, but when it does go, this is the mirror we'll be ordering again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall very nice Mirror', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It has disclaimer about fogging and how to address that is the only thing that is a bit annoying sometimes otherwise great mirror. Was a bit concerned that it would hold with the suction cup but have had it installed over a month with no issues. Like the razor holder has multiple spots for both my wife and myself', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'Christina H', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got these a year or two ago for my husband to shave in the shower. They're easy to clean and they have worked well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent', 'author': 'This is boat', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I gave it four stars because of the price, they scratch easy and the hole is bigger than I expected, what do you expect for a few bucks? Hang this with the hook in the shower. When you go to shave, rinse the FRONT AND BACK of the mirror. The water temperature heats up BOTH sides, and then it does not fog (for about 5-10 minutes). reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Slim, Beautiful, and Awesome Compact Mirror', 'author': 'SG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you were going to design a perfect compact mirror to carry in purse, car, pocket, wallet, anyplace - this would be it. title: Makeup Mirror with Lights, 2-Sided Vanity Mirror with 1X/10X Magnification Rechargeable 3 in 1 Hand Held Desk and Hanging Lighted Mirror 3 Colors Lighting Stepless Dimming for Home
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I’ve been looking for this for years!', 'author': 'sweetpeamama', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love to travel, but the thing I miss the most from home (besides my pets), is my vanity mirror, a lighted, 2-sided 1x on one side, full 10x on the other on a decent height stand. Putting my makeup on is so much more of a chore on vacation! I’d bring my mirror from home if I had the room!I have bought numerous travel mirrors over the years and here are all the downsides: too small, too dim (or no lighting at all), uses batteries that I’m afraid will die on the trip, doesn’t stand up at a good height. And what’s up with the 1x only mirrors (unless you want one of those stupid, tiny round stick-on 10x mirrors to put on the corner of the 1x mirror? I am 49 and need a ton of magnification to put on mascara and make sure my foundation and concealer are blended properly.I just received this today, so I haven’t used it yet but am already so excited I have to share!1) It’s solid and can be used as a handheld or with a decent built-in stand that can be moved in many angles. It feels like the joints are properly tight but flexible enough to move. Hope this continues.2)The mirror itself is an impressive diameter for a travel-size so I can comfortably see what I need to3)Full 1x on one side and FULL 10x on the reverse side!!!! Thank you!!4)What seems to be nice bright lighting visible on both sides5)Comes with a USB cable for charging (but not a power box)6)Comes with a protective bag for travel7)Space-saving size for packing considering all that this mirror can doI can’t wait to try this mirror out on my next trip!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars portable LED make up mirror', 'author': 'Vivian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "OMG I love this mirror. because it can be folded And the size is suitable too With three lighting effects Really friendly for people who need makeup. There was a discount when I bought it I think it's really worth the money. Plus, I really like that it comes with a bag and lens cleaning cloth. It’s so thoughtful for a beauty who loves to be clean. Finally, I sincerely recommend everyone to buy it", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love love', 'author': 'shawn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My grand daughter love this', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it', 'author': 'Vivian', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Three adjustable lighting back 10x mirrors are especially suitable for eyebrow repair', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect makeup mirror', 'author': 'The Dude Abides', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My daughter is 11, going on 18 and has gotten into skincare and beauty products. Her bedroom isn't very big, so it'd be hard to fit a vanity in there, so we were on the hunt for a mirror for her. This one has several light settings - very bright and it dims from there. Both sides are mirrors; one side is a normal mirror, but the other side is an extreme closeup - highly magnified, to where you can see anything on your face quite well. The handle folds so that it has a stand and on the handle is a USBC port to charge it with - it'll last 2-3 days getting used occasionally each day, at least that's how it's worked out of the box for us. It comes in a travel bag, but it's a soft bag, so you'll have to be careful where you put it in your bag if you travel with it. Overall, it's fairly compact in size and does what it says it should.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very convenient', 'author': 'Pink Pearl', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like the size , few different light options. title: Mirrors
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good film, better service.', 'author': 'Mike S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Mirrors was an okay film, but the speed with which I received it was even better. Great vendor!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love Kiefer Sutherland', 'author': 'Laura R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Best scary movie ever love it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Suspenseful movie!', 'author': 'Laura S. That being said, it was a unique story, but I hated how it ended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars THE BEST MIRRORS MOVIE', 'author': 'wa buyer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'THIS WAS A GOOD MOVIE--I GOT MIRRORS 2 FROM A DISCOUNT STORE. THIS MOVIE IS BETTER NOT JUST BECAUSE IT WAS THE FIRST BUT IT WAS ALSO NOT PREDICTABLE AS MOVIE#2 WAS PREDICTABLE..IT YOU LIKE A GOOD SCARY MOVIE, THIS IS IT.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Reflections…', 'author': 'Einsatz', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This movie teaches a valuable lesson, never trust a mirror…especially after a certain age. In this case, something in the mirror(s) is holding a grudge. It’s trapped and it wants to get out. Unfortunately, the only one who can solve the mystery of the mirrors has serious anger issues and he takes forever to almost figure it out. As horror movies go, this one has a low threshold of fright. I liked it to a point, right when it began to wander…', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Underrated.', 'author': 'TTT', 'rating': 5, 'content': "A truly excellent quality film. Underrated, It's a wonder why, how, I have not heard of this before? My girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed the film.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reflection of Fear', 'author': 'Santeria', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I saw the Theatrical version the first weekend out and thoroughly enjoyed MIRRORS.I did feel that something was missing, and once again the Unrated Version has proven to be the gold standard.MIRRORS UNRATED packages both the Theatrical and the Unrated together, so you can see the two edits of the film on the same disk.Fabulously Eerie with its supernatural elements, the story brings you through the experience as we come to the final terrifying twist in the story. The disk is made for a 5.1 setup with its great audio, and specifically its ghostly audio that adds much to its spectacularly spookiness. Kiefer's performance brings up a brilliant scare. Its an excellent watch.DVD: Great extras.I don't agree with the deletes but thats the fun of the movies. The making of show a great deal of how this scare-fest was put together. HAVE FUN !!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2009', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars srorriM', 'author': 'Franci', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is probably not the most brilliant and original film, not to mention a couple of plot holes in it. I wasn't looking for the most brilliant and original story, and those minor holes imo were a way of leaving some things up to the viewer, for your own imagination. I'm really into creepy atmosphere and something that toys with the psyche and then leaves it up to me to figure some things out, suspense. This had all those elements. It's also an interesting storyline with a couple twists. There's really good acting, makeup and effects, and cinematography (not to mention I'm a Kiefer fan).In my opinion it's 4.5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2009', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars What does one see?', 'author': 'Sarah H.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This was a spooky movie.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The Unrated Version is "The Definitive" Version', 'author': 'Dyers_Eve', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I rented this and it was pretty cool but a few scenes bugged me and I kinda laughed at how fake the fire looked in one scene in particular.The I said what the heck and bought it. I was surprised the version I'd seen was NOT the unrated version. I'll be honest the bath tub scene and the sheer scariness and brutality of it was enough to get me to purchase this dvd and for that I am not dissapointed, despite several flaw in both the script, the story and the effects. The thing that bothers me the most is this movie had the potential to be truly terrifying. From the trailer I saw it had potential written all over it and things got kinda fumbled on the potential part but i still an entertaining film thanks to Keifer and Amy Smart.If you had gotten to know his sister more, and really like her, perhaps she coudlve even had a bigger part? then the bathtub scene would have been that much more tramatic and gruesome and have garnered Keifer a bit more sympathy from us movie watchers. There's no reason at all togo with the theatrical version...Pity...", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2009', 'is_verified': True}]

I have a full mirror in the bathroom on the wall of the counter where the sink is located but I have to lean in to get my contact lenses which places stress on my knees and lower back. The solution was this beautiful illuminated free-standing mirror. Convenient features include 10X magnification, solid stainless steel construction, and a soft, even ring light. No more knee and lower back pain! Of course, it\'s great for make-up and will integrate with most decor in the bathroom or bedroom.The only CON I can think of is that it wasn\'t meant for travel. It\'s a sizeable 9" diameter mirror Certainly, it\'s portable. If you wanted to move it from the bathroom to your make-up vanity, that\'s fine but if you wanted to drop it into your suitcase for a trip, it\'s a bit bulky and may be damaged en route.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Large, Bright & Clear Mirror', 'author': 'Kristiane', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Where do I start....This is an overall great mirror.It is clearer than any other mirror like this that I have had. The 10X magnifying side is very crisp and clear. Some I have had, the magnifying side always seemed to have a slight blur to it and it was annoying. Not this one, it is very clear. Love that.I love the touch to light up part as my other ones have a button on side and this makes it so much easier to use. You just tap once for the first setting, tap again for the next, if you want, you tap once then hold and the light will either decrease or increase the amount of light for that setting. So you can control how bright you want that settings light to be.It is very sturdy with a great weight to it but yet very easy to pick up and move if needed. It is rechargeable which is great for saving on buying batteries.This came shipped very quickly and very nicely to ensure no damage during shipping.If you are looking for a nice size mirror where you can see your whole head, plus it being clear and visible, this mirror is it. I haven't found one flaw with it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Big Mirror', 'author': 'William Taylor', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Big mirror and nice brightness for the light. Quality is nice. Switch and charging port are ‘interesting’ in their placement, but work well. I was impressed by the protective packaging as well. Glad to have this mirror!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High-quality and very bright upgrade from unlighted mirrors', 'author': 'Elle M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'High-quality and very bright upgrade from unlighted mirrors. I upgraded from an unlighted 8" mirror and the difference between both those mirrors is basically night and day. I didn\'t realize how much of a difference just 1 inch in diameter would make but it makes doing my makeup so much easier!The built in ring light is also great and super bright. Before with my unlighted mirror, I would need to turn on all the lights in the room and it still wasn\'t bright enough but with this, I have all the light that I need. Literally perfect.The only downside to this mirror is that it is harder to spin but that will probably loosen up with time since it\'s brand new. Personally I only use one side of the the mirror 99% of the time anyway.Assembly is really easy, just screw in the base.Weight is solid. If anything it takes a little effort to lift and move around but that\'s better than being too light and falling over.5 stars, highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: The Mirror
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent and very scary horror movie!', 'author': 'Phil', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was actually tiring a little of 'found-footage' movies after viewing a spate of recent ones that were poorly made, badly written and just plain implausible!And then I watched The Mirror.I thought it was an absolutely brilliant and genuinely frightening horror movie. I haven't felt so scared watching a horror movie in years! It literally gave me chills.To begin with I found the story of the three flatmates attempting to capture some spooky footage rather entertaining - they're all fantastic, very natural actors and the interplay between them was highly watchable. But as events started getting out of hand, as a result of the ominous mirror, I found myself being drawn into the chilling narrative to the point of feeling like I was watching a nightmare being played out on the screen. The 'found-footage' style evoked such a sense of dread that I felt like I was actually watching one of my own nightmares. The third act of the film is an absolute masterclass in tension, suspense and disturbing, unsettling filmmaking - and all achieved with no music score!I haven't had this kind of a reaction to a horror movie in a long time and it was really refreshing to watch something that actually scared me. Structurally and stylistically The Mirror is an excellent horror film and I'd recommend it to all horror fans - even if, like me, you'd become disillusioned with 'found-footage' - The Mirror should shine you back onto them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2015', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good movie, dumb ending', 'author': 'Hermanator', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Do all scary movies have to end the same these days!! SO boring!! BUT the movie has a good creepy vibe to it. It's a slow burn but I actually enjoyed it. I of course was ready for the stupid ending, as that's what I expect from all horror movies these days. So I just learn to enjoy the movie and hate the ending. I could also do without all the gore. I like to be scared but gore does nothing for me. My thoughts though are ..... why didn't they call the police when he went missing? Why didn't they call an ambulance for Jemma? I mean, I know horror movies wouldn't be good without dumb people but to me, that is a no brainer! So could it be better? Yes. Could the ending have been A LOT better? Yes. Was it creepy and worth a watch? Yes.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Definitely worth a rental for low budget found footage supernatural films fans.', 'author': 'TomHunter1968', 'rating': 4, 'content': '** NO SPOILERS ** Well, I seem to be the only one who found this one fairly enjoyable!I\'ll be the first to admit it was not full of over the top, edge-of-your-seat thrills or scares (and there is one significant plot hole). Also, the movie description initially made me a bit irked in that I thought the marketing team was claiming something about the film\'s popularity (I see some reviewers also missed this), but I see now - having seen it - that it wasn\'t a phony attempt at claiming the film was all-abuzz on Twitter, etc - it\'s actually part of the plot itself, not movie hype.The movie is filled with a long series of low-key spooky moments that add up to an overall engaging and "believable" found footage experience. All three actors were quite good and the ACTING was certainly on the level of any low budget found footage film I\'ve seen (and I\'ve reviewed around 50 of them so far) including Blair Witch and Paranormal Activity.It helps, bit, too, if you know about the long-standing $1 million prize offered by James Randi, as this forms the basis of the film, especially as to why the kids hang in the for as long as they do, despite the events unfolding around them (no spoilers)...I found it absolutely worth a rental, especially if you enjoy slow-build, b-horror, found footage movies and not thrill-a-minute films.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars A Brief Inquiry into Horror Writing', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'So there\'s a concept in all narrative, but it\'s especially important in horror called "the lock in". It\'s when your characters are committed to the plot and can no longer just walk away from it at their convenience. The Blair Witch project, patron saint of these films has a lock in at a razor sharp 15 minutes in, though you don\'t know it until near the end when it\'s revealed that they can\'t leave the woods.Lock In\'s are important because they stop the audience from spending the entirety of the runtime asking "Why don\'t they just call the police/hospital". Hitchcock may have said \'they don\'t call the police because it\'s boring\', but he was also a genius working at the top of his craft. The rest of us mere mortals need to hold up the B and C movies with structure.I am, in general, pretty lenient towards found footage because it tends to pulpy by nature and thrown together by eager 20 somethings with about two thousand dollars between them. So I guess what I\'m saying is that I can forgive that The Mirror is 80 minutes of nothing happening followed by some Halloween store knife work - that\'s just what you *get* when you sign up for this sort of thing - but I can\'t find it in myself to forgive that the Lock In, the moment where the stakes are raised and people can\'t solve this issue by dialing the hospital doesn\'t happen until sixty holy crap minutes into a ninety minute film.Better luck next time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not the worst', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'but certainly not the best found footage out there. There were quite a few times I wondered if these people had access to phones since they never called for assistance at any time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Started strong', 'author': 'Another Amazon reviewer', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The movie started strong in my opinion but it never got past it and just went down hill. So much ridiculousness. At what point do you leave? At what point are you honest about what you are doing at night? At what point do you stop making jokes? Pure trash. I wouldn't waste you time with this at all. Don't want to give anything away, but after the first 1-2 occurrences, it is repetitive, not interesting and leading towards a basic ending.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars dont let the first 20 minutes fool you...', 'author': 'Daniel Yoranus', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'If you are looking for a super slick, high-budget horror movie this isn\'t the film for you, HOWEVER, my partner and I were SPOOKED from this one. I was not expecting much going into it, the first 15 or 20 minutes had me fairly convinced that "The Mirror" would be just another predictable, formulaic, low-budget horror film but thankfully, we were wrong! There were some really interesting, attention grabbing shots that made this film stand out above the others in the sea of B horror films. I thought that the dialog was far more believable and well-written than most other B horror films, honestly I thought the writing in this film was better than some blockbuster horror titles (though this isn\'t saying much). Well worth a watch if you aren\'t too afraid of found footage horror, mirrors, or the British!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Your Average Found Footage', 'author': 'Just Floating Through', 'rating': 2, 'content': "The Mirror is a found footage horror film with a supernatural premise. I've seen many found footage movies on Amazon Prime and I can safely say that this one is not hot garbage. On the flip side, neither is it groundbreaking.The movie is shot well and also well acted. The characters are likeable, which usually isn't the case for found footage movies. However, like many found footage movies the ending is open ended. I mean if you're looking for closure and finality, you shouldn't be watching found footage movies in general. The characters do make questionable choices; like when your friend starts sleep walking with a knife, now is the time to make a gameplan. Or when your friend goes missing for days, by 24 hours you should have contacted the police. But other than these discrepancies I don't really have an issue with the film. I can see how some may find it boring, as it is light on scares. I was intrigued enough to keep watching. And nothing to do with the story but the actress playing Jemma (her name is also Jemma) is gorgeous.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Almost a 5', 'author': 'Jonathan F.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'There is a little overacting and a very ugly lamp in an otherwise sharp apar-(flat) Im a big fan of found footage movies and this is nowhere near the worst of them.A super solid 7/10 in the same ballpark as Area 51 but it moves quicker. Great job! Scarier and more cohesive than expected!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Interesting twist on your average found footage films', 'author': 'Damon Palyka', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I was pleasantly surprised by this movie. 90% of these found footage movies are garbage with bad scripts and even worse acting. This one was actually good. The ending should have been longer and taken more than 5 minutes to "wrap up", but overall it\'s worth a watch and the actors are actually quite good!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2020', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Neck Mirror Needs To Be redesigned.', 'author': 'Aliaswink', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have order several and they are not well constructed but I have to have them to put color on my hair (sectioning off the back). the wings that hold the mirror are too flexible and after a bit of use the mirror drops out and breaks. I would hope the manufacturer could strengthen the base that holds the mirror so it doe snot fall out and break....this has happened three times with me....not just once but three!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 9, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars CHEAP!!!', 'author': 'ADSW', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Mirror wouldn't stay in holes. Very friendly, good communication and quick shipping.. But, ZERO stars for this product. I really should have paid better attention to those who gave low star reviews, because they really are true. This item should be sold very cheap at a flea market. What a poor imitation of what was once a really good product spanning several decades has become what you'd find in any common junk catalog arriving unsolicited in your post box. Horrible! This decline in quality is so typical of junk sold at highly inflated prices these days. The actual mirror, the reflective part, can be moved around with your finger in its frame. That frame, which has two little points to be inserted into the outer frame do not fit properly to hold the mirror in. If you push it into the holes, the mirror with frame will fall right out. Considering the ultra poor quality, the whole thing would break into pieces if it hit the floor. Everything others have said about the screw is absolutely right. It will not hold up to more than being adjusted a few times before the holes in this cheap plastic will wear out. Well, I won't bother myself packaging and returning this loser. So, please everyone, take heed of yet another warning regarding this totally useless piece. :((", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Round the Neck Mirror', 'author': 'FloridaCitizen', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I was glad to find this mirror.
