This does not work well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not what it used to be.', 'author': 'Lois Bowen', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I bought a plastic Rucci neck mirror about 20 years ago. It has served me well and would still be serving me if my husband hadn't sat on it! A couple of years ago I searched stores and the internet for a replacement neck mirror so I'd have one if mine broke. I could find nothing. I was so happy to find this mirror and at such a low price! I ordered it on Monday and it was here on Thursday. I'm very pleased with the quick delivery.However....I just opened the package and can see that this Rucci mirror is not made nearly as well as my original one. The plastic is much more flimsy and light weight. There is only one wing nut, where there were two places with wingnuts for adjustment on the old mirror. I could really tighten the wing nut on my first mirror by using a screwdriver in the groove in the head of the screw to hold it firmly while I twisted the wing nut. The screw on the new mirror has no groove, so I can see already that this will be a problem.Thankfully, I also ordered another brand of neck mirror from Amazon that is made of metal. I plan to use this at home and use the plastic Rucci for travel, so it won't get nearly as much use as my original mirror did. I could not style my hair without this type of mirror, so am very glad to have found not only one, but two!I haven't yet received the metal mirror, so can't compare them, but I don't know if I would recommend the Rucci for everyday use. It doesn't look like it will last very long.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2012', 'is_verified': True}]

manufacturer: Marlys Millhiser, Lynda Evans, et al.
title: The Mirror
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Two Great Time Travel Novels in One', 'author': 'Kenny G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just now finished this novel after only two days of reading - quite a feat to read a 383 page book in such a short time! As one who has a passion for social history, genealogy, and re-enacting, this work by Marlys Millhiser was right up my alley. I mean, to have the opportunity to travel back in time to meet one\'s ancestors, to experience life "as it was," and to know what the future would hold not only for this person but for the world, well, it tends to make the imagination run. The trouble is, in `The Mirror,\' Shay Garrett had absolutely no interest in the past, much less wanting to live there. She all but ignored her mother\'s family history stories, and could have cared even less about the way folks lived 78 years earlier. But, due to a mysterious mirror, Shay - the very up-to-date modern girl of 1978 - unwittingly finds herself living the life of her grandmother, Brandy McCabe, 78 years earlier, in 1900.The author did an absolute tremendous job in her social history research, giving very accurate accounts of what life was like in the year 1900, from slow travel and modes of dress to tools, furniture, bed sheets, sicknesses (like consumption, of which Shay has no idea what it is), and types of foods, as well as slow speech patterns and language usage. And poor Shay (now as Brandy) must conform to that life as well as the mores and morals of a very different time, a time when females had very little say in their lives. Miss Millhiser has used her words and research to paint a veritable picture of the past. No easy task and pretty much a rarity from many authors.Part two of this novel shows the new life that Brandy McCabe - Shay\'s grandmother - must live. Since her granddaughter, Shay, has inhabited her body 78 years earlier, Brandy has now entered Shay\'s body 78 years into her future, in 1978.This second part of the book is a bit disconcerting - many different and unexpected avenues are taken that, at times, I questioned where the author was going. But, what Miss Millhiser did very well once again was to describe in vivid detail the awe and wonder that the 20 year old "antiquated" Brandy (now in Shay\'s body) feels in this futuristic world with talking picture boxes, disco bars, automobiles, electric blankets...heck, she even learned (through a TV commercial) that she should shave her underarms and legs!But Brandy, like her granddaughter counterpart now hopelessly living in the past, is not fond of this new (to her) world, especially with its lack of morals (as she knew them to be), scanty clothing styles (bare arms and legs!), and tasteless food.Brandy definitely has a tougher time accepting her new role as Shay with its freedoms in 1978 than her granddaughter does in her new role as Brandy in 1900 with its constraints, which is surprising. But, I feel it is probably more realistic - morals and mores in the past were much stronger and deeper than today and I feel that Brandy would not so readily accept becoming the modern woman of today, like many others might feel she should have.Another interesting aspect to the two stories are the way the author intertwines the two girls lives through the mysterious mirror - their visions of each other\'s events and reactions fit like a puzzle. While reading Brandy\'s story I was constantly referring back to Shay\'s story during the mystery mirror scenes (you\'ll understand once you read the book).And finally, the middle interim for daughter/mother Rachael became a vital connection to the two stories.Marlys Millhiser did a remarkable job spinning this time-travel tale. Considering that this is not your average historical/modern novel, I would love to know how long it took her, from her initial idea through historical research to penning and then finally to publishing. Truly amazing.I must give thanks to Cindy who works in the Adams House at historic Greenfield Village, Michigan for `turning me on\' to this story. You were right!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2006', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Chinese Mirror -- a Fantasy/Horror Film!', 'author': "Critic's Corner", 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The Mirror, by Marlys MillhiserReally surprised a movie was never made on this interesting fantasy “time travel” story. Similar to the 1980 film Somewhere in Time, you don’t need a time machine to get a taste of the past. Unfortunately for Shay and Brandy, they get more than a taste!This is a story of two young women from the same family but separated by several decades of American “progress.” Shay is a free-spirited girl, whose ideas of sex and marriage would make any Victorian-era woman frump and fuss – and musical tastes as the Bee Gees might do that too.The story is actually the story of an Oriental mirror. Of unknown origin, it travels from one place to another, enticing its victims and makes itself known through the use of electricity and it’s many-fingered array along the edges of a very tall mirror. It hums and crackles with anticipation, pulling the viewer in to either (a) drive them insane to insanity or (b) switch them with others decades in the past or future.The author builds us up with a brief history of the mirror and also a major history of a family with its insanities, dysfunctionalism and crazy characters in the West – Colorado!Plots and Points:Shay is great as she tries to adapt to the past, wishing in some ways she paid better attention to her family history and American history as she confronts the Great Depression, the birth of twins and her own mother (yikes!) and the dawn of World War II (when was Pearl Harbor – December 11th or 7th? Oops).Most of the book revolves around Shay’s decisions: Will she mess up family history? What would Brandy do? Should she marry the man John McCabe wants her to marry? But Strock does not have the eyes that she has – or had. What of Rachael, her mother?Later in the book we get to know Rachael – a mother who loves her family’s past, struggles with a bad marriage, and now her mother just died in front of the wedding mirror. And now Shay is not herself. When Rachael discovers the truth, she goes a bit bonkers.However, the author does not develop this part of the story very much. Kinda drops Rachael as a main character and that’s just too bad. More could have been done there.The Brandy story is not as interesting – I think because we’re living where she’s living and can understand a person from 1900 not understanding disco or women’s’ rights or liberation. Not that interesting. Shay’s confrontation with her family’s past could lead to some unpleasant changes in her own future, so that adds tension and suspense to the plot.Meanwhile the Mirror continues to travel, affecting others through insanity and death. The horror aspect is not played up much – more of a historical fiction/fantasy story than a horror one.Bottom Line:Decent story, rolls along well with the Brandy/Shay/Rachael characters and how the Mirror affects them. Some dropped balls with the old man & his granddaughter, Rachael’s fate and a rushed ending with her future husband Marek. Overall, recommended!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars A magnificent time travel book, and so much more, right up there with Finney's Time and Again. Read it!!!", 'author': 'D. Safir', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I don\'t know what to say except that this is one of the best books I\'ve read on Kindle, and maybe one of the best books I\'ve ever read. I purchased it (apparently at a great discount at $1.99) as it was billed a horror novel. I would not call it that at all. There are some unexplained deaths in the book and a supernatural plot, but not real horror. It turned out to be much more than that. It is a time travel book, in the vein of Jack Finney\'s famous "Time and Again," the difference being that Finney\'s book also had a murder mystery plot, while this one doesn\'t. But it resembles it in that not only are we transported back in time, but the author has obviously done extensive research (she was a history major) into the times and places in the book, namely the Boulder, Colorado area around the turn of the twentieth century. The supernatural and time travel elements are definitely intriguing, but the characterizations, the writing style and the beautiful exposition of the life and times we\'re taken to are a wonder I\'ve rarely seen. Not surprising that this book was a sensation when it came out in 1979, and was the most stolen book in libraries as the time. I will not say much about the plot (which is as fascinating as the period piece), as that has been detailed extensively, already. You will be totally involved in the characters and will not want to put this book down until you find out what happens to them. I almost wish there was more of it. I definitely recommend this book.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not for everyone', 'author': 'C. G. King', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Let me offer some perceptions so you can judge for yourself whether you'll enjoy this book. I was swayed by the many positive reviews, but in the end wasn't satisfied with the read. I'm not a paranormal fan, but that part of the story didn't bother me. It was the mechanics and conclusions that did.Pros: Intriguing concept. Imagine living in your grandparents or great-grandparents time. The book does a good job of painting a pretty realistic picture of the hardships, attitudes and advantages of an earlier time period. I liked that it wasn't romanticized. Conversely, imagine living in the future and trying to deal with unimaginable technology advances and a different belief system. Not easy. And again, the book does a good job of conveying the difficulty as well as the appreciation of some `modern' advantages. Imagine living in a body and a life that isn't yours. That was handled really well.I thought the author did a good job of keeping things straight in the different time periods and handling the discomfort the protagonist/s felt about a situation that seemed unbelievable, but to them was disconcertingly real.Cons: I found the pace uncomfortably choppy, with many sudden point of view changes that had me rereading a lot. Some parts were covered in great detail and had a good engrossing flow, while others were glossed over so abruptly, I lost my concentration and often didn't retain that information well. Consequently, when that tidbit was addressed later I had only the barest recollection of having seen it before, which jarred me out of the story. It seemed as though the author wanted to include too much--more than was necessary to tell the story well. Multiple very brief scenes seemed randomly stuck in almost as an afterthought. Some had value, but most didn't. I found that annoying, but perhaps those more attuned to the sound bite style of media today might not find it a problem. In that regard, this book seems to have been written before its time. It fits in better with today's preferences, which perhaps explains its resurgence of popularity. I also wondered if the manuscript had been overly long and edited down to pre-defined size a little too ruthlessly.I found the ending unsatisfying. There were loose ends everywhere and it was depressing. Supposedly, the story was about the mirror, but it wasn't really, it was about the two women, who for unexplained reasons were treated differently by the mirror than everyone else. I found the bits about the mirror incidental and unnecessary, as though there was conscious effort to make the story about the mirror when it wasn't.Obviously, to read other reviews, many really enjoyed this book. Perhaps paranormal fans are more at home with how some things were handled. Sadly, it just didn't work for me although I truly did find the concept fascinating, and read the whole book with interest (coupled with some confusion). I can't say I don't recommend it, because it is thought provoking, but it is also flawed, so go in with open eyes.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2008', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not typical time travel but so worth the read', 'author': 'DebbieB', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First off, if you're looking for a normal time travel book with people having their own revolving door in time, or a classic time travel romance, this isn't it. Reading The Mirror in the 1970's set me on a path to reading (and enjoying) many of those books. This, however, is something deeper and darker. I was fascinated with it when I first read it and I still love it. But now, as a mother and grandmother, I appreciate it not only as time travel but also as tragedy and even (psychological) horror. The emotional implications of what a main character must bear are almost overwhelming. For both main character there are the requisite problems presented in time travel scenarios, living in and adapting to a strange time, but for for one, oh my. Many other people are affected by a character's knowledge of the future. As she wonders at one point, would something have happened if she didn't know that it would and followed that path. So, I've just erased half my review because I wouldn't want to have that knowledge prior to reading the book, and don't want to give away the twists that I found particularly painful. One final note. 40 years ago I didn't have to do this, but this time I found it helpful to make a scratchpad list as I went of who is/was/will be who and their relationships. It might keep a reader from thinking that the author was confused about her characters.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Hidden Gem', 'author': 'lindapanzo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This might well be my favorite book so far this year, of the 100+ books I\'ve read thus far. It\'s a time travel book but hard to categorize: Part science fiction/fantasy, part historical fiction, part romance, and part mystery.My all-time favorite book is Jack Finney\'s time travel book, Time and Again, and I have to say that The Mirror is my favorite time travel book since I read Time and Again all those years ago. I wish this book had been longer as I didn\'t want it to end. How this sat on my shelves, unread, for so long, is a mystery to me.Picture a young woman, on the verge of being married in 1978 (which was the present-day when it was written) being thrown back to inhabit her young grandmother\'s body in 1900 just as the grandmother was about to be married. Further, the young 1900 grandmother is brought forward to inhabit her 1978 granddaughter\'s body. It\'s the story of the grandmother, granddaughter, and their daughter/mother.For me, besides enjoying the story, I found it to be quite thought-provoking. I kept thinking about whether it\'d be tougher for a 1970s girl to go back and live life in the early 20th century or the early 20th century girl coming forward to live life in the late 1970s. I also wondered quite a bit about how, if this whole body switch thing could\'ve been reversed, whether that would that be a good thing, or not.This might well be one of the best books hardly anyone\'s ever heard of. Absolutely loved it and have been "talking it up" among my friends as a hidden gem they won\'t want to miss', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Highly recommend 👌', 'author': 'Trish', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Decidedly, I post this comment after reading this book over a year ago. Here's why. I still think about this book offten. I loved the rich history, the plot and I miss following the characters. However, I hated the way it seemed to be rushed at the end. I feel like the story could have ended in a different direction yet, I like that it wasn't predictable. I just wish it was played out in more detail. Definitely a good read!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars If you like time travel, you will like this one', 'author': 'Sharyn McQuaid', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I first read this book from the library when it first came out. I liked it a bit more then--it's really about a 4 1/2 this time around. I guess part of that for me is that Brandy from the past came into what was then current time (1978). It was not significant to me that Brandy and Marek didn't go further into the future. Now I would like them to develop their relationship, just as Shay did with Hutch. I guess Milhiser was seeing time as a corkscrew and Brandy and Shay switched places at parallel times in the continuum. But once Shay formed connections to the people and places in the pastime she realized she no longer wanted to return to her time. Milhiser maintained the device that Shay's mind was in Brandy's body and vice versa which covered the sticky problem of Rachel being raised by her daughter. Now that almost 40 years have past since I first read this, I would like to see Brandy and Marek and how he helped her adapt to her new time--an advantage that Shay never had.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Bizarre', 'author': 'AngeH', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'This was a really strange book - sort of "Back to the Future" meets "Freaky Friday." The premise was fascinating but the story was unevenly written. At first the whole timeline didn\'t make sense to me, until I realized that it was published in the 70\'s - and this also made me wonder if the author was maybe enjoying some herbal refreshment at the time.It\'s hard to even explain this crazy plot but I will try to summarize. In a nutshell, there is a mysterious and evil Chinese mirror that has been around for centuries, randomly killing people who look in it; or showing them scenes from the past or the future; or actually teleporting them around in time. During the mirror\'s tenure in the Garret family, it decides for fun to send Shay Garret, the "modern" girl, back in time to become her own grandmother. Shay\'s part of the story is quite interesting, with vivid descriptions of life in turn-of-the-century Boulder, Co. Even so, I had a hard time getting past the "ick" factor of someone essentially having sex with their own grandfather and giving birth to their own mother and uncles.I less enjoyed the story of Brandy, Shay\'s grandmother, who is transported to the future to become Shay. Her experiences could have been fascinating but the story completely derails here (following my earlier hypothesis, this may have been when the author graduated from weed to the harder stuff.) Shay - before Brandy inherited her body - apparently became pregnant. Fortunately, she is engaged to Marek, the father, who seems like a successful, nice guy who genuinely loves Shay. For reasons that are never explained or even hinted at, Shay\'s parents REALLY don\'t want her to marry Marek. Now that Shay has been acting "crazy" - because she is really Brandy, trapped in Shay\'s body and having trouble making sense of the situation and the modern world - when her parents find out about the pregnancy, they decide to have her committed and forced to have an abortion. WTF?? Shay/Brandy overhears the conversation where this is being decided, and she runs away.She somehow ends up living on a ramshackle farm with some old dude who lost his mind when his beloved wife passed away. He buried his wife in the backyard and names all his cats and farm animals after her. More WTF-ness.Shay\'s parents and fiance have been searching for her this whole time. Eventually they find her, and she gives birth to twins. Then inexplicably, despite Brandy having spent her whole time in Shay\'s world uninterested/repulsed by Marek, the novel ends with a completely out-of-nowhere sappy romantic ending.So I really don\'t know what to make of this crazy thing. Sometimes it was really interesting, but long stretches were boring and in general it was just a big mess.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Read it at least once! Maybe twice?', 'author': 'Steele', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This book is really hard to describe (especially without giving any spoilers...but I\'ll try my best). I thought it would be scarier than it was. The "Backward" at the beginning was a little spooky. But it was not really a suspense, horror, romance or thriller. At best I\'d place it in the historical fiction category with time traveling. You need to pay attention while reading as it jumps around a bit, and time passes quickly in some sections. The story is split into three parts and I believe I liked the middle the least as I didn\'t like Rachel\'s character much. As a fact I didn\'t particularly like Shay or Brandy much either. I did like the secondary characters a lot though, especially Thora K. I would have loved it if Millhiser had gone more into the backstory of the mirror, more than what was described in the "backward." And why does it kill some people but not others?This novel would be great for a book club. It\'s definitely discussion worthy. I might read it again in a few months to a year as I\'ll pick up on things that I may not have read the first time around.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2016', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Mavoro Magnifying Mirror with Suction Cups - Triple Suction Cup Stick on Mirror with 15X Magnification. Portable Travel Makeup Mirror, Magnified Cosmetic Mirror (15X)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good mirror..', 'author': "P'lope", 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought one a year ago and loved it. Great size for travel. Wouldn’t be without one.I love everything about this mirror.Also great for seeing the back of my head when cutting my own hair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works well', 'author': 'Denise M', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Size is great. It magnifies really well with no distortion except for a couple of millimeters at the circumference.7x is perfect. (I replaced a 10x mirror and 7x is much better for seeing more of my face yet at a really ideal magnification.)There are 3 surprisingly large suction cups. I attached it to a regular mirror on a cabinet, and it’s not going anywhere! I considered testing it on the tiles in my shower which are notoriously fickle about suction cups, but it’s really hard to take off the mirror now! I suspect they would hold well in a shower too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome', 'author': 'Diana', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great mirror. I like the 7x it is a perfect magnification 10x is to strong and 5x is not strong enough. It's hard to find a 7x in the stores they are always sold out and I lost my other 7x and was looking for another one. This is a very nice mirror has good suction and is great for any need.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Issue with suction cups', 'author': 'SMP', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Mirror is great but having an issue with suction sticking cups on window when I want lots of natural light.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great image, suction cups seem to work well, and reasonable price', 'author': 'andymand', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We\'re in the home stretch of a recent bathroom remodel and the old medicine cabinet off to the side of the sink had a door to which I\'d secured an old magnifying mirror with a couple Command Strips. This allowed me to open the door, attend to some close-up grooming, close the door, and nobody would be the wiser because the mirror was attached to the inside of the door.Unfortunately, that old medicine cabinet went away in the remodel and was replaced with an in-wall, but doorless medicine cabinet. While we added three other medicine cabinets on an adjacent wall, the orientation of their mirrored doors (perpendicular to the wall in front of me) prevented my sticking my old magnifying mirror on the inside of one of those doors because I\'d then have to lean and twist my torso to use it, so no go. (In the interest of avoiding confusion with the magnifying mirror), I will hereafter refer to these mirrored doors as "glass" in this review.)The main options available to me were:- Wall-mount mirror: I\'d rather not poke holes in our brand-new walls.- Freestanding mirror: the vanity is small (like 24" x 24"), so not a lot of free counter space.- Suction-cup mirror: I could attach it to the glass directly behind the vanity/sink.The third route seemed like the best one, so I ordered the 7x version of this item and, as usual, it arrived pretty quickly.I was a little worried that its suction cups might be flimsy, but they seem decent. I also saw some reviews questioning the magnification power and I don\'t even know how I\'d know if it was 5x or 7x or 6.318x, but when I test-fit things by holding the mirror up to the glass and leaning a little over the sink, I was pleased with the arrangement. I could see my nostrils and ears quite clearly and that was the plan.Side-note: before attaching the magnifying mirror to the glass, I gently rotated its three suction cups so that the little tab was near the circumference of the mirror. This would allow me to grab each tab when the time came to remove the mirror, whenever that might be.Another note: Before applying the three suction cups to the glass, I gently rubbed a small amount of "oil" from my finger on to each suction cup, as I believe that a super-light film of oil increases the quality of the seal the cup makes on the glass. Now that I reflect on it, I realize that might be an urban legend, but it hasn\'t fallen yet. (Admittedly, it\'s just been a few hours.)The magnifying mirror was reasonably priced and I see no flaws or distortion in the image. If the suction cups stay put for a while (I might give the entire thing a gentle pull every few months to see if it\'s about ready to give way), this item meets my needs perfectly. Thanks!(And I guess I should be super-clear: I\'ve received nothing free, no discount, no coupon, nothing in exchange for any aspect of this review; I paid for this item entirely by myself.)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 22, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel', 'author': 'Linda Lou', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I slip this in a small padded bag, and bring it out all my trips. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very well designed', 'author': 'Peter C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well thought out, including the little "tabs" on the suction cups for easy removal. Now I can tweeze my brows and deal with blemishes without needing housemates to clear things off for a stand-up mirror. The mirror itself is clear and magnifies very well, and wipes off easily. In the past, I could not find strong enough suction cups. Unfortunately, this mirror has the same problem. Per description, mirror can be attached to tile or glass; it fell from both within hours. We cleaned both with soap and rubbing alcohol; did not help. So if you are looking for a mirror that can be hung on suction cups, I would not recommend this one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing suction power!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My bathroom has no counter space to put a free standing magnifying makeup mirror. At 6" in diameter, it\'s a good size and there\'s little distortion to your image as long as you keep your \'work area\' in the middle of the mirror. And I need as much magnification as I can get, so I was thrilled that this came in a 10x magnification. The only thing better than the price has been the suction. I should have cleaned the mirror I stuck it to and should have wet the suction cups before I adhered it to the mirror. I didn\'t do either of those things and this mirror has not budged since I put it up 4 weeks ago.You could probably use it for travel, but it doesn\'t come with a carrying case. I\'m always nervous about packing a mirror unless it has a carrying case. I would pay a few dollars more if they included that with the mirror.Overall, I am very happy with the mirror and highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars No great', 'author': 'Mayra', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Very bad quality materials. title: Wall Mirror Full Length Mirror for Wall,Home Gym Mirror 14''x12'' x 12PCS, Glass Frameless Body Mirror Wall-Mounted for Gym, Bedroom, Living Room, Over The Door
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very useful mirror, saves space, no image distortion', 'author': 'Mahanu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I didn’t want to spend a lot on full length mirror and chose this one instead . For a sticker , it looks really like a mirror , no image distortion at all . I recommend this', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PERFECT FOR MY PROJECT', 'author': 'Jay', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wanted to make a “mirror-window” on a low budget and these worked great. ALL 12 pieces arrived perfectly packaged. Stuck them to freshly painted wall then used pvc window casing around them and pvc spacers in between. Go big or go home👍', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy-ish install, decent price', 'author': 'Anon', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I installed this in my basement office directly across from a white accent wall to help brighten up the room because I experimented with a paint color that was a little too dark. I think it works for what I wanted it to do.The install wasn\'t too bad, I actually didn\'t look at the instructions because I couldn\'t be bothered to look up the QR code in the "instruction manual". It took me about ~1hr putting it up solo. I wasn\'t too fussy about being a perfectionist, once I measured and place the first mirror I just used a spacer (my leveler) and eye-balled a lot of it. If I had another person to help, I could have put it up in ~40 minutes and I could have been more precise.Tip: once you have the adhesive on the back of the mirror, place one edge on the wall with the mirror ~perpendicular to the wall so the adhesive is NOT touching. Use your leveler or tape markings to make sure the edge is perfectly horizontal or vertical (depending on which edge you chose. If you have something to brace against this next part will be easier, for my I used my leveler. Pivot the mirror towards the wall slowly, watching to make sure the edges are lined up and gently press it into the wall. The adhesive tape is quite sticky and it will be difficult to make any adjustments once the adhesive is touching the wall.The instructions specifically say that the adhesive tape and the adhesive glue are both permanent, but you can get command line strips (sold separately) to make the mirrors removable.The mirrors are 1/2 - 1/4 the thickness of a typical bathroom mirror. They\'re thin enough that they can bend slightly, warping the reflection so the image will be slightly less than perfect. It\'s possible this is mitigated by using the glue instead of the tape, since the mirror will have little or no space between it and the wall - I used the tape.Also they give you plenty of adhesive, they sent me 3 tubes of adhesive glue and 2 pages of adhesive tape that are cut up into squares. I used 4 squares, one for each corner of the mirror, and had 60 squares left over, so you could easily put 8+squares on, but be aware that adjusting a mirror after placing 4 adhesive squares onto the wall was nearly impossible.Mirrors can be quite expensive, so I think the price is reasonable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars cute', 'author': 'Anna', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love how it looks in my room, and was cheap and easy. be careful though because I cut my finger putting it up but that’s probably user error. also there are no instructions so I kinda guessed. anywho it’s cute and easy and cheaper than buying other mirrors.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars FUN HOUSE MIRRORS', 'author': 'laura', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'These were easy to install, and the glass was definitely glass, however, they are all different types of glass. In one mirror panel I look extremely skinny, in the one beside it, I look short and squatty. It is HORRIBLE, and It is installed permanently on my wall. My husband is very upset that I did this. He would love it if they were actually decent mirrors, but they are far from it. I have never seen so many different types of reflections. It is crazy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Soso', 'author': 'Torrien Henderson', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Not enough', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love the mirrors!', 'author': 'Queen SC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good quality product. Definitely glass/mirror and didn’t come scratched or broken. Ordering one more to extend across my wall lol. I really turned my room out', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Installation', 'author': 'JANICE ALLEN', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'There are no dislikes, but I would rather have a floor mirror', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Bad distortion', 'author': 'Roopa', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'They were easy to install (and difficult to remove), but they distorted images so much they were basically unusable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Decent mirrors. Adhesive very strong', 'author': 'Sean C', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'These are pretty solid especially for the price. Though definitely use command strips to mount if you want them to come off. The included foam adhesive is quite strong. I broke one of mine while trying to take them down to move.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Mavoro Magnifying Mirror with Suction Cups - Triple Suction Cup Stick on Mirror with 7X Magnification. Portable Travel Makeup Mirror, Magnified Cosmetic Mirror with Cloth. Mirrors for Dorm Decor
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good mirror..', 'author': "P'lope", 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought one a year ago and loved it. Great size for travel. Very nice quality mirror. 7x is just right for putting on make up. Suction cups were great, never had an issue. I recently left it stuck to a hotel mirror and had to order a new one. I had issues with the suction cups when I first used it, but cleaned them and after that it was fine. Would definitely recommend... Hopefully I won't leave this one behind", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Still working well after many years. No scratches. Never has fallen off mirror.', 'author': 'Mark', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's a great size (large) with good magnification and no weird distortion (due to its larger diameter). It has never loosened from the bathroom mirror. I think it's probably too big for travel for most people. Good value.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Movable and sturdy, plus nice looking.', 'author': 'collette savasuk', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have 2 of these mirrors. They are great for applying makeup. Wouldn’t be without one.I love everything about this mirror.Also great for seeing the back of my head when cutting my own hair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works well', 'author': 'Denise M', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Size is great. It magnifies really well with no distortion except for a couple of millimeters at the circumference.7x is perfect. (I replaced a 10x mirror and 7x is much better for seeing more of my face yet at a really ideal magnification.)There are 3 surprisingly large suction cups. I attached it to a regular mirror on a cabinet, and it’s not going anywhere! I considered testing it on the tiles in my shower which are notoriously fickle about suction cups, but it’s really hard to take off the mirror now! I suspect they would hold well in a shower too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome', 'author': 'Diana', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great mirror. I like the 7x it is a perfect magnification 10x is to strong and 5x is not strong enough. It's hard to find a 7x in the stores they are always sold out and I lost my other 7x and was looking for another one. This is a very nice mirror has good suction and is great for any need.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Issue with suction cups', 'author': 'SMP', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Mirror is great but having an issue with suction sticking cups on window when I want lots of natural light.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great image, suction cups seem to work well, and reasonable price', 'author': 'andymand', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We\'re in the home stretch of a recent bathroom remodel and the old medicine cabinet off to the side of the sink had a door to which I\'d secured an old magnifying mirror with a couple Command Strips. This allowed me to open the door, attend to some close-up grooming, close the door, and nobody would be the wiser because the mirror was attached to the inside of the door.Unfortunately, that old medicine cabinet went away in the remodel and was replaced with an in-wall, but doorless medicine cabinet. While we added three other medicine cabinets on an adjacent wall, the orientation of their mirrored doors (perpendicular to the wall in front of me) prevented my sticking my old magnifying mirror on the inside of one of those doors because I\'d then have to lean and twist my torso to use it, so no go. (In the interest of avoiding confusion with the magnifying mirror), I will hereafter refer to these mirrored doors as "glass" in this review.)The main options available to me were:- Wall-mount mirror: I\'d rather not poke holes in our brand-new walls.- Freestanding mirror: the vanity is small (like 24" x 24"), so not a lot of free counter space.- Suction-cup mirror: I could attach it to the glass directly behind the vanity/sink.The third route seemed like the best one, so I ordered the 7x version of this item and, as usual, it arrived pretty quickly.I was a little worried that its suction cups might be flimsy, but they seem decent. I also saw some reviews questioning the magnification power and I don\'t even know how I\'d know if it was 5x or 7x or 6.318x, but when I test-fit things by holding the mirror up to the glass and leaning a little over the sink, I was pleased with the arrangement. I could see my nostrils and ears quite clearly and that was the plan.Side-note: before attaching the magnifying mirror to the glass, I gently rotated its three suction cups so that the little tab was near the circumference of the mirror. This would allow me to grab each tab when the time came to remove the mirror, whenever that might be.Another note: Before applying the three suction cups to the glass, I gently rubbed a small amount of "oil" from my finger on to each suction cup, as I believe that a super-light film of oil increases the quality of the seal the cup makes on the glass. Now that I reflect on it, I realize that might be an urban legend, but it hasn\'t fallen yet. (Admittedly, it\'s just been a few hours.)The magnifying mirror was reasonably priced and I see no flaws or distortion in the image. If the suction cups stay put for a while (I might give the entire thing a gentle pull every few months to see if it\'s about ready to give way), this item meets my needs perfectly. Thanks!(And I guess I should be super-clear: I\'ve received nothing free, no discount, no coupon, nothing in exchange for any aspect of this review; I paid for this item entirely by myself.)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 22, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel', 'author': 'Linda Lou', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I slip this in a small padded bag, and bring it out all my trips. I’m a flight attendant, so always in hotels, and they often don’t have make up mirrors or a bright enough light. I’ll attach this to the existing mirror in the bathroom, or even bring it out into the room where the light is better. 7x what is the perfect magnification. I bought the 10x at first, and it was too powerful and it made me dizzy!Just remember not to leave it behind if you travel with it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Look great', 'author': 'JJ', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I like the size and magnification of this mirror. Too bad it's made in China", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Magnification is too much', 'author': 'Biscuit', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Pro: I like the three suction cups because the mirror I had before only had two and would fall off the bathroom mirror from time to time.Con: 10X magnification is really too much. It's not necessary and that much magnification will show you things you really don't want to see. Plus you can only see a small part of your face at one time.The other bad thing is there is no adjusting the angle of the mirror. You have to be right on top of it. If you're putting this mirror on your bathroom mirror or on a wall behind a sink or cabinet don't think you can see anything unless you lean way into it and stand on your tiptoes.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Great purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works as Expected', 'author': 'Dr.JD', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This mirror and the mini mirror are functional and convenient. We cannot comment on how long this Chinese production wonder will actually work so 4 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel', 'author': 'Deepal Patel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect for travel. Battery lasts for 2 weeks with daily use. The size is perfect and the light is nice and bright!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I was looking for', 'author': 'Lee Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently got my hands on this travel mirror and let me tell you, it\'s an absolute game-changer for my beauty routine on the go! This lighted makeup mirror has everything you could ever need and more.First off, let\'s talk about versatility. With three different light modes - cool, natural, and warm - and adjustable brightness, I can achieve the perfect lighting for any occasion with just the touch of a button. Whether I\'m doing my makeup in a dimly lit hotel room or under bright natural sunlight, this mirror has me covered.And speaking of convenience, this mirror is designed with travel in mind. Its compact size (7.5"L x 5.1"W) and lightweight design make it easy to slip into my luggage or handbag, and the included waterproof bag adds an extra layer of protection. Plus, the 180° adjustable stand allows me to find the perfect angle for applying makeup wherever I am.One of the best features of this mirror is its rechargeable battery. With just 2 hours of charging, I can enjoy 180-300 minutes of use, making it perfect for long trips or busy days out and about. And thanks to the Type-C charging interface and included cable, recharging is a breeze no matter where I am.But perhaps the most impressive thing about this mirror is its smart sensor switch and memory function. The mirror automatically turns on when I open the stand and off when I close it, saving energy and ensuring that the battery lasts as long as possible. Plus, the memory function means that it remembers my preferred light mode every time I use it, so I can pick up right where I left off.Overall, I couldn\'t be happier with this travel mirror. It\'s compact, versatile, and incredibly convenient, making it the perfect companion for any beauty enthusiast on the go. Whether you\'re traveling the world or just heading out for a night on the town, this mirror has everything you need to look and feel your best.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Game changer', 'author': 'HerculesSingh', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The GIMBELEN Travel Makeup Mirror with Light and Mini 10x Magnifying Mirror is a versatile and compact beauty accessory designed to enhance your makeup routine on the go. Here's a breakdown of its features:Portability: The mirror's foldable design makes it perfect for travel, ensuring you can easily slip it into your bag or suitcase without taking up much space.Lighting Options: With three adjustable light colors, including warm, natural, and cool, you can customize the illumination to suit various environments and makeup needs. Whether you're in a dimly lit room or natural daylight, this mirror has you covered.Dimmable: The dimmable feature allows you to adjust the brightness level according to your preference, ensuring optimal lighting for flawless makeup application.Smart Sensor: The inclusion of a smart sensor adds convenience by automatically turning the lights on/off when you open/close the mirror, saving battery life and ensuring hassle-free operation.Rechargeable LED: Say goodbye to disposable batteries. This mirror is equipped with a rechargeable LED, providing eco-friendly and cost-effective power solutions for long-term use.Adjustable Stand: The adjustable stand offers flexibility, allowing you to position the mirror at the perfect angle for effortless makeup application or grooming tasks.Mini 10x Magnifying Mirror: The addition of a mini 10x magnifying mirror is a game-changer for intricate tasks like tweezing eyebrows or applying precise eyeliner, providing a closer view for impeccable results.Design: Available in a stylish pink hue, this mirror not only serves a practical purpose but also adds a touch of elegance to your beauty collection.Overall, the GIMBELEN Travel Makeup Mirror combines functionality, convenience, and style, making it an essential companion for beauty enthusiasts on the move. Whether you're traveling the world or touching up your makeup at home, this mirror ensures you always look your best.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The good, the bad and the rest', 'author': 'Selena', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great little mirror to have around. I've recently been trying face yoga and gua sha massage that I follow along to on YouTube. Without having a way to view yourself it's often confusing to know if you're doing it correctly. This is a perfect size to keep by my desk and it's slim enough to easily put away. It does have a soft bag to keep in for extra protection also, though it feels sturdy enough I'm not really worried.I like that it has little rubber feet on the bottom so it doesn't slide around easily. And the many angles of adjustments are nice. I can easily set it in position and it stays put. I've had others that were so loose they fell under their own weight. I also like how easy it is, with just a gentle touch to change the color and intensity of the light. And Love that it remembers what I last set the light to so I don't have to reset each time I open it up. I charged it up and have used maybe an hour a day for the last week and haven't needed to recharge yet. I also appreciate that it has a decent 3 foot length USB to C charging cable. Much nicer than those piddly 12inch ones that these things normally come with.Overall, I like and would purchase again and feel comfortable recommending.Peace and beautiful images for all", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is Nice!', 'author': 'Jody Girl FL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I do a bit of traveling for business, races, and fun. But when I checked into a Romantic lakeside Inn with my boyfriend recently, I was dismayed to find that the bathroom mirror was - totally inadequate for makeup use. Yikes!None of the pocketbook mirrors I have seen were any better than the compact mirror that I always carry with me. Until I saw this one. At 7" x 5" and nearly 10 ounces it\'s substantial enough to use on my vanity desk, and bright enough to use out on the road. I was pleased to find that it charged up in a matter of a few hours when plugged into a USB C charger, and when I opened the cover the light came on immediately. Cles the lid, and the light goes out.The power and brightness buttons on the mirror face are terrific, requiring very little pressure, with three color choices to choose from and the ability to dim the light to any level you choose. The heavy-duty case will protect the mirror inside a carry-on or a stuffed suitcase, and the color of mine is a nice subdued pink shade.OVERALL - I wish I had this in the past - it\'s truly a lifesaver for anyone who finds themselves out "on the road again". Keeper', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Be sure to look at the photo of the product. They clearly show what they are but not the description below:Actual description: Travel Makeup Mirror with 10x Magnifying Mirror, Portable Folding Lighted Makeup, etc.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Large, lit mirror does not magnify.', 'author': 'Todd Scott', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'This larger lit up mirror does not magnify. title: Shatterproof Shower Mirror for Shaving with Hook (Medium 6x8 inch)40% Cheaper Than the Original,Unbreakable Deluxe Plexiglass Makeup Mirror,Largest Bathroom Wall Hanging,Portable Handheld Camping
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It doesn’t fog up, period.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve had 4-5 of these shower mirrors and this one is absolutely the best. Don’t know how they keep it clear without a hot water reservoir in the back, but it works. I even dropped it on the tile, slightly bent the corner and it still works. Also like it comes in two sizes.Might be the last shower mirror I’ll ever buy again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Happy with purchase', 'author': 'HR', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very happy with product and buying/shipping transaction', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This fog-free mirror works great!', 'author': 'Arn Poe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'d always thought shower mirrors were an unnecessary luxury. For several decades I\'ve been shaving at the sink or creek, then hopping into the shower/bath to rinse off. It was a simple process that seemed to work well.On a whim, I decided to try this inexpensive shower mirror. I\'m glad I did!I\'m notoriously horrible at visualizing measurements and was (as usual) shocked by the size of this mirror. I\'d been expecting a small handheld mirror (maybe 6"x4"?) and the larger format (as advertised - slightly over 8"x10") was awesome!The mirror includes a sticky-hook to affix on the shower wall, allowing the mirror to hang, perfectly balanced, from a hole in the top of the mirror. I hung it at eye-level (probably the only mirror in the house I can see into without crouching down!) and hopped in the shower with my shaving accessories.This fog-free factor was cool! I\'m not sure why I\'d never considered this a "need" - being able to clearly see in the mirror despite steam and water droplets was amazing! I don\'t know if the mirror also magnifies or if i was just standing closer than I can the sink mirror, but I was able to get a great shave and could see very well every terrible detail of my face.This mirror does more than it advertises and is sold at a fair price. Highly recommended!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Reliable and Practical Shower Mirror for Everyday Use - But Not Fogless', 'author': 'Sam Fisher', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently ordered this Shatterproof Shower Mirror for Shaving, and I appreciate its large, lightweight, and clear design. The size of the mirror is perfect, and the circular hole for hanging on the hook adds to its convenience. It's worth noting that these mirrors are not fogless as advertised, but wiping the fog off is an easy fix. The lightweight plastic construction is a plus, as it eliminates the worry of glass shards in case of a fall. Additionally, removing the protective film that the mirrors are shipped with is essential, as it significantly enhances the clarity of the mirror. However, due to the misleading fog-free claim in the advertisement, I have deducted one star from my rating.---Product: quegau Shatterproof Shower Mirror Shaving Mirror for Shower,Unbreakable Wall Mirror,10.7x8 in, Plexiglass Makeup Mirror,Largest Bathroom Wall Hanging,Handheld Camping Mirror 35ASIN: B0CL8ZZH1L", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It\'s a "Real" Mirror! Better Than Expected', 'author': 'GuitarBasement', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My concept of a mirror is something made from glass, but after peeling the protective film off of this one I was surprised to see how clear it is. It IS a real mirror.Since this is so lightweight it could easily be used as a hand held mirror too. And because it's not made of glass it's much safer. I'm wondering whether that super clear surface will last though, especially since the typical bathroom steam will probably need to be cleaned off. Time will tell, but even if it has to be replaced every few years, these are not so expensive. This is a nice simple product and is going to be useful.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Decent quality, nice size, doesn't fog up if done correctly", 'author': 'John Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had a smaller shower mirror that I lost during a move, and this is a good replacement. It works perfectly for what it is, the hook has stayed up with the weight of the mirror so far and I like that it is metal, and after warming it up for a few seconds under the water stream at the start of a shower the mirror has stayed un-foggy throughout the rest. There were two layers of protective plastic on the font and one on the back, so make sure you get them all when unpackaging, when I pealed off the first layer I thought the mirror was scratched but found the second a little later and the finish was perfect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Simple and seems to be Fog Free', 'author': 'Eric M', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is your basic plastic mirror with a hole in it and a hook with a sticky back. The mirror is clear and undistorted and is exactly what I needed to shave in the shower. I already have a place to keep my razor so the latk of a razor holder or anything else was unimportant to me. If you need a simple shaving mirror for your shower, this should work fine for you.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice LARGE non-breakable mirror', 'author': 'FJL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a very large mirror and has a great mirrored surface. title: Travel Mirror with 10X Magnifying Mirror, 2500mAh Rechargeable Light up Makeup Mirror with 72 LED Lights, 3 Colors Light Modes USB Portable Mirror with Dimmable Touch Screen
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this mirror!', 'author': 'Debbie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I will probably buy a second one to use for camping. It came charged and I have used every day for 10 days and have not had to charge.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect travel accessory', 'author': 'Jay Torres', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I just took this on a several week trip to the Caribbean where power is not always guaranteed but my makeup still needed to look flawless.LOVE:- small footprint. fit in my bag easily.- three lighting temp options PLUS an option to brighten/dim- charge lasts forever (no, really, I've had it a month and a half and with daily use have not recharged it yet)DON'T LOVE:- the latch for it. it can be tricky to open.- there's no way to prop it open; still have to hold it or prop it on something else. the mirror portion is heavy so it doesn't stay folded open.Even with those things that could be better I would buy this a hundred times over and definitely recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Make-Up at Home, or On-The-Go!', 'author': 'OnePickyMom', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This mirror is perfect for what I intended. I wanted a "travel" lighted mirror, but also one that I could use at home to put my make-up on. I specifically wanted the three types of light to choose between for putting on my make-up. I LOVE the fact that with a "long press" with your finger you can dim or brighten any of these lights. I love the subtle circle on the mirror that you press to turn it on and off, and do the dimming, that is so neat and tidy to me. The size of this item is perfect by the way- not too small to be usable, and not too large to be transportable. It comes with a small magnifying mirror, with extremely strong suction cups (kind of hard to pull off actually once you press it on,) if you need to do any close-up make-up work, or correction, or plucking. I thought the light strengths on this mirror, either dimmed or full strength make it very versatile to be able to use in a darkened room, or even daylight. Just adjust as needed. The two things that I did not like about this mirror, was the "latch", I thought was cheap-looking, not reflective of this mirror overall, because the quality otherwise is great. The latch design could use some improvement, but isn\'t essential if it keeps the cost of this mirror lower, then by all means, it is fine how it is! I like the affordability of it at present. The charging port is on the back of the mirror, and the charging cord they include with this is pretty short, just be aware. The LED light on the mirror does not turn off when you close the case, you have to turn it off yourself before you close the case up. Some other lighted compact mirrors I considered selecting, were cute but they had the one side of regular mirror paired with an opposing side of a magnifying mirror, and whoever made it, put the LED lighted rim around the magnifying mirror, and not the regular mirror at all!!! So you are lit up from under your chin rather than the regular magnification mirror you are using, to do your make up with- so strange!! I passed on those. In contrast- this mirror, the design makes a whole lot more sense to me, the LED lights perfect, and it will be very practical to use, I can tell already, I\'m so excited about it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel - very convenient', 'author': 'S. Woodard', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Many travel mirrors are so small, you can barely see your face in them - let alone do your make-up. I really needed something that would be large enough to let me see my entire face and I needed it to light up so I can actually see what my make-up looks like. This mirror does just that - it is perfect!It is extremely light-weight and will easily fit into your travel bag. It folds flat. Unfolded, it is stable on most surfaces. It came pre-charged and lit up with a push of the button - there are 3 lighting modes (cool, natural, and warm). If you hold down the button, the light will dim/brighten. The description states that it has "automatic memory of last used brightness" - yes, that is correct, but it is only for that lighting mode. You can basically adjust the 3 lighting modes each to a different brightness.I plugged the charging cord into my laptop and the mirror immediately started charging. When charging, the light will be red; fully charged, the light will turn green. I thought it was a little weird that the charger plugs into the back of the mirror. I would have preferred to plug in from the side but, with the mirror being so thin, this may not be possible.The magnifying mirror can be attached to the front of the regular mirror - the suction cups work very well! The magnifying mirror is only 3 inches big so a little too small for my needs.I am going on a trip in a couple of weeks and this mirror will definitely be coming along!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars teenager loves it', 'author': 'C_B', 'rating': 5, 'content': "my teenager loves this mirror. It's meant for traveling, but we found it's awesome for using around the house too. It can be charged with a USB-C cable, and it charges up really fast. once it's charged, the battery lasts a long time, which is perfect for my busy teen.the mirror is so popular in our house that now I might need to buy a second one because my kids are always arguing over who gets to use it. It's a great product and totally worth the money. If you're looking for a mirror that's portable, easy to charge, and lasts a long time, this one is definitely a must get.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Poorly designed', 'author': 'Zoey', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The base is lighter than mirror so it will not stand at any angle other than straight. Overall very poorly designed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice travel mirror', 'author': 'A Wandering Reader', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I took this mirror on a trip recently because my poor eyesight requires me to lean way over the sink to see in the mirror to put on my makeup in a hotel. This mirror was a game changer for me. It has 3 different light temperatures and charges with a USB-C cord. It held a charge for days.My only complaint is that it only has one angle, so I had to prop it up on top of something to see in it. I wish it were more adjustable, but that is a minor complaint.Overall, it worked really well for me and I can't imagine going on another trip without it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Compact and perfect for travel', 'author': 'lisan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. My travel goal is to spend three weeks abroad with one carryon, sacrificing nothing. Long ago I gave up makeup, because I can’t apply makeup without a magnifying mirror. For years I gave up makeup altogether because my old travel mirror was too big and ineffective. Because of that, I never got a travel photo of myself good enough to share, unless I was wearing sun glasses. No make up is a huge sacrifice.This mirror will help me achieve my goal of one carryon/no sacrifices. It is slim and can fit anywhere. I have used it to apply my makeup, and it can be done. Of course there’s nothing better than the big mirror at home. There are three servings for lights, depending on the situation, which is a bonusWhen the mirror first arrived, I had trouble opening it. I used a knife to pop it open which broke the latch off. That was really no big deal, because it doesn’t need the latch to stay closed.I did buy a 7” x 9” zipper bag to keep the mirror, charging cord and the suction cup magnifying mirror together in my carryon. It would be easy to leave the accessories behind or loose them otherwise.This a great product for the price. If it cost more, I would give it four stars due to the broken latch.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Broken', 'author': 'George', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I received a shattered mess! I’ll be retuning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Dimmeable & Rechargeable', 'author': 'T. Collins', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I absolutely love this mirror. I use it everyday. title: wobsion Travel Makeup Mirror, 7.4 * 5.1in Rechargeable Portable Folding Makeup Mirror with Lights, 3 Colors Light Up Mirror with 48 LEDs,Dimmable,Multiple Angles and High Adjustable,Gift,White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for bedridden', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My mom is in a nursing room so I sent this to her for convenience. She can easily use this on her table in bed, she loves it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excelente', 'author': 'Laura M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Buena calidad y tamaño', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Bright, compact, protected for travel', 'author': 'JenM', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So far I have only used this mirror for some tweezing & testing out its functions. I am not someone who wears makeup on a daily basis, so the jury is still out on that part. I do agree with other reviews that the lighting options are a bit "odd" - cooler toned, I guess you could say - but I\'m comparing this LED lighted mirror to an incandescent style lighted mirror, so I think that is to be expected.It is simple to switch between the different light temperatures & to dim/brighten each one. The memory function works perfectly, too & carries over to each light temperature from what I can tell.It seems like a very sturdy mirror. The option to extend it upwards is a huge plus, as a lot of these types of mirrors on the market do not seem to have that capability. I do wish it came with some kind of magnifying mirror, but the suction cup kind would be easy enough to add on (just maybe not for travel). After comparing this mirror to another I own, this one actually seems to be 2x magnification, not 1x, which I personally appreciate. I also love that when folded up, the mirror itself is fully protected, because again, not all the ones on the market offer that.As for the slippery base that others mentioned, you have to peel the little protective stickers off the rubber pads. Once you do that, it holds a good grip.The only issue I have found, and maybe mine is just defective, is that it does not light up green/red when charging or to let me know the battery is low. This is rather annoying to me, since I never know if it\'s fully charged or close to dying. It leads me to wonder how long the mirror as a whole will last before it requires being plugged in full-time during use. Otherwise, I think this lighted mirror is an excellent option for travel or on-the-go needs, but maybe not an every day make-up mirror (for every day make-up needs, I would prefer something a little larger and with lighting options that were toned properly for different environments).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for home & travel!', 'author': 'S.A. Otten', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This WOBSION travel makeup mirror is the perfect accessory for home and travel use.The folded compact, 8”x 6.1” size is just right for travel and fits easily inside a suitcase pocket, backpack or tote. The waterproof storage bag included with purchase is nice and well made.The mirror is rechargeable and comes with the charging cord but you need to supply the wall adapter plug. The mirror is fully charged in 2hrs or less. The small light on the back next to the charging port will flash red when it needs to be charged, solid red when charging and green when fully charged.The mirror was charged when I received it and the light comes on as soon as you open the case. The stand is adjustable in height and mirror angle. I\'ve grown tired of finding a place to do makeup in hotels. Sometimes there are no flat surfaces near mirrors, sometimes there\'s space but dismal lighting, and sometimes I\'m crouched on a tiny desk in a dark corner. I managed to find a makeup bag (finally) that allows me to apply my makeup just about anywhere without losing my product, so when I spotted this mirror and realized it would fit in my new makeup bag, I was really excited.At first, I wasn’t certain about the brightness of this mirror. The initial setting leaves me with haloes in my vision and makes it difficult for me to see well enough to apply my makeup, but the dimmed lights (holding down the power button) are much better, and the device does hold the settings in memory, so that’s a bonus. The light tones are slightly "odd," for lack of a better word. I have a makeup mirror in my room that does various light options like this, and the travel mirror is harsh in comparison. Every setting washes me out instead of mimicking environmental conditions; this may be better in hotel environments since I have only overhead lights in my house, so I’m reserving judgment here (my stationary makeup mirror swivels to avoid the overhead situation; this mirror can’t achieve that angle).The construction of the mirror is solid. It came charged, so I was able to test it immediately. The plastics seem sturdy, and the mirror closes snugly with a hard piece over the glass to protect it. The glass doesn\'t appear delicate and has no odd spots (wavers, ripples, etc.). The buttons are responsive and easy to press. I like that it can work as a stand unit or "float" in the air to achieve different angles and heights. This can be done with the mirror facing the base. Facing away from the base gives you the tallest height, which I’ll find most useful, but the downside is that the angle for this is mostly fixed and a bit too pitched up to be fully ideal. The hinges supporting the mirror’s movements work smoothly and easily, so props to the manufacturers for this. Most of the time, I have to struggle with this type of product.There are a few downsides to the mirror construction: 1) There are no rubber feet or similar textures on the bottom to prevent the mirror from sliding, and the plastic is very slippery. It slid every time I bumped it on my wooden table and dresser; 2) fingerprints practically cling to the mirror and are obvious as soon as they\'re present. Pack a buffing cloth if you get this, and 3) It’s a little heavier than I’d hoped, but if it lasts, I’m okay with that.I’m looking forward to trying it on my next trip at the end of the month! It looks promising, and I hope that bears to be true, but I’ll try my best to update my review shortly after either way.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Mirror A Little Bigger Than I Thought It Would Be', 'author': 'InExcelsis', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a very nice mirror that has a ton of different ways in which you can set it up for use. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product!', 'author': 'Eric McClellan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mirror is real easy to mount and operate. Very little assembly required. For those worried about putting this in the shower, the battery pack has a seal in place to prevent water from entering from the back. The mirror does not steam up no matter how much steam is in the room. Adhesive works extremely well, almost too well. Practically impossible to remove it by hand and I needed to use a spatula to help remove it from the wall. The product comes with two adhesives so if you don’t like the first place you put it you have a second chance of putting it in the right place or you could place it in two different areas (like in or out of the shower) since the mirror itself hooks and unhooks easily off the adhesive.The only gripe I have with the product is that you can’t adjust the mirror 90 degrees to the left or right from the wall (dependent on placement). Unless it is placed on the very edge of a wall or on a pillar, it won’t be able to turn a full 180 degrees (90 degrees left or right of the wall). This is likely because the mirrors distance from the wall is about 2 7/8 inches and the smallest diameter of the mirror itself is about 6 5/8 inches (or 3.3125 inches radius). It’s the perfect size and the lighting options are great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Versatile and Affordable Battery-Powered LED Light Shower Shaving Mirror *A Comprehensive Review*', 'author': 'Vincent Rodriguez', 'rating': 4, 'content': "As someone who values using mirrors along with grooming tools, I understand the significance of having a reliable mirror available for getting ready. This mirror has great features. It was packaged in a sturdy box and well-protected during shipping. The package was well organized and simple to open, and it was easy to follow the instructions given inside. The mirror has a shaver holder that can accommodate two shavers. I also appreciate how flexible, adjustable, durable, and sturdy the mirror is based on my experience. When you insert the back buckle into the adhesive hook, it allows the mirror to be attached to various wall surfaces according to your preference. This feature provides flexibility in where and how you use the mirror. You don't need to drill into the wall to install the mirror, making the process simple and less time-consuming. Furthermore, not having to drill walls to install a mirror like this helps prevent potential damage.To power the LED light, you'll need to insert 4 AAA batteries, as indicated in the user manual included inside the package. Yes, it notes on Amazon that you need to insert batteries, but it doesn't state the type, and you would have to find out upon receiving the box once delivered. I believe it would be beneficial for potential buyers if this information were included in the Amazon listing, not only in the instruction manual that's in the package. This way, they can be informed about the battery type required before purchasing the product. Furthermore, it's important to note that the mirror's lights are not powered by charging via a USB extension cord or by plugging them into a socket. Personally, I would prefer mirrors that offer recharging options over those relying on disposable batteries, especially for those on a budget. This helps reduce the need for frequent store visits to purchase replacement batteries. If you don't want the ongoing expense of buying disposable batteries, you may consider investing in a separate battery charger. Which comes at an additional cost, especially for those on a budget. I couldn't find a clear indicator or explanation in the user manual or on Amazon regarding how long the batteries would last while using this product. This lack of information means that I may have to update this review when I've had a chance to assess the battery life.In conclusion, based on my impression, due to the price and affordability, usage, and appearance, I'm giving it around four stars. This mirror offers many great features for its price, and it's a flexible mirror to use for many settings, making it a great affordable choice to have while practicing self-care.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'Lisa G', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'A little smaller that I expected.
