title: The Mirror
reviews: [{'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Mostly vibes, less narrative', 'author': 'Derek Metcalf', 'rating': 3, 'content': "In Tarkovsky style this movie requires an open mind with respect to traditional narrative structure. The sequences are deliberately disjoint, sometimes giving a sense of mania even though most individual shots are slow. The fourth wall is occasionally self-referentially cracked with shadows of a boom mic and the suggestion that the movie is at least partially autobiographical. This is absolutely not for everyone, which is why I hesitate giving it more stars despite liking it quite a bit. You have to know what you're getting into.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Unique directors stand the test of time', 'author': 'Curated Essentials', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The movie is more art than your average flick and I loved it. The picture quality is amazing and I can’t believe this was shot and or released in 1976. The color palette, the subtle wind blowing grasses and tree leaves, the extended sequences with no dialogue make this a unique experience. Highly recommend and we plan on seeking out other Tarkovsky movies.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Lighted Shower Mirror Fogless for Shaving, Heated Fog Free Large 9.5*8inch 3 Color Modes Dimming Shower Shaving Mirror with Light, Rechargeable Anti-Fog Shower Mirror with Storage Tray & Razor Holders
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome - and even better with mods! (see pics)', 'author': 'A Guy With Good Taste', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is one of the best gadgets I\'ve bought in years. Get one!Now some cool details that neither the seller nor other reviewers will tell you:Yes, it defogs flawlessly in about a minute. Yes, the light is nice and bright, adjustable for both three color temperatures and brightness.BUT... 1) This thing comes with an ugly, clunky "shelf" that barely holds a can of shave gel sideways (effectively jamming it in your face) and two razor slots, neither of which can even accommodate a Gillette Fusion Power razor. If you have a shower caddy, the "shelf" is both superfluous and ugly.AND... it comes with two mounting options, both of which are pretty awful: 1) You can use permanent adhesive mounting that will likely destroy your shower if this thing ever dies or you even change your mind; and 2) two SCREWS which will totally destroy whatever surface you mount it to!SO... Take a look at my photos! Because 1) I easily sawed off the silly hanging-down "shelf" thing; and you can\'t see that I made any mods, once the mirror is hung, because the mirror itself hides what I\'d cut off. And 2) even better, you can easily mount the base plate using waterproof 3M Command Strips (the special "bath and shower" versions), which you can get, cheap, right here on Amazon! They\'re both strong, and REMOVABLE.This results in the best-of-everything! A brilliant, beautifully-lit, self-defogging mirror that looks gorgeous and doesn\'t permanently mar or destroy your shower!Yes, you\'re welcome! BTW I\'m an official Vine Voice reviewer, but I used my own hard-earned money to buy this product. And zero regrets; it is awesome! And with the two mods described above, it\'s even better! Enjoy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Oh, how I have longed for something like this!', 'author': 'Ryan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I shave my head and have found the best place to do so is in the shower. I have tried other mirrors that claim they are "anti-fog" and "perfect for the shower". They have all been terrible. This one outshines them all!I am impressed with the overall quality and durability. There are two options for mounting the base. I opted for the adhesive rather than the screws because I didn\'t want to risk cracking my surround. I\'m always weary of adhesive mounting, even with a thorough cleaning of the surface, so we\'ll see what does, or doesn\'t, happen in the future but if for some reason it falls the mirror and the base, I am confident, will survive. It does appear to a good adhesive though.My bathroom does not have a light directly over the shower area, so the only lighting comes from outside through the blurry window. That would make me hold a mirror and adjust my head to shave by the window to get the best lighting I could on either side of my head, real annoying. The lighting on this mirror is fantastic, I really love it! Now I can stay in one spot and it works great, never felt like I needed to take it out of it\'s base to see better by the window.Now the real question, is it anti fog? Without a doubt, I will say yes. When I turned on the shower and the water got steamy it fogged up, but after a quick hit with water and turning on the heat function I never had a problem for the rest of my shower. I wish I had thought to take a quick video afterwards to show the comparison between this product and the bathroom mirror that was really fogged up. I love that there is a light indicating the heat function is on and working too so that there is no question.So, yes, this thing slides onto a base so you can take it out and recharge it. The charging port is well protected so moisture can\'t ruin it and the mirror slides over the base, rather than under it, ensuring it won\'t fall off.Another great feature is the tilting action. I love it has that this capability given as how everyone in my house will want to use this and we all vary in height. This will let us all use it.This is a fantastic product, highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Hey! This is a nice fogless lighted mirror for the shower', 'author': 'Stella E', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've tried other fogless mirrors for the shower/bath before that frankly just did not work - and were also battery powered and so heavy they frequently fell off the shower wall. This fogless lighted mirror from Suupvaor (which I tried through Amazon Vine) solves a number of problems, which I'll describe below. This a great option for men's shaving needs or (like me, a woman) doing a skincare routine in the shower.Pluses:* The mirror is charged via USB cable (no charging block, but everyone has one) so no need for batteries. * The charging port is covered with a rubber plug so no worries about water getting inside.* The fogless feature really works. I had the shower running for a minute before I remembered to turn it on, and within a minute, the mirror was clear. Yay!* I like the changeable LED light colors.* The separate wall mount means that you can slide the mirror off to recharge without taking the whole thing with you.* The adhesive patch that attaches to the wall mount portion of the mirror is STRONG. Make sure you get your application right, because it won't be easy to remove. Fortunately the manufacturer gives you an extra adhesive patch if you move or decide to use it in a different bathroom.* The built-in shelf accommodates a couple of razors plus room for other tools or a container of shave cream. It can be expanded, but I don't think I will use that function. The shelf has drainage holes for no mess.* The manufacturer includes a little pair of blunt-tip grooming scissors and a tweezer. I missed this in the product description, so finding them was a pleasant surprise.All round this is a very nice mirror for the price. Don't be afraid to take the plunge.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fogless and Works Great!', 'author': 'Army_Veteran', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I was searching for a quality fogless shaving mirror for my shower and chose this one.I am very pleased with this mirror.These are the things that I like about this mirror:1.) Fogless: Many mirrors I have come across and even tried claim to be fogless but have fallen short for different reasons, including just not being effective enough. This mirror has a dedicated button to enable the mirror to resist fogging. I find that this is very effective, if the mirror happens to fog up because you forgot to press the button, it will quickly (within a minute or two) clear away the fog after pressing the button.2.) Lightweight: This mirror is very lightweight, even with a shaving cream can holder on it.3.) Mounting: There is no drilling into the wall to mount this, unless that is what you want. It comes with a sticky mounting pad already attached to the wall mount, just peel the paper off and mount the mirror in your desired location. It also comes with an extra sticky mounting pad and a couple of screws w/mounting anchors if you don't have the right surface to use the mounting tape.4.) Two-piece design: The mirror can be removed from the wall mount by just sliding the mirror up to remove it. The user's guide says to remove the mirror when charging.5.) Lighting: This mirror has a dedicated button to power the mirror on and that same button you use to choose from three different color temperatures. It comes with a charging cable (USB-A to USB-C), no power adapter needed, simply plug the USB-A side into a USB-A port and the other end plugs into the mirror.6.) Additional features: There is an adjustable shaving cream can holder and two holders for your razors.I am very pleased with this mirror and recommend it.I hope this helps.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well featured shower mirror', 'author': 'Prkie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The mirror comes with two mounting methods, regular screws with anchors and double sided tape. For most purposes, the tape will be plenty strong as the mount together with the mirror don't weight all that much and you don't have to put holes in your walls/tile. The only qualm here is that it would be nice if the mirror also had side to side tilt, but up/down is fine enough. Mirror can be removed from the mount for recharging. Mount is made out of very thick and substantial plastic, and has a folding shelf.The mirror itself doesn't seem to have a waterproof rating, but appears to be plenty waterproof for splashes. The USB-C port is covered with a gasket, and as long as it's facing down, it should be safe from any moisture ingress. Heats up fairly fast, and is truly fogless. Three different lighting temperatures.The main advantage to me is the massive internal battery. Most mirrors of this type have significantly less, or are not as resistant to moisture due to needing to have a battery compartment. Having this be a large rechargeable battery means less time spent recharging and swapping out batteries. Also, the USB-C port does charge via a C-C cable so the correct circuitry is included for futureproofing, even though an A-C cable is used by default.Other accessories are not very notable, but nice to have - small scissors and tweezers.Very recommended due to the great feature list and a reasonable price point.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Brilliant Shower Mirror for Effortless Grooming', 'author': 'Humberto Marcano', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This Lighted Shower Mirror has exceeded my expectations. The generous 9.5*8-inch size, coupled with the heated fog-free feature, ensures a clear reflection during every shave. The three color modes and dimming options provide a customizable ambiance, enhancing the overall grooming experience. The addition of a rechargeable anti-fog feature, along with a practical storage tray and razor holders, adds to its functionality. A fantastic addition to any bathroom routine', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Steamy Vision Made Crystal Clear!', 'author': 'Zeus360', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Foggy bathroom mirrors after a hot shower are a thing of the past thanks to this Lighted Shower Fogless Mirror! This innovative product has transformed my shower routine, and here's why:No more wiping the mirror every few seconds just to catch a glimpse of yourself while shaving or applying skincare. This mirror utilizes built-in heating technology to effectively prevent fogging, even in the steamiest showers. It's a game-changer!This mirror isn't just fogless, it's also illuminated with adjustable LED lights. Choose from warm, cool, or natural light to create the perfect ambiance for your morning or evening routine. No more struggling to see in dimly lit bathrooms!Mounting the mirror was a breeze thanks to the included adhesive strips and screws. It adheres securely to a variety of surfaces, making it suitable for different bathroom setups. Plus, the sleek and modern design complements any bathroom decor.The mirror boasts a touch sensor for easy light control, even with wet hands. The built-in clock helps you manage your shower time efficiently. And, for those who enjoy listening to music or podcasts while showering, the Bluetooth speaker is a delightful bonus!All in all, this Fogless Mirror is a fantastic addition to any bathroom. It's functional, stylish, and packed with convenient features that make your shower experience more enjoyable and efficient. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a fog-free and well-lit oasis in their shower!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "2.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't work", 'author': 'Claudene R.', 'rating': 2, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I wanted to like this mirror so badly. It's pretty nice! The different tone lighting is great, the mirror warms up (not hot) which is supposed to prevent the fogging during showers. The mount secured nicely to my shower wall, which I placed and let sit for 12 hrs before mounting the mirror, per the instructions. The sad thing is when not plugged in, it won't turn on or stay on. I charged it all night/until I had the green light. After unplugging, it won't light up or will but only for 5 seconds then won't turn back on.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 5 Stars All The Way!', 'author': 'Rick', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Similar to the other 5 star reviews I have had a great experience with this mirror. The charging was very easy and seemed to work quickly. I use it daily, both the heating and lighting function and have not had to recharge it yet after over a weeks worth of use.The defogging/warming function works wonderfully and quickly as well. The mirror can be completely fogged over and after pressing the heating function button, it is less than a minute later that the entire mirror is fully warmed and completely fog free. This is so much better than the traditional old style method of running hot water either behind or on the mirror part itself, which would lead to water spots and not work for very long before having to do it again.The mirror itself is a perfect size, with a tilt function to get the perfect up/down angle you need. The lights are also very nice with 3 color choices and a dimmer setting for each.I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a shower mirror, or a mirror to use in any steamy or foggy locations. Excellent!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing!', 'author': 'Tori', 'rating': 5, 'content': "One shower with this mirror and I'm wondering why I didn't get one sooner!The only lights in our bathroom are above the sink so the enclosed shower stall we have gets quite dark. Enter this lovely mirror, with 3 light settings. It helps brighten the shower so I can see better, especially when trying to wash all the mascara off my face.The anti fog feature really does work within 1-2 minutes of turning it on. It went from completely foggy to clear as day in a short amount of time.I like that the extra shelf under the mirror can fold up for storage and it has slots in the shelf so there isn't standing water.I think the smartest feature of all for this mirror though is that you can remove the entire mirror from the frame to charge it with the included charger. The frame is firmly mounted onto the shower wall with the adhesive strip and it isn't showing any signs of coming off anytime soon. The mirror also came with a replacement strip of adhesive for if it needs to be replaced.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome mirror', 'author': 'Janice Pierce', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great mirror. I will definitely getting another one. My sons have also confirmed that it is NOT, in fact, fogless. They splash the mirror with water to warm it up and it will stay clear for a few seconds - then fogs again. We're going to try to move it closer to the water stream to see if the extra warmth might keep it clear long enough for them to shave.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Product!', 'author': 'Ashleigh', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This mirror is a high quality, aesthetically pleasing fogless mirror. We absolutely love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Mirror Image', 'author': 'Richard Noble', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was perfect for my use in the shower for shaving, never fogged up, convenient storage of razor and adjustable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No Fog', 'author': 'Kizmet B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Mirror is just as described, no fog no matter how hot the shower gets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Very Nice Shower Mirror', 'author': 'UnderWaterSuperHero', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This has to be the best shower mirror I've ever owned.It is generously larger than the mirrors I've seen at Wal Mart or CVS, and I would say it is of much higher build quality than ones I've owned in the past. The entire body of the mirror is made of a tough plastic that could probably survive a fall to the floor, but there is little worry that this will happen due to a very good adhesive mounting solution that simplifies installation and is sure to last as long as you make sure you prepare a clean mounting surface. I used rubbing alcohol and scrubbed a squeaky-clean spot onto the ceramic tile surface of my shower.The mirror gets points for usability. It pivots easily on a swivel mount, so it can be repositioned as needed to accommodate.The reflecting surface of the mirror seems of good quality - no distortions or warping - and it seems to resist fogging well. So well in fact, that my partner commented on two things she liked about the mirror: 1) the generous size of it and 2), that it doesn't fog up.Another useful feature of this mirror is the razor holder. It can securely hold two shaving razors.The only warning I have for the reader is to be careful when attaching the mirror body to the swivel base. The included hardware nut that is used to fasten the mirror to the swivel mount is small and slippery. I would stay away from sink and shower drains when assembling the mirror, just so you don't risk losing it.Also, I recommend using a small needle-nose (or other) small pliers. You'll want to use it for proper torquing of the small nut, which is almost impossible to do by hand alone.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It really works!', 'author': 'Jon Crawford', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was skeptical that it would actually remain free of fog, but it does! My only critique is the neck that attaches the mirror to the wall is about an inch too long. This is a nice mirror at a great price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product.', 'author': 'michael wilson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Mirror is totaly fog free. It was easy to install and I like the size. Bigger than I expected', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Fargo Shopper', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My husband's old mirror was really in rough shape. It did not fog up at all and though all plastic it is well designed and made well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Sticks really well to the sliding shower door, but anti-fog properties were gone in two weeks :(', 'author': 'Sock', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I got this shower mirror because I color my hair and I keep it touched up with color-depositing conditioner. Could be bigger.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not for me but seems to do the trick!', 'author': 'Amanda', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've slowly been de-bachelor-padding my boyfriends apartment. He asked if I could find him a fogless mirror because he prefers his temperatures at diabolical, suffocating degrees.I typically go for the lowest priced products so long as the reviews aren't abysmal, but decided to purchase this slightly more expensive mirror because I know his patience would wane if it wasn't truly fogless. Let me tell you, it absolutely is.The quality is solid - actually amazingly so. I first tried installing it in a central point across from the showerhead where we could both use it (he's about a foot taller than myself) but neglected to pay attention to the seams of the tiles, so the suction cup failed, fell and it did NOT break. Color me impressed! Now being properly placed, the suction cup is solid enough that we can both manhandle the mirror to our respective heights without fear of it falling.The razor-hanging feature has several slots so we can both hang and preserve the quality of our razors without taking up precious shelf space. The suction cup also places the mirror several inches off of the wall (think Michael Scott's plasma TV), so you don't have to risk your life leaning forward if you have the eyesight of a mole.Hoping this mirror will last us quite some time, but when it does go, this is the mirror we'll be ordering again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall very nice Mirror', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It has disclaimer about fogging and how to address that is the only thing that is a bit annoying sometimes otherwise great mirror. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good film, better service.', 'author': 'Mike S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Mirrors was an okay film, but the speed with which I received it was even better. I liked it to a point, right when it began to wander…', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Underrated.', 'author': 'TTT', 'rating': 5, 'content': "A truly excellent quality film. My girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed the film.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reflection of Fear', 'author': 'Santeria', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I saw the Theatrical version the first weekend out and thoroughly enjoyed MIRRORS.I did feel that something was missing, and once again the Unrated Version has proven to be the gold standard.MIRRORS UNRATED packages both the Theatrical and the Unrated together, so you can see the two edits of the film on the same disk.Fabulously Eerie with its supernatural elements, the story brings you through the experience as we come to the final terrifying twist in the story. The disk is made for a 5.1 setup with its great audio, and specifically its ghostly audio that adds much to its spectacularly spookiness. Kiefer's performance brings up a brilliant scare. Its an excellent watch.DVD: Great extras.I don't agree with the deletes but thats the fun of the movies. The making of show a great deal of how this scare-fest was put together. HAVE FUN !!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2009', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars srorriM', 'author': 'Franci', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is probably not the most brilliant and original film, not to mention a couple of plot holes in it. I wasn't looking for the most brilliant and original story, and those minor holes imo were a way of leaving some things up to the viewer, for your own imagination. I'm really into creepy atmosphere and something that toys with the psyche and then leaves it up to me to figure some things out, suspense. This had all those elements. It's also an interesting storyline with a couple twists. There's really good acting, makeup and effects, and cinematography (not to mention I'm a Kiefer fan).In my opinion it's 4.5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2009', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars What does one see?', 'author': 'Sarah H.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This was a spooky movie.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The Unrated Version is "The Definitive" Version', 'author': 'Dyers_Eve', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I rented this and it was pretty cool but a few scenes bugged me and I kinda laughed at how fake the fire looked in one scene in particular.The I said what the heck and bought it. I was surprised the version I'd seen was NOT the unrated version. I'll be honest the bath tub scene and the sheer scariness and brutality of it was enough to get me to purchase this dvd and for that I am not dissapointed, despite several flaw in both the script, the story and the effects. The thing that bothers me the most is this movie had the potential to be truly terrifying. From the trailer I saw it had potential written all over it and things got kinda fumbled on the potential part but i still an entertaining film thanks to Keifer and Amy Smart.If you had gotten to know his sister more, and really like her, perhaps she coudlve even had a bigger part? then the bathtub scene would have been that much more tramatic and gruesome and have garnered Keifer a bit more sympathy from us movie watchers. There's no reason at all togo with the theatrical version...Pity...", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2009', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Shower Mirror Fogless for Shaving with Razor Holder Suction Cup, Shaving Mirror for Shower Bathroom Anti Fog Hanging Mirror Waterproof & Shatterproof No Drilling Removable for Man & Woman, White
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product overall.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I shave in the shower and this is the best no-fog mirror I’ve owned. No adhesion issues. It does fog up slightly but I just throw a little water on the mirror and it clears. Sturdy and very easy to install.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great! My stepdad loves it.', 'author': 'Andika1216', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It has really good suction power, but you do need to clean the surface it will be used on really well & use rubbing alcohol to get great suction. It fell once, but after the alcohol wipe, it hasn't moved since the 2nd day after Christmas. The tilt stays wherever you want. It even looks better than the higher priced ones. I highly recommend it. It occasionally fogs up when you start the shower, but a quick spray of the warmer water fixes it easily. He was actually happiest with what was the cheapest of the presents I got him.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A little foggy', 'author': 'aubrey', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is super easy to install. I love how you can move it and detach the mirror. It does get a little foggy though, I’m not sure it’s possible to be fully fog less or not but it does get a little foggy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Cheaply made and will not stick', 'author': 'Keith Hammond', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Really disappointed. Made of very flimsy plastic, especially the "tray." Doubt it would last very long under regular use since there was a razor thin slit you would have to insert it in. Not that I got a chance because the suction cup would not stick to glass or any other smooth flat surface (whether I had things on the tray or even just removed the tray entirely). Would always fall within a couple hours. Would not recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No fog', 'author': 'Eric Peller', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This mirror works great stock on to my tile shower with ease and doesn't fog up when taking a hot shower.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Fogless?', 'author': 'jordan', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'It worked great for a couple of weeks but now it fogs up', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Harrison', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect size, easy to install, very stable wall adhesion on a smooth surface. The razor carrier attachment can be retracted when not in use, which is a nice touch.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It really works. Does not get foggy even with very steamy hot water.', 'author': 'Tony B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to install and for the first time I’ve actually found a mirror that does not fog up in very steamy water', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not rustproof', 'author': 'Household6', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Purchased in Dec 2021. Reviewing in Jan 2024.Like others have stated, it’s def not made of “rustproof stainless steel material.” Took about 4 months before I noticed it developing on the bracket that hangs from the suction cup. (Suction cup cover and frame around the mirror are fine.)Anti-fog lasted about a year. But even today all it takes is one wipe and fog is gone for remainder of shower.Shower is made of fiberglass. Suction cup has never failed.I like that it tilts - a needed feature when I’m 5’5 and others who use the shower are 6’+.For the price paid I’m buying another one, but will spray the bracket a protective coat of something on it to prevent the rust and use an anti-fog wipe I have with my car wash items.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Shower mirror', 'author': 'bridget', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Kind of small but works for shAving. Does fall off occasionally but overall I like the mirror.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: The Mirror
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent and very scary horror movie!', 'author': 'Phil', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was actually tiring a little of 'found-footage' movies after viewing a spate of recent ones that were poorly made, badly written and just plain implausible!And then I watched The Mirror.I thought it was an absolutely brilliant and genuinely frightening horror movie. I haven't felt so scared watching a horror movie in years! It literally gave me chills.To begin with I found the story of the three flatmates attempting to capture some spooky footage rather entertaining - they're all fantastic, very natural actors and the interplay between them was highly watchable. But as events started getting out of hand, as a result of the ominous mirror, I found myself being drawn into the chilling narrative to the point of feeling like I was watching a nightmare being played out on the screen. The 'found-footage' style evoked such a sense of dread that I felt like I was actually watching one of my own nightmares. The third act of the film is an absolute masterclass in tension, suspense and disturbing, unsettling filmmaking - and all achieved with no music score!I haven't had this kind of a reaction to a horror movie in a long time and it was really refreshing to watch something that actually scared me. Structurally and stylistically The Mirror is an excellent horror film and I'd recommend it to all horror fans - even if, like me, you'd become disillusioned with 'found-footage' - The Mirror should shine you back onto them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2015', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good movie, dumb ending', 'author': 'Hermanator', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Do all scary movies have to end the same these days!! SO boring!! BUT the movie has a good creepy vibe to it. It's a slow burn but I actually enjoyed it. I of course was ready for the stupid ending, as that's what I expect from all horror movies these days. So I just learn to enjoy the movie and hate the ending. I could also do without all the gore. I like to be scared but gore does nothing for me. My thoughts though are ..... why didn't they call the police when he went missing? Why didn't they call an ambulance for Jemma? I mean, I know horror movies wouldn't be good without dumb people but to me, that is a no brainer! So could it be better? Yes. Could the ending have been A LOT better? Yes. Was it creepy and worth a watch? Yes.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Definitely worth a rental for low budget found footage supernatural films fans.', 'author': 'TomHunter1968', 'rating': 4, 'content': '** NO SPOILERS ** Well, I seem to be the only one who found this one fairly enjoyable!I\'ll be the first to admit it was not full of over the top, edge-of-your-seat thrills or scares (and there is one significant plot hole). Also, the movie description initially made me a bit irked in that I thought the marketing team was claiming something about the film\'s popularity (I see some reviewers also missed this), but I see now - having seen it - that it wasn\'t a phony attempt at claiming the film was all-abuzz on Twitter, etc - it\'s actually part of the plot itself, not movie hype.The movie is filled with a long series of low-key spooky moments that add up to an overall engaging and "believable" found footage experience. All three actors were quite good and the ACTING was certainly on the level of any low budget found footage film I\'ve seen (and I\'ve reviewed around 50 of them so far) including Blair Witch and Paranormal Activity.It helps, bit, too, if you know about the long-standing $1 million prize offered by James Randi, as this forms the basis of the film, especially as to why the kids hang in the for as long as they do, despite the events unfolding around them (no spoilers)...I found it absolutely worth a rental, especially if you enjoy slow-build, b-horror, found footage movies and not thrill-a-minute films.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars A Brief Inquiry into Horror Writing', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'So there\'s a concept in all narrative, but it\'s especially important in horror called "the lock in". It\'s when your characters are committed to the plot and can no longer just walk away from it at their convenience. The Blair Witch project, patron saint of these films has a lock in at a razor sharp 15 minutes in, though you don\'t know it until near the end when it\'s revealed that they can\'t leave the woods.Lock In\'s are important because they stop the audience from spending the entirety of the runtime asking "Why don\'t they just call the police/hospital". Hitchcock may have said \'they don\'t call the police because it\'s boring\', but he was also a genius working at the top of his craft. The rest of us mere mortals need to hold up the B and C movies with structure.I am, in general, pretty lenient towards found footage because it tends to pulpy by nature and thrown together by eager 20 somethings with about two thousand dollars between them. So I guess what I\'m saying is that I can forgive that The Mirror is 80 minutes of nothing happening followed by some Halloween store knife work - that\'s just what you *get* when you sign up for this sort of thing - but I can\'t find it in myself to forgive that the Lock In, the moment where the stakes are raised and people can\'t solve this issue by dialing the hospital doesn\'t happen until sixty holy crap minutes into a ninety minute film.Better luck next time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not the worst', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'but certainly not the best found footage out there. There were quite a few times I wondered if these people had access to phones since they never called for assistance at any time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Started strong', 'author': 'Another Amazon reviewer', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The movie started strong in my opinion but it never got past it and just went down hill. So much ridiculousness. At what point do you leave? At what point are you honest about what you are doing at night? At what point do you stop making jokes? Pure trash. I wouldn't waste you time with this at all. Don't want to give anything away, but after the first 1-2 occurrences, it is repetitive, not interesting and leading towards a basic ending.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars dont let the first 20 minutes fool you...', 'author': 'Daniel Yoranus', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'If you are looking for a super slick, high-budget horror movie this isn\'t the film for you, HOWEVER, my partner and I were SPOOKED from this one. I was not expecting much going into it, the first 15 or 20 minutes had me fairly convinced that "The Mirror" would be just another predictable, formulaic, low-budget horror film but thankfully, we were wrong! There were some really interesting, attention grabbing shots that made this film stand out above the others in the sea of B horror films. I thought that the dialog was far more believable and well-written than most other B horror films, honestly I thought the writing in this film was better than some blockbuster horror titles (though this isn\'t saying much). Well worth a watch if you aren\'t too afraid of found footage horror, mirrors, or the British!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Your Average Found Footage', 'author': 'Just Floating Through', 'rating': 2, 'content': "The Mirror is a found footage horror film with a supernatural premise. I've seen many found footage movies on Amazon Prime and I can safely say that this one is not hot garbage. On the flip side, neither is it groundbreaking.The movie is shot well and also well acted. The characters are likeable, which usually isn't the case for found footage movies. However, like many found footage movies the ending is open ended. I mean if you're looking for closure and finality, you shouldn't be watching found footage movies in general. The characters do make questionable choices; like when your friend starts sleep walking with a knife, now is the time to make a gameplan. Or when your friend goes missing for days, by 24 hours you should have contacted the police. But other than these discrepancies I don't really have an issue with the film. I can see how some may find it boring, as it is light on scares. I was intrigued enough to keep watching. And nothing to do with the story but the actress playing Jemma (her name is also Jemma) is gorgeous.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Almost a 5', 'author': 'Jonathan F.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'There is a little overacting and a very ugly lamp in an otherwise sharp apar-(flat) Im a big fan of found footage movies and this is nowhere near the worst of them.A super solid 7/10 in the same ballpark as Area 51 but it moves quicker. Great job! Scarier and more cohesive than expected!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Interesting twist on your average found footage films', 'author': 'Damon Palyka', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I was pleasantly surprised by this movie. 90% of these found footage movies are garbage with bad scripts and even worse acting. This one was actually good. The ending should have been longer and taken more than 5 minutes to "wrap up", but overall it\'s worth a watch and the actors are actually quite good!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2020', 'is_verified': True}]

He asked if I could find him a fogless mirror because he prefers his temperatures at diabolical, suffocating degrees.I typically go for the lowest priced products so long as the reviews aren't abysmal, but decided to purchase this slightly more expensive mirror because I know his patience would wane if it wasn't truly fogless. I first tried installing it in a central point across from the showerhead where we could both use it (he's about a foot taller than myself) but neglected to pay attention to the seams of the tiles, so the suction cup failed, fell and it did NOT break. The size is perfect and the light is nice and bright!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I was looking for', 'author': 'Lee Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently got my hands on this travel mirror and let me tell you, it\'s an absolute game-changer for my beauty routine on the go! This lighted makeup mirror has everything you could ever need and more.First off, let\'s talk about versatility. With three different light modes - cool, natural, and warm - and adjustable brightness, I can achieve the perfect lighting for any occasion with just the touch of a button. Whether I\'m doing my makeup in a dimly lit hotel room or under bright natural sunlight, this mirror has me covered.And speaking of convenience, this mirror is designed with travel in mind. Its compact size (7.5"L x 5.1"W) and lightweight design make it easy to slip into my luggage or handbag, and the included waterproof bag adds an extra layer of protection. Plus, the 180° adjustable stand allows me to find the perfect angle for applying makeup wherever I am.One of the best features of this mirror is its rechargeable battery. With just 2 hours of charging, I can enjoy 180-300 minutes of use, making it perfect for long trips or busy days out and about. And thanks to the Type-C charging interface and included cable, recharging is a breeze no matter where I am.But perhaps the most impressive thing about this mirror is its smart sensor switch and memory function. The mirror automatically turns on when I open the stand and off when I close it, saving energy and ensuring that the battery lasts as long as possible. Plus, the memory function means that it remembers my preferred light mode every time I use it, so I can pick up right where I left off.Overall, I couldn\'t be happier with this travel mirror. It\'s compact, versatile, and incredibly convenient, making it the perfect companion for any beauty enthusiast on the go. Whether you\'re traveling the world or just heading out for a night on the town, this mirror has everything you need to look and feel your best.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Game changer', 'author': 'HerculesSingh', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The GIMBELEN Travel Makeup Mirror with Light and Mini 10x Magnifying Mirror is a versatile and compact beauty accessory designed to enhance your makeup routine on the go. Here's a breakdown of its features:Portability: The mirror's foldable design makes it perfect for travel, ensuring you can easily slip it into your bag or suitcase without taking up much space.Lighting Options: With three adjustable light colors, including warm, natural, and cool, you can customize the illumination to suit various environments and makeup needs. Good quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars UPDATE: NOPE HATE IT', 'author': 'Caroline Lamb', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'RE: 20X Magnifying Mirror (6" diameter entire, 5.25" actual mirror) with 3 Suction Cups attached to back for Easy Mounting (brand on box says JMH, and model# under UPC code is X0039KZX3D )***> UPDATE! 2 days after the return window I go to clean it with glass-specific cleaner & paper towel (BARELY WIPING) and the mirror finish right in the center disappeared & looks like black speckled, rendering it useless & no option to return! **** B A D product!ORIGINAL REVIEW:Love this Mirror, Yet Hate This Mirror (for 2 reason, only 1 product fault). Here\'s WhyHad to take off a star because the mirror itself was not at all attached to the back. There was dried glue on the back as if it should have been, but was not....don\'t know if it just wasn\'t pressed onto the back during assembly, or if a year or 2 of floating around on a shipping container separated it. Normally I\'d return it, but since that is more of an annoyance than just supergluing it myself, I\'ll just do that as nothing else was wrong with it.What ELSE do I hate about it (that ISN\'T it\'s fault)? This thing DEFINITELY performs it\'s 20x function! Why do I hate this? Because, although my 8x mag lighted makeup mirror crushed any delusion I had about my "perfect complexion," THIS sucker downright destroyed the notion, so, while I\'m able to overlook the glue flaw on the product, those which it has made me see on my face cannot be unseen! I got this mirror to be able to pluck stray brows and be able to see my eye makeup application, which clearly it is perfect for, but the damage to my ego this mirror has inflicted will be eternal.As I said I already have one of those round, lighted, flip-2-sided (1x/8x) stand makeup mirrors, but the 8x was very lacking for what I needed, so I got this with the suction cups on the back, with the idea that I\'ll just stick it onto the face of the lighted mirror when I need it. I just stuck the back part (I did not glue the mirror yet), and believe me when I say that thing SUCTIONS like nothing else, so I have no doubt it will still do so when the actual mirror is glued back in. It is WORK to get those suckers off with care so not to break, so I will probably just leave it stuck over my other mirror\'s 8x side, since this one\'s (20x) actual mirror is so much better.As I stated my own current makeup mirror is lighted, this is NOT (and doesn\'t claim to be), but it works PERFECTLY how I want to use it, and fits just right on the surface of my lighted Conair stand one. PERFECT for close makeup application, plucking, or seeing that it\'s long overdue time for a face exfoliation/peel/moisturizing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Suction cups', 'author': 'GrandmotherJ', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'No matter what I cleaned my bathroom mirror & the magnifying mirror with, glass cleaners, alcohol, lighter fluid it still fell off in a day or so.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Quality', 'author': 'C. Kouns', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have a long, very thin mirror on our bathroom door (like 3/16"). Will shatter and scatter if you tighten to far.', 'author': 'Elsie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Exactly what I needed to hang a rectangular mirror without its own frame. Pretty easy to install. The anchors are kinda flimsy and a pain to get in, but they give you a ton of them so you don't have to worry if you damage one past the point of no return. title: KEDSUM Upgrade 2X Heated Shower Mirror with Light, 3 Color Dimmable Shower Mirror Fogless for Shaving, No-Tools Wall Mounted, 360° Swivel, Waterproof, Rechargeable Real Glass Shaving Mirror
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what i was looking for', 'author': 'Courtney Wilson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had been looking for a working fogless mirror for some time. I purchased several others; most claim to be fogless but are not. Others are fogless for the first few uses, then they\'re not. However, this fogless mirror carries promise why because it does not use an "ant-fog coating." Instead it uses simple science and heats the mirror. I couldn\'t for the life of me understand why other mirrors did not do the same, especially when they\'re battery-powered anyway. I have only had the mirror for a day and used it once, but it has so far impressed me. The defogging feature works like a charm as long as you remember that it\'s a long two-second press to activate it rather than a simple tap. The light is very bright and allows for a clear unobstructed view. Despite the great experience so far, I have two critiques of this item. 1. it uses an adhesive to stick to the bathroom wall. It\'s 2024, and we should have suction options so the mirror can be moved when needed. Its a bit odd that an adhesive is still being used. The second critique is the use of the functions. Sometimes, I have to tap a couple of times before the device can recognize that I\'m trying to change the brightness.As I mentioned before, I truly do enjoy this item, I wish I had purchased the 3x zoom or 2x zoom for a closer shave, but overall, I am satisfied. Def worth the cost, especially since I couldn\'t find any other mirror that comes close to being fogless.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mirror for your shower', 'author': 'Nicole H', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It secures to the shower wall nicely and does not budge and you can still rotate it around to find the perfect angle on any given day. The timer features are great because I do forget to turn it off sometimes. I love that it’s rechargeable instead of battery operated.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars weak attachment point -breaks with heavy ball/mirror.', 'author': 'Myriah', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I was initially impressed with this mirror. I put it up in the shower- NOT in direct water flow. It was under my showerhead and attached with the adhesion/glue with no problem. The mirror itself was awesome, light is very bright, and the anti-fog part worked really well. After only 1 shower, probably 5-6 hours after attaching it to a cleaned surface, with regular shower steaminess, I heard this CLUNK followed by what sounds like a quarter dropping and spinning till its flat, only WAY LOUDER. (If you have kids, you end up being an expert at what causes which noises)) I knew what it was before I went in to check. The mirror was on the floor of the shower, thankfully UNbroken. The attachment in the pictures was also on the floor. It seems that the rounded (weak point) that holds of the back of the screw broke, which put too much tension on the square adhesion and pulled off dropping the mirror. This sucks. I loved how it fit in with my bathroom and actually WORKED. I am going to figure out my own way to attach the stem, because I really like this. But you guys need to figure out a better way to attach something this heavy besides a small PLASTIC round doodad held on by a thin glue pad. If it was a strong stable attachment, it would get 5 stars. I don\'t have an option to "contact seller" for some reason on this product. It only let me chat with an amazon online "person" and they only offer returns or replacement. No thanks- Ill figure it out myself. If the company reads this, PLEASE rework the attachment base of this mirror. I\'m sure this will happen to someone else- Bummer.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The instructions need a little more details. But I figured it out.', 'author': 'Scott Johnston', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The mountain had some issues, I use the ball joint and the mirror rotates down from the weight of the bottom of the mirror. Unless I’m trying to shave my wedding tackle that wasn’t gonna work. So I got a piece of rubber hose and propped it up to her now it reflects my face. I had to go online for the instructions on how to get the heater to work. But once I did, it works great. Then when I turned it off the whole bottom of the mirror and and the buttons flashed red as orange. Just assume that means it needed to be charged. That seems to have worked. Overall pretty good so far.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just as advertised', 'author': 'kirkglaspie  Sr', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve tried other mirrors which didn’t work as they said but this one is great it holds the charge almost a month and with the heat button the mirror doesn’t fog up', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This a great product.', 'author': 'HECJR', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have had this mirror for over 3 months and it is the best shower mirror that I have ever had. When there are dried water spots on it a wet and dry paper towel brings it back to like new. I can't say enough good things. Try it you won't be disappointed.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'Brett H', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the best shower mirror I have ever owned. I was kinda disappointed in this, you really don't need this much magnification in the shower. You have to stand so close to it or it's just a blur. I guess it could be useful for men shaving their face in the shower but unless you're shaving your face you don't stand that close to a mirror in the shower. I do like the lighting of it and the mirror itself is very clear. I wish it had a regular stand so that I could use this as a travel makeup mirror. I never can find a good quality travel mirror. It would be perfect for doing makeup but the stand is made for shower installation. The heating function to defog is iffy. title: HIEEY Hollywood Vanity Mirror with 12 Dimmable Bulbs Lights , Three Color Lighting Modes, and 5X Magnification , Smart Touch Control, 360°Rotation (White,Gift Box)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Review of the HIEEY Hollywood Vanity Mirror', 'author': 'Travis J. Curnutte', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Design and BuildFirstly, the HIEEY mirror impresses with its design. The round shape and glass frame give it a sleek and modern look that complements any room decor. Its 17.3"L x 13"W dimensions make it a perfect fit for bathroom countertops or vanity tables, providing ample view for makeup application or skincare routines.Lighting and MagnificationThe standout feature of this mirror is undoubtedly its lighting capabilities. With 12 big dimmable bulbs, it offers exceptional illumination that mimics natural daylight, ensuring makeup looks flawless in any setting. The three color lighting modes—day light, cold light, and warm light—allow for versatility, catering to various needs and preferences. Moreover, the addition of a detachable 5X magnification mirror is a thoughtful touch, enabling detailed makeup applications like eyeliner or lipstick with precision.User ExperienceEase of use is where the HIEEY mirror truly shines. The smart touch control is intuitive, allowing for quick adjustments to brightness and light color with a simple tap. The 360° rotation feature is another boon, offering flexibility in angles for a comprehensive view. It\'s also worth mentioning that the mirror arrives fully assembled, ready to use right out of the box, which is a significant convenience.PerformanceUsers have lauded the HIEEY mirror for its brightness and clarity, with many noting the significant difference it makes in their makeup routine. The ability to adjust the lighting intensity means it\'s suitable for use at any time of the day, while the color temperature options help in creating looks that are consistent in various lighting environments. The magnification mirror has also received high marks for its functionality and ease of use.Value for MoneyPriced at $39.99, the HIEEY Hollywood Vanity Mirror offers excellent value. It competes with higher-end models in terms of features and performance but at a more accessible price point. The inclusion of a gift box also makes it an attractive gift option for beauty enthusiasts.Final ThoughtsThe HIEEY Hollywood Vanity Mirror is a stellar addition to any beauty routine. Its superior lighting, user-friendly design, and versatility make it a standout product. Whether you\'re a makeup aficionado or someone who appreciates the importance of good lighting, this mirror is a worthy investment that promises to enhance your beauty regimen.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE IT SO FAR', 'author': 'Esmie Bermudez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just got it today 2/03/2024 and it’s so big and pretty!! title: Portable Magnifying Mirror with Light, Travel Make up Mirror 2-Sided 1X/10X Lighted Makeup Mirror Tabletop Light up Mirror, Foldable Cosmetic LED Vanity Mirror for Makeup,Tweezing, Blackhead Removal
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works Great!', 'author': 'Donna Robertson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The mirror I was previously using was just a cheap 2 sided (1 side magnified) mirror on a stupid wire stand. The base flipped around so you could use each side, but one of the positions didn\'t sit right, so it always fell over. During one of those falls, the mirror came off of the circular frame it was on. The frame actually split in half, so I had to glue it back around the mirror. Ever since then, I\'ll tilt it up so I can see my face, look away to grab some makeup, then before id look back, it would tilt back down to where all I could see was my neck. For a while it messed with me, I would think to myself, "Was I slouching?", or "Did I move my chair forward by accident?", "Is there something haunting my mirror?", or what I finally landed on: "I must be losing my mind!". Finally I caught it move out of the corner of my eye, because I heard it squeak at the same time, which was new. I realized I must\'ve bent the metal stand somehow, but I did such a good job super glueing it all back together, there was no getting it apart. So I got an LED mirror that accordians out from the wall, cuz I always wanted one, but realized where I do my makeup, there\'s nowhere to hang it. Then I got a suction cup one that lit up, which was great, cuz it NEVER fell over, but it was only a magnifying mirror, which messed with my vision if I wasn\'t an inch away from it at all times. Then the most recent one I tried was a rectangular, LED one that didn\'t magnify, but it had a weird leatherish flap, that was almost like a cover for a tablet, that bent in weird ways to hold it vertical or horizontal. Both of which were too far back, so if I got a pillow or sat on an old-school yellow pages, I might\'ve been able to pluck my eyebrows, but that\'s about it. Plus if you accidentally nudged it, it\'d fall flat over.Mind you, in between each of these mirror fails, id keep going back to Ol\' Squeaky, propping it up with various things on my desk.But finally, FINALLY, I got this one! (*angels singing*)It has two magnifications, which is nice, it lights up with 3 different kinds of lighting options (I never know which one to use, but as long as I can see what I\'m doing). The size of the mirror is good sized, so I can see my whole face no problem . Not that I have a huge face or anything, just my OG mirror had about a 5" dia. And the most important thing, it has a nice sturdy base, So I\'d pretty much have to punch it for it to actually fall over, lmao. Oh and the button for the light is right on the base, which is nice. It\'s out of the way, so it doesn\'t get turned on by accident like the on-the-mirror buttons do. That can get pretty irritating too.But all in all, I think we finally have a winner! Woot! woot!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 10X Magnifying - Portable - Rechargeable', 'author': 'Liz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a good size travel mirror with 10X magnifying power and this ZAVAREA Portable Magnifying Mirror with Light is perfect for my needs. The mirror is 6" not including the base which is 3". It comes with a storage pouch and a 30" rechargeable cord. The mirror has 3 lighting modes with adjustable brightness. It has a swivel base that allows for multi-positioning of the mirror. The light switch is just below the non-magnified mirror, so when the mirror is turned to the 10X magnification, the light switch is on the back. The base must be repositioned when switching between mirrors. The recharging port is on the side just below the mirror and has a light that displays when charging.I\'ve had many other travel mirrors and this one is by far the best I have found. Even though I got it specifically for traveling, I like it so much that I am using it as my daily makeup mirror. I appreciate that the manufacturer stands by their product and has a "100% No-Hassle Money Back Guarantee, ensuring that if the LED mirror encounters any issues, we will provide a FULL REFUND." The only thing that would improve this mirror is if it was stored in a hard case instead of a soft pouch. Other than that, it\'s great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice, dual mirror', 'author': 'jrs', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm very picky about mirrors. I need a magnification mirror & it helps if it's lighted. So many magnified mirrors are wavy & blurry even up close. Not for me. But these 'old eyes' do need some help.This mirror has features that make it superior to most other mirrors. One side is normal focus, while the other is 10X magnification. The glass is clear & focused. The thing that makes this mirror superior is the choice of two different shades of brightness. One shade is bright white, while the other is a more softer, mellow shade - while still providing good brightness. A simple pass of your finger at the base of the holder makes these changes. I also like the handle. You can adjust it so that it slightly rests upon your chest while holding it during use.All in all, this mirror is much better than any hand mirror I've come across so far.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like this mirror it’s lightweight has a plastic base and stand. The stand does pivot all the way around so you can have it angled either on the side with the magnification, or the normal view mirror. it’s a good size mirror. It does pretty flat wind completely collapsed. Comes with its own caring bag that you can pack in your carry-on or suitcase. Easy to charge, turn on and has different shades of lighting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Travel Mirror!', 'author': 'Lynsey C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I used to pack up my $100 vanity mirror, that was so heavy with every trip to have magnification and a comfortable place to get ready, yet still see myself… until that mirror broke from the pressure of my suitcase.Well gone is my bad luck with this little guy! It arrived well packaged, in its travel bag and already charged to try out! Loved that. Pictured is the bright white, natural, and warm light as well as the cleaning cloth, travel bag, and charger. Only suggestion is watch out for the charger *possibly* scratching the mirror, once the protective film is off and stored in the same travel bag?Fantastic, handy mirror that won’t take up so much of my suitcase! Literally don’t want to put this away, when is my next trip?!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars best as a hanging mirror', 'author': 'vorpal hamster', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I like that it has a large 10x surface because I'm blind without my reading glasses. It's annoying that the on/off button for the light is only on the 1x side so I have to fish for the light switch, but it's not a huge deal. The light seems warmer than most so the 'daylight' is pretty neutral and the 'warm' is too warm. The light is also not as bright as a couple of these mirrors I've had, but that just means it isn't blinding.The only problem I've had with it is that it will not stay stood up by itself for very long. I folded out the stand and stood it on the counter with the mirror at a decent angle and an hour later it had folded back up and fallen over. The stand folds out completely to make a hanging loop, though, so I put up a command hook and hung it up. Problem solved.It takes a USB-C charge cord, of which I have thousands, and it keeps a charge. I've used it every day for a week and not had to charge it yet. It's small (about the size of my outstretched hand) and light enough to travel with and comes with a decent flocked vinyl bag to carry it in.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, works great', 'author': 'J. Silva', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This excellent motor will make skin maintenance much easier when I travel. The10x magnification side is fantastic-- you really can see areas that need attention. The mirror has a sturdy stand that folds up so it fits into a nicely made drawstring carry bag. To charge the light, just plug the USB plug into a charger - a full charge takes a couple of hours but lasts for weeks. I think this is a tad heavy for travel but my previous lighted small mirror was pretty useless so I'm willing to lug this around for the convenience of quality magnification.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very large mirror', 'author': 'Jen A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This two way portable magnifying mirror is very large. It’s too large to fit into my makeup bag, but I will take it in my next trip and see how it fares. It does have a 10x magnification on one side, which is what I need. The light is bright and allows you three different brightness settings. The stand is strong enough to use on a table top without it flipping over. The stand also doubles as a handle to use the normal side to check the back of your hair. Really nice mirror.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this mirror', 'author': 'MC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am a bit of a mirror snob, I like to have good quality HD mirrors and they are hard to find in a travel version. title: Gospire 1x/10x Magnifying Lighted Makeup Mirror Double Sided Round Standing 360 Degree Swivel Mirror for Shaving Bathroom 7 Inch Diameter
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product, especially for college students!', 'author': 'megha patel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So I bought this mirror because in a month I will be moving to college and I wouldn't have the time to buy one before moving in. I was looking for something that was relatively cheap (broke college student :) ) and had its own lights, no cord, and wasn't too big because of low lighting, limited sockets and desk space in my dorm. This mirror seemed to check all the boxes and also had the benefit of the light being on both sides of the mirror instead of just one, so I chose this. It came in one day and the mirror inside was well packaged. There was styrofoam surrounding the mirror and the box was the perfect size for the product, which was great for me because it had became so easy for me to rebox it and put it in a suitcase for college and not worry about something breaking. It was easy to screw on the base and put in the batteries, but I struggled a little closing it after putting the batteries in. Note that it does not come with batteries but it only needs AAA batteries which are easy to get. I loved that the power “button” isn’t really a button but a touch switch kinda like the home button for iphone 7 and 8, it added a little bit of a fancy feel for the mirror. Lighting is perfect, not too bright and you can dim it if needed. Sometimes when the lighting is too bright it has warped my perception of the amount of makeup on my face, but this worked well. My only issue is that there is no indicator that you have dimmed all the way, you just have to hold the button and see if the light gets any lighter. Another thing to note is that if you dim the mirror and then turn it off, it will automatically turn on as the brightest light setting. I saw this as a good thing, built it really depends on your preference and it only takes a couple seconds to dim. Overall the mirror is great, and I would 100% recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great mirror', 'author': 'Nancy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Lighted, one side regular, one side magnified. Attractive. Comes packed well so shipping is safe. Expensive but worth it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars How is this so cheap?!', 'author': 'Samantha', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Overall I am blown away by the quality of this mirror for the price. It is very heavy and stable on a surface and the light is super bright and lights up evenly and the mirrors are nice and clear and do not seem distorted at all. The mirror rotates freely to position as needed, but doesn't slip or turn out of place on its own (which has been an issue with other mirrors I've had). The switch to turn on the light is basically a touch-sensor, which was a little weird at first since there is no depress or feeling of touching a button, but I like it now because I feel like it will be more durable over time (not having to constantly push on one edge of the mirror) since you just have to tap the button lightly or gloss your fingertip over it and the light responds immediately.My only complaint is that each of the two mirror surfaces feel a little flimsy. Either the metal is very thin or its just metal coated plastic, but either way when taking the mirror surfaces apart (to put in or change the batteries) it feels very flimsy and like the whole thing could snap in half. When all is assembled though, it is sturdy and I would still 100% buy again even with this very minor complaint.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Alright', 'author': 'Alexis', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'EDITED***So they reached out to me and offered a refund which was very nice of them.A few other things, the mirror is a nice good size with good magnification for doing makeup. I also use it on my vanity and it sits at a very nice height with me sitting down.Original review***************So my sister has a ihome mirror and its amazing but I did not want to spend as much since I was buying a lot of other things at the time and didnt need the music compatibility. When I first got this, it came very well packaged and was easy to put together. The brightness was good also with brand new batteries. Unfortunately, a few issues have come up...I dont use it that much maybe 5 to 10 minutes about 4 times a week but the batteries do go down fast. After a month the light is very dim sadly, so you will use a lot of batteries. Also another very very very annoying thing is that it keeps coming apart from the base (the stand will separate from the base) the screw does not seem to be long enough and might be a little striped. I hardly move it but it does this often.So I actually wish I got the ihome and probably will in the future but for now it still works nicely as a mirror sans the light.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Light not bright', 'author': 'Traci Teichmann', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The light is not bright. Worked well for about a week. Constantly changing batteries to keep the light bright. It is lightweight so i carry it to a brighter room. Update 9/7/22, the company did reach out to me about the mirror and offered a replacement mirror. It is an 8" rechargeable mirror and the light is bright. A big improvement. I do appreciate the customer service listening to my concerns and fixing them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Light isn't very bright at all.", 'author': 'Gaylon Landers', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'good mirror and sturdy base....if light was brighter it would be perfect', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bright and Clear', 'author': 'Felicia Marie Justiniano', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This mirror is the brightest mirror I've owned. It has 10× magnification on one side, and a reg lighted mirror on the other. The charge lasts a long time and also charges quickly. There's adjustable brightness on the front of the base and a touch on off button on the back of the base. This is a very sturdy mirror- well made and substantial. I'd definitely recommend this purchase.I had purchased a different brand at 5 times the price and it wasn't as bright as this one.I can use this on my vanity or nightstand and the base is small enough in circumference to also fit on my 3 inch windowsill. I'm looking forward to new product development from Gospire. Great purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Doesn’t last', 'author': 'JoAnn', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Nice mirror but it didn’t last a full year. title: Makeup Mirror with Lights, 2-Sided Vanity Mirror with 1X/10X Magnification Rechargeable 3 in 1 Hand Held Desk and Hanging Lighted Mirror 3 Colors Lighting Stepless Dimming for Home
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I’ve been looking for this for years!', 'author': 'sweetpeamama', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love to travel, but the thing I miss the most from home (besides my pets), is my vanity mirror, a lighted, 2-sided 1x on one side, full 10x on the other on a decent height stand. Putting my makeup on is so much more of a chore on vacation! I’d bring my mirror from home if I had the room!I have bought numerous travel mirrors over the years and here are all the downsides: too small, too dim (or no lighting at all), uses batteries that I’m afraid will die on the trip, doesn’t stand up at a good height. And what’s up with the 1x only mirrors (unless you want one of those stupid, tiny round stick-on 10x mirrors to put on the corner of the 1x mirror? I am 49 and need a ton of magnification to put on mascara and make sure my foundation and concealer are blended properly.I just received this today, so I haven’t used it yet but am already so excited I have to share!1) It’s solid and can be used as a handheld or with a decent built-in stand that can be moved in many angles. It feels like the joints are properly tight but flexible enough to move. Hope this continues.2)The mirror itself is an impressive diameter for a travel-size so I can comfortably see what I need to3)Full 1x on one side and FULL 10x on the reverse side!!!! Thank you!!4)What seems to be nice bright lighting visible on both sides5)Comes with a USB cable for charging (but not a power box)6)Comes with a protective bag for travel7)Space-saving size for packing considering all that this mirror can doI can’t wait to try this mirror out on my next trip!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars portable LED make up mirror', 'author': 'Vivian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "OMG I love this mirror. because it can be folded And the size is suitable too With three lighting effects Really friendly for people who need makeup. There was a discount when I bought it I think it's really worth the money. Plus, I really like that it comes with a bag and lens cleaning cloth. It’s so thoughtful for a beauty who loves to be clean. Finally, I sincerely recommend everyone to buy it", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love love', 'author': 'shawn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My grand daughter love this', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it', 'author': 'Vivian', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Three adjustable lighting back 10x mirrors are especially suitable for eyebrow repair', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect makeup mirror', 'author': 'The Dude Abides', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My daughter is 11, going on 18 and has gotten into skincare and beauty products. Her bedroom isn't very big, so it'd be hard to fit a vanity in there, so we were on the hunt for a mirror for her. This one has several light settings - very bright and it dims from there.
